I stole the draper's tinderbox so the vengeful farmhand could set fire to his former employer's farm and then plant it there as evidence the draper did it.
我偷了布商的打火盒，好让复仇心切的农场工人点着了他前雇主的农场，然后把打火盒放在那里做证据，栽赃给布商。
The farmhand wants me to help him get revenge on the draper by stealing a tinderbox he always carries with him.
农场工人想让我报复布商，偷走他随身携带的打火盒。
I brought the stolen tinderbox to the farmhand. I was curious how it would end up, but I didn't want to be around when things got hot - in more ways than one.
我把偷来的打火盒交给了农场工人。我很好奇这事会怎么结局，但是事情发展得白热化的时候我可不想留在附近了——各种意义上的白热化。
I should bring the stolen tinderbox to the vengeful farmhand.
我应该把打火盒交给复仇心切的农场工人。
My efforts were futile and the charlatan has gone to meet his Maker. Let's hope He will be more forgiving that the citizens here.
我无力挽救，骗子已经去见上帝了。但愿上帝会比这些被骗的人待他宽容一些。

The old whore bartered the only warm piece of clothing she had, a woollen shawl, for a bite to eat. Then she regretted it and wanted it back. So I stole it for her - the village woman doesn't need it as much as she does.
老妓女通过她最后一件厚衣裳，一个羊绒披肩，换了食物。现在她后悔了想要回来。所以我为她偷了为了——那个村姑并没有那么需要它。
The old whore from the Inn in the Glade wants me to steal her woollen shawl back from a village woman she gave it to in exchange for food.
那个林中小店的老妓女想要我为她从村姑手上偷到她换了食物的羊毛披肩。
I brought the woollen shawl back to its original owner.
我把羊毛披肩带回给了它原本的主人。
I've got the shawl. Now to bring it back to the old whore at the Inn in the Glade.
我拿到披肩了。现在我要把它带回给林间旅店的老妓女。
Since the last inhabitant of Rovna is no longer among the living, there's no point in bringing a priest there. No one will be returning to Rovna for some time now.
既然罗维那的最后的一个居民已经死了，那再找一个牧师就没有必要了。没有人会回到罗维那了。
Along with the parish priest, hope died that the former Rovna inhabitants would soon return to their homes.
和那个教区神父一样，希望罗维那居民回来的希望没了。
It would be best if I show up at the building site during the day when everyone is there, otherwise I'll have a hell of a job finding him.
我最好在白天大家上岗工作时去建筑工地，不然我踏破铁鞋也找不到他。
The librarian told me the page I found is from a book he's been missing.
图书管理员告诉我找到的这页是来自于他丢的一本书里的。
I found a page torn from a book. I should ask the librarian about it.
我找到了从书中撕下来的一页。我该问问图书管理员这事。

I joined Captain Robard's company, which was trying to invade the camp at the point through which I'd made my escape from captivity before. Even though we were spotted trying to sneak in through the rear, we managed to fight our way inside.
我加入了罗巴德长官的军队，尝试从我脱离虎口的地方进攻敌营。我们成功闯进了营地，以支援主力部队。就算我们在从后方闯入营地的过程中被发现了，我们还是在其中杀出了一条血路。
I joined the raiding party trying to sneak into the camp from the rear, but we were spotted. We've got to shoot down the bandits to get inside.
我加入了后方偷袭营地的小队，但我们被发现了。我们得把那些土匪干掉才能突入营地。

After long-lasting preparations, we finally sieged Vranik. The foe refused to surrender to us, so we had to resort to force. The battle began! We aimed the main attack at the gate, which finally fell, and we succeeded in breaking into the camp. Our fire arrows brought terrifying chaos, the flames swallowed up the tents and forged panic amongst the enemy.
在漫长的备战工作后，我们终于发起了弗兰尼克围攻战。敌军不肯投降，所以我们只能采取暴力手段歼灭他们。战斗打响了！我们集中兵力攻打大门，最终将其突破，杀进了敌方大营。我们的火箭使敌人陷入混乱，吞噬营帐的火焰给敌人造成了极大的恐惧。
The battle has begun! First we have to get inside the camp. I can wait until they break down the gate, or try my luck on the scaling ladders.
战斗打响了！我们先要杀入敌营。我可以在他们突破大门之前待命，或者爬云梯试试运气。

We had to secure the burnt ground in the middle of the encampment and crush the enemy who were lurking there, waiting to attack us from the rear. In the end we succeeded and were left facing one last obstacle - another gate.
我们得守卫营地中央的火场，击败妄图从背后偷袭我们的敌人。我们成功了，摆在我们眼前的只剩下最后一道大门。
We've got to secure the burnt ground, so the foe can't attack us from the rear across it.
我们要守卫火场，以防敌人从后方偷袭。

Behind the second gate the last group of bandits made a futile attempt to resist. We beat them, but Istvan and Erik were not among them. We'd won the day, but those vipers had slipped from our grasp once more.
第二道大门后龟缩的土匪们无力抵抗我们的进攻。我们把他们一举歼灭了，但伊斯特万和厄里克并不在他们之中。暂时取胜的我们，又一次让这条毒蛇从眼皮底下溜走了。
Here we are! Istvan and Erik must be among the last few defenders. I can't wait to see the look on his face when I take back my sword from the bastard!
我们来了！伊斯特万和厄里克肯定就在这最后的残余势力之中。我已经迫不及待要看他那张狼狈不堪的脸，并从这个混蛋那里夺回我的宝剑了！

Lady Stephanie wanted me to bring her a keg of the best wine in the region from the merchant Konrad Hagen, but he'd already donated his last keg as first prize in an archery contest. Not that that was a problem, what with my archery skills. I won the contest and the keg of wine.
斯蒂芬妮女士要我帮她从附近的商人康拉德哈根那带一桶最好的葡萄酒，但他已经把最后一桶酒赠作箭术比赛的头等奖品了。但那并不成问题，我用我的箭术赢得了比赛和那桶酒。
Getting the wine won't be so easy after all. The last good keg was donated to the archery tournament as first prize.
毕竟想弄到葡萄酒不容易。最后一桶好酒被赠作箭术比赛的头等奖品了。

Lady Stephanie wanted me to bring her a keg of the best wine in the region from the merchant Konrad Hagen, but he'd already donated his last keg as first prize in an archery contest. Not that that was a problem. I managed to get the wine another way. I can't be bothered with archery anyway.
斯蒂芬妮女士要我帮她从附近的商人康拉德哈根那带一桶最好的葡萄酒，但他已经把最后一桶酒赠作箭术比赛的头等奖品了。但那并不成问题。我用别的办法弄到了葡萄酒。毕竟我不想在箭术上费功夫。
Damned tournament! I'm sure the others cheated. And there was a tricky wind! The bow I had wasn't worth a damn either. Well, I'll just have to get the wine some other way. Now, who was it who won it?
该死的比赛！我能肯定有人作弊了。还有那棘手的风！我拿的弓也烂的不行。看来我只能想想别的办法来弄到葡萄酒了。好了，是谁赢了来着？
I have everything Lady Stephanie wanted from me. I should bring it all to her in time for her cousin's wedding.
斯蒂芬妮女士需要的我都弄到了。我得及时给她带过去准备婚礼。
Once I had everything needed for the new herbarium, I gave it all to Brother Nicodemus. He was delighted, gave me a small reward and started scraping the ink of the book at once.
我找到他需要的所有东西之后就把他们都给尼可丹姆斯修士了。他很高兴，给我一小笔奖赏之后就开始擦除书上的字迹。
Now I've got all the herbs and an old book, I only have to take them to Brother Nicodemus.
现在我有所有的草药和旧书了，现在我回去找尼可丹姆斯就行了。
I met a wayfarer who spotted Pie. That skittish creature was galloping upstream along the creek a little to the south.
我碰到了看到过阿派的路人，那个家伙曾沿着小溪上游向南奔驰。

As soon as I mounted Pie, I saw he was a damned fine steed. So I thought, what if I don't take him back? The poor animal can't even get up a proper gallop at the stables. No doubt that's why he bolted when he had the chance. He'll be much better off with me.
当我骑上了阿派，我发现他真是匹好马。所以我想啊，我可以不可以不把他带回去？这可怜的家伙在马厩里都不能活动开来。这绝对就是他跑掉的的原因。他跟着我肯定会更好。
I already brought some meat, but it seems a soldier's belly is never full. It won't hurt to bring some more.
我已经带来了些肉，但是貌似还不是很够。再多带来些就更好了。

The old whore used the dagger I stole for her to slit her former husband's throat! She killed his new wife too, ransacked the house and vanished. Maybe I should think things through before doing what people ask.
那个老妓女用我偷的匕首切开了她前夫的脖子！她杀了他的新妻子，洗劫了房子然后消失了。可能我应该在帮人做事之前仔细想一想。

Helping the Vicar wasn't as straightforward as I'd hoped. He sent me right away to find the assembly place of the Waldensian heretics, which was no easy matter, since all he gave me to go on was the testimony under torture of a heretic taken prisoner in Kuttenberg. The poor wretch was evidently in a delirium from his suffering and his description of the route to the Waldensian's meeting place resembled more a passage from the Book of Revelations.
帮助代理牧师并没有我原想的那么简单。他只给了我一份用酷刑逼供一个异教徒囚犯说出来的证词就立刻派我去寻找瓦勒度派异教徒的聚集地，这可不容易。那个可怜的家伙显然因折磨陷入精神错乱之中，而他对瓦勒度派聚集地的描述却更像是从启示录里摘出来的一样。

Sir Hanush charged me with getting the Vicar off his back. Not that I can just ask the Monsignor to be on his way - I'll have to help him with his mission. Once he finds out there's nothing going on in Uzhitz, he'll be on his way and everyone will be happy.
瀚纳仕大人派我去解决代理牧师这个麻烦。我可不能就喊蒙席直接上路——我只能协助他完成他的使命。只要他发现乌兹茨这什么都没有，他便会离开，皆大欢喜。
Not only did someone try to kill me, but apparently the ground has swallowed up Leshek and Zmola.
不仅有人想要刺杀我，雷士克和莫拉也人间蒸发了。
I didn't find the would-be killer. I should at least look for Zmola and Leshek.
我没找到刺客。至少先要把莫拉和雷士克找来。
We succeeded! We charged part of Medek's force, which was trying to flank the Talmbergers. The creek ran red with their blood.
我们成功了！我们击退了偷袭塔尔木堡士兵的梅德科部队。他们的血把河道染得鲜红。
And now for the charge! We must take advantage of the moment of surprise and destroy them quickly! They mustn't cross the ford!
现在进攻！我们必须要打他们个措手不及，将敌人迅速一网打尽！他们不能跨过浅滩！
Istvan's reinforcements broke through the blockade on the bridge at the last moment, seriously threatening Sir Divish's force. But we crushed them - we won the battle for the province!
伊斯特万的支援最终突破了桥上的防线，对戴卫斯的部队造成了严重威胁。但是我们消灭了他们的主力部队，为整个战区赢得了一场胜利！
The foe has broken through the blockade on the bridge. If I don't help Captain Robard and his men right now, they'll be slaughtered!
敌人突破了桥上的防线。如果我现在不出手营救罗巴德长官的部队，他们会被全歼的！

Just as Sir Divish planned, we stayed out of sight and let the attacking reinforcements pass in the direction of Captain Robard and his men, who are ready to face them. They didn't see us - the trap is set!
一切就按戴卫斯大人的计划进行，我们躲到了敌军视野以外，让敌方援军向罗巴德长官的部队方向进军。罗巴德长官已经准备好迎敌了。敌人没有发现我们-他们已然自投罗网！

The moment of truth is here! If we fail to hold the line and beat the foe's reinforcements, the whole province will be lost! First I have to let the attackers engage with Sir Divish's men, so we can storm them from the flank when the moment is right.
把握关键时刻！如果我们没能守住防线，让敌人的援军突破过去，整片战区就会沦陷！首先，我们得先让敌人和戴卫斯大人的兵交上火，然后再把握时机，从侧翼打他们个措手不及。
I found quite a stock of game in the cellar of the Inn in the Glade. There was no doubt about how it got there - I just had to persuade the innkeeper to tell me what the source was.
我在林间酒馆的酒窖里找到了很多猎物。它们是怎么到那里的当然毫无疑问——我只需要说服酒馆掌柜告诉我来源就好了。

Done! By Christ, we won the day! Istvan had no choice but to accept a deal to save his own skin. But to my utter disgust and dismay, he made the most of his advantage. He released Lady Stephanie in exchange for Erik, but he refused to let my father go! He took him with him as a hostage in case anyone tried to stop him and promised to release him when he reached Skalitz. The slimy toad! Unfortunately, no one heeded my protests.
感谢上帝，我们今天胜利了！伊斯特万除了接受条件自保以外，别无选择。但让我恶心的是，他充分地利用了他的价码。他用斯蒂芬妮夫人作为筹码换回了埃里克，但他拒绝释放我父亲！他把父亲作为人质带走，以防止任何人阻止他撤离，但他承诺会在他到斯卡里茨的时候把父亲给放了。恶心的老蛤！不幸的是，并没有人关心我的意见。
We haven't won the day yet, because Istvan has dragged Lady Stephanie up to the north-eastern tower. I must rescue her!
仗还没有结束，因为伊斯特万把斯蒂芬妮夫人拖到了东北塔楼。我必须解救她！
Theresa - she's really got something special about her. I really have been looking forward to seeing her. Better not rush things though.
特丽莎-真是个魅力十足的姑娘。我已经迫不及待与她再次相见了。最好不要太心急了。
I got everything I needed. But now the hardest part awaited me.
我已经找到了我需要的东西，接下来却是最难的部分了。
I've been discovered. I'll have to go away for a while and try again later.
我被发现了。我必须先逃走下次再找机会重来。
I searched the assembly place from top to bottom and eventually found something that could be a useful clue - an ornamental wooden cross.
我把这到处都翻遍了，最终找到了一个有用的线索—一个有装饰的木制十字架。
I'll have to have a good look around the assembly place and see if I can find any clues.
我得好好在这聚集地瞧瞧，看能不能找到一些线索。
Pious is dead... if it was him.
派阿斯已经被除掉了……如果那果真是他的话。
I'm supposed to kill Pious. I don't know yet which one of the novices he is, but once I find out, he's dead.
我应该去杀掉派阿斯。我还没从学徒中把他分辨出来，但一旦我有头绪了，他立马就会下地狱。
I had to pick up a roan from Uzhitz for Lady Stephanie. It wasn't easy getting that stubborn beast to the Talmberg stables.
我在乌兹茨为斯蒂芬妮夫人选了匹马。把这个倔东西带回塔尔木堡的马厩可不是什么容易的事情。
I talked to everyone who was interested in a job, but I wasn't sure which of them to choose.
我和对工作感兴趣的人谈过了，但我不确定选谁才好。
I should talk to the Skalitz refugees who are interested in jobs.
我应该找对工作感兴趣的斯卡里茨难民们谈一谈。
I found Father Francis in Sasau. He told me he has no plans to return to his parish. All I had to do was bring the news to Agnes.
我在莎邵找到了弗朗西斯神父。他告诉我并没有回教区的打算。我只需要把这个消息告诉阿格尼斯。
Agnes the cook is a very stubborn woman, who won't be easily persuaded. Maybe if I find Father Francis and talk to him, it'll be easier to convince her.
厨师阿格尼斯是个固执的女人，嘴皮子磨烂了都雷打不动。如果我能找到弗朗西斯神父和他谈谈，这样更有可能说服她。
Agnes was sorry her time with Father Francis was over, but she agreed to go and work as a cook for Konrad Hagen.
不能再服侍弗朗西斯神父的阿格尼斯对此感到很伤感，但她已经答应了成为康拉德·哈根的厨师。
It's enough to tell Agnes what I found out from Father Francis and she'll surely take the job with Hagen.
只要把我从弗朗西斯神父那里得到的信息告诉阿格尼斯，就能够说动她为哈根工作了。

Ulrich revealed to me where he buried the body of the merchant Menhart. If I take the path northwards from the crossroads where the wagon was ambushed, after a while I'll reach the ruins of a cottage. Menhart is buried somewhere behind it.
伍尔里希向我透露了他掩埋商人门哈特的尸体的地方。如果我从被伏击的十字路口向北走，不出一会儿我就会到达一个小屋的废墟。 门哈特被埋在它的后面。
I told Captain Robard about the robbery. Fritz and Matthew have been a thorn in my side anyway, ever since their stupid dung-throwing caper!
我把抢劫的事情告诉了罗巴德队长。反正弗利兹和马修对我而言一直都很棘手，从他们开那个愚蠢的扔粪玩笑的时候就是这样了！
Andrew thinks the whole quarry robbery idea is horseshit. Instead of helping the lads, he reckons I should report the plan to Captain Robard.
安德鲁觉得这个采石场抢劫的主意就是胡扯。他觉得不该帮助那些小伙子们，而是应该让我向罗巴德队长报告这个计划。
Fritz and Mathew are dead. Those fools attacked the whole armed escort! What in God's name were they thinking of?
弗利兹和马修死了。这些傻子居然去袭击了一整队武装护卫！天啊，他们到底在想什么啊？
I'd better go and see what's going on with this whole business. Matthew was planning to steal the quarrymen's wages five days after we talked in the tavern.
我最好去把整件事的来龙去脉搞清楚。我们在酒馆交谈五天之后，马修计划去偷矿工的薪水。
I snitched on Andrew to Matthew, who didn't take it too well...
我把安德鲁的计划透露给了马修，后者听了之后可不太高兴。
Maybe instead of heeding Andrew, I should warn Matthew about his treacherous intentions.
也许比起听从安德鲁，我应该把他的背叛之意告诉马修。
Andrew says his door will always be open to me from now on, the damn scoundrel!
安德鲁说他的大门从此对我敞开，这混蛋！
I have to tell Andrew his plan worked out and the lads are dead.
我得告诉安德鲁他的计划成功了，那些小伙子们死了。
Fortunately, I know that the Skalitz Parish Priest has been hiding out in the Sasau Wagoner's Inn since the raid. I should go there and talk him into returning to St. James.
幸运的是，我知道找斯卡里茨的牧师自从被袭击了就躲在莎邵驿站的旅馆里。我应该去那里找他然后让他回到圣詹姆斯。
I gave Theresa the nails and got back to forging with Father.
我把钉子交给特丽莎，然后回去和父亲一起打铁了。
I easily found the nails. Now to bring them to Theresa.
我很容易就找到了钉子。现在把它们交给特丽莎。
Jezhek of Ronow told me lots of useful things when questioned, which I then recounted to Sir Radzig.
罗诺福的杰西克被问时和我讲了很多有用的事情，我随后向拉德季阁下复述。
Sir Jezhek of Ronow told me a lot of useful things. I should report it all to Sir Radzig.
杰西克阁下告诉我了很多有用的信息。我应该上报给拉德季阁下。
The coin is at the quarry. Now just to get hold of it...
钱在采石场里。现在只需要去弄到手了……
I managed to heal Daniel, the delirious man from Merhojed.
我成功治愈了丹尼尔，那位神志不清的莫霍杰德人。
I shot down the branch. Now to get it, quick, before someone else takes it!
我射掉了树上的枝条。现在，在没人捡起来之前赶紧拿上。
Now just to bring the necklace back to Lukesh.
现在只要把项链带回给鲁克斯就好了。
I managed to heal Straw's wife.
我成功治疗了斯特劳的老婆。
Straw's wife died. There was nothing I could do for her.
斯特劳的老婆死了。我无计可施。
I promised old Straw I'd heal his wife.
我答应斯特劳会治疗他的老婆。
Sir Divish and Master Feyfar now have at their disposal the best engineer in the kingdom, if not in the whole Empire. The trebuchet should be built in a few days.
戴卫斯大人和费法尔大师有了全国最好的工程师的协助，投石机应该在几天内就造好了。
The trebuchet should be finished by now. I must go and see it being tested!
投石机现在应该造好了。我要去看看建完后的测试！
I promised Fritz and Matthew I'd try to get them jobs. Maybe I should try asking around the mills? Or I could ask the lads who they think might help.
我答应弗利兹和马修要试着给他们找工作。也许我应该去磨坊附近看看？或者我可以问问他们俩觉得该去找谁。
The debt I owed to the apothecary for the treatment he gave me while I was unconscious is finally paid.
我因为草药师的治疗而欠下的债终于还清了。
I ran up a bill with the apothecary while I was unconscious. I have to pay him 50 Groschen.
我还昏迷的时候欠了草药师一笔钱。我得付给他50格罗申。
I've got to get the bottom of this. Fritz mentioned some fight. A fight in the monastery?!
我得把这件事查个水落石出。弗利兹提到了打架。在修道院里打架？！
Lucas was greatly relieved when I told him I'd talked to the Circators and they'd agreed to leave him alone. He's happy he'll finally be able to lead a normal life in the monastery.
当我告诉卢卡斯我已经跟巡查长们谈过了，他们同意放他一马时，他松了一大口气。他很高兴终于能在修道院里普通的生活了。
There's nothing I can do to help Novice Lucas now.
我现在没什么能帮助卢卡斯的。
I talked to the Circators. They shouldn't be bothering Novice Lucas any more.
我和巡查长们谈了。他们应该不会再打搅学徒卢卡斯了。
I haven't spoken to Matthew yet. I should talk to him.
我还没跟马修说过话呢，我应该过去跟他聊聊。
I haven't spoken to Fritz yet. I should go and have a... scholarly debate with him about the meaning of life.
我还没跟弗利兹说过话呢，我应该过去跟他……进行一场有关人生的意义的学术辩论。
It looks like the lads aren't doing too well. Thomas the overseer is on their backs and keeps bothering them. They asked me if I could do something to sort it out.
看起来他俩过得不太好。监工托马斯一直纠缠着烦他们。他们问我能不能帮忙解决一下这事。
Christ! I totally forgot about Fritz and Matthew. Oh well, they're big enough to take care of themselves... I suppose.
天啊！我把弗利兹和马修忘了个干净！不过他们也不是小孩子了，可以自己照顾自己了……大概吧。
I went to see if Thomas would listen to reason.
我去找了托马斯，看他能不能听进去道理。
I should go and see Thomas the foreman and try reasoning with him.
我应该去见见工头托马斯，试着跟他讲道理。
The Captain sent me to scout out the northern farm.
队长让我去侦查北部的农场。
Captain Bernard sent to to go and take a look at the raided farm to the south.
巴纳德队长让我去南边看一下被袭击过的农场。
Don't forget to come in the evening with your mates. You don't want to miss the fight with Thomas.
别忘了晚上和你的伙伴们回来。不要错过跟托马斯的约架。
We went in the evening to the arranged place for the fight and after a while we were brawling with the foreman.
我们晚上去了约架的地点，过了一会儿我们就和工头打起来了。
Give Thomas a bloody good thrashing!
Don't forget to come in the evening with your mates. You don't want to miss the fight with Thomas.
别忘了晚上和你的伙伴们回来。不要错过跟托马斯的约架。
Matthew was very happy with the way I settled things with Thomas.
马修对我解决托马斯的事情的方式很满意。
I have to tell Matthew I managed to persuade Thomas.
我得告诉马修我设法说服了托马斯。
Matthew was delighted with the way I settled things with Thomas.
马修对我解决托马斯的事情的方式很满意。
I have to tell Matthew I managed to persuade Thomas.
我得告诉马修我设法说服了托马斯。
I managed to arrange a fight with Thomas to settle things. I told Fritz and as I anticipated, he was delighted at the prospect of a punch-up.
我设法跟托马斯约了一架，好解决问题。我告诉了弗利兹，正像我猜的那样，他听说能打架，开心极了。
I managed to arrange a fight with Thomas to settle things. I should tell Fritz. No doubt he'll be delighted at the prospect of a punch-up.
我设法跟托马斯约了一架，好解决问题。我该去告诉弗利兹，他肯定会因为能打上一架而开心的。

I made sure Thomas went the other night to a neighbouring mill to play dice. Only he never got further than the middle of the woods. He got a few fives though - right in the teeth! I told Fritz and of course it put a smile on his ugly mug.
前几天晚上我让托马斯去了附近的一个磨坊里玩骰子。只不过他没能走出森林。他牙上被打了几拳！我告诉了弗利兹，然后他的丑脸上挂上了笑容。

I made sure Thomas will go in the evening to a neighbouring mill to play dice. Only what he doesn't know is he won't get further than the middle of the woods. Now to get quickly to Fritz and tell him, so we can get ready to dice with Thomas and throw him a few fives - right in the face!
我让托马斯晚上去附近的一个磨坊里玩骰子。只不过他不知道，他这晚上根本走不出森林了。现在我要快点去告诉弗利兹，这样我们就可以去往托马斯脸上揍几拳了！
As I expected, my mates weren't too happy about how my fight with Thomas turned out. I'll have to find some other way to settle things.
就像我预料的，我的伙计们对我和托马斯打架的结果不太高兴。我得找个别的办法来解决问题了。
That fight with Thomas didn't turn out as expected. I'd better tell the lads. They won't be happy about it.
和托马斯打架的结果没那么理想。我应该告诉伙计们。他们可不会开心的。
As I expected, my mates weren't too happy about how my fight with Thomas turned out. It seemed I'd have to find some other way to settle things.
就像我预料的，我的伙计们对我和托马斯打架的结果不太高兴。看起来我得找个别的办法来解决问题了。
That fight with Thomas didn't turn out as expected. I'd better tell the lads. They won't be happy about it.
和托马斯打架的结果没那么理想。我应该告诉伙计们。他们可不会开心的。
I've paid back Miller Peshek for the treatment I got while lying unconscious.
我已经把昏迷不醒时欠磨坊主皮社科的治疗费还清了。

Rattay Miller Peshek took care of me when I was wounded and unconscious. It seems it cost an arm and a leg, but Peshek will be happy if I perform a simple task for him in return. Otherwise, he'll want coin.
拉泰的磨坊主皮社科在我失去意识的时候照顾了我，那似乎是一笔不小的支出。但是皮社科说如果我能帮他完成一件简单的任务也可以还债。如果我不干，我就需要还他钱。
I'm not one to cheat on a lifelong friend, so I gave Matthew a fair share of the loot.
我不会背叛我终身的朋友，所以我给了马修合理的分成。
Matthew didn't do much to help me steal the quarrymen's wages, so I figured he didn't deserve a share.
马修在我偷采石工的薪水的时候可没帮上什么忙，所以我觉得他不该拿分成。
I should pay Matthew his fair share of the stolen coin. Best to meet him in the Inn in the Glade.
我应该把马修的分成给他。我最好去林间酒馆找他。

After talking to Farmer Bauer, I arrived at an unpleasant conclusion - the only way the Bauers could be safe was if the Vicar departed from this world. I didn't relish the task, but that man would have tortured the whole family and burned them at the stake. Let him discuss the rights and wrongs of it with St. Peter...
跟农夫鲍尔交谈后，我得出了一个不妙的结论——唯一能保住鲍尔一家的方式就是让代理牧师从这个世界消失。我并不喜欢这个任务，但是那人会折磨这整个家庭并把他们送上火刑架。让他和圣彼得去讨论这事的对和错去吧。
After talking to Farmer Bauer, I arrived at an unpleasant conclusion - the only way the Bauers could be safe was if the Vicar met with an accident.
跟鲍尔农夫交谈后，我得出了一个不妙的结论——唯一能保住鲍尔一家的方式就是让代理牧师出意外。
I told Sir Hanush what went down in Uzhitz and he seemed pleased with the outcome. He was rid of the Vicar and that's what he wanted most of all. And I was suitably rewarded for my efforts.
我告诉瀚纳仕大人了发生在乌兹茨的事，他看起来对结果很满意。毕竟他最想要的就是保妥代理牧师。我相应的被奖赏了。

There was no avoiding it, I couldn't lie - I had to go to Rattay and report what had happened in Uzhitz. Sir Hanush nearly jumped out of his skin when he heard what I did. Hopefully he'll understand why when he's cooled down and won't send me to the pyre!
这件事情没法避免，我不能撒谎——我得回拉泰然后报告乌兹茨发生的事情。当瀚纳仕大人听到我得汇报后他差点吓死。希望他能冷静下来后不要把我送去火葬场！
Esther's life was hanging by a thread since those bastards abducted here. And sadly the thread finally broke and Esther died. My efforts to rescue her came to nothing.
自从被那些绑匪绑架到这里，伊丝特尔便命悬一线。可惜她最终没能撑住，还是遇难了。我的营救行动失败了。

I had to got to Rattay and report the Vicar's death to Sir Hanush. I knew he wouldn't be happy about it, so I made up a story. I'm not sure whether he was entirely convinced, but I still have my head on my shoulders, so at least he gave me the benefit of the doubt.
我回到了拉泰向瀚纳仕大人报告了代理牧师的死亡。我知道这件事情不会让他高兴，所以我就编了一个故事。我不能确定他到底信了多少，但至少我头还挂在脖子上，所以他还是放过我了。

My return from Uzhitz was none too cheerful. I knew the Vicar wouldn't give up his mission and there was nothing I could do to prevent him. Sir Hanush wasn't happy - he was hoping I'd come back with the news that the Vicar would finally be out of his hair.
我从乌兹茨的归来并不令人满意。我知道代理牧师不会放弃他的任务，而我没有办法阻止他。瀚纳仕大人并不高兴——他期望的是我能带给他代理牧师离开他领地的消息。

It was quite a job following the trail from the hunters' shelter, but it was worth it. To the north, not far from the last trace of blood, I got a view of Wolflin's camp, concealed in a little valley on the bank of a stream.
一路追踪到猎人们的藏身处并不是轻松的活儿，但是我的努力是值得的。在北边，离最后一块血迹不远的地方，我看到了坐落在小溪谷里的沃尔弗林的营地。
I should try and follow the trail of the wounded bandits. They start by the hunters' shelter in the woods.
我应该试着跟随受伤的匪徒们的踪迹。他们是从猎人们的林中小屋出发的。
The locals told me I should ask Father Godwin about the cross.
当地人告诉我应该去问问古德温神父有关十字架的事。

I immediately reported my findings to the Vicar, who was clearly pleased that the heretics in Uzhitz had been tracked down so quickly and he could take them to Kuttenberg to stand trial. He thanked me and rewarded me for my services to Holy Mother Church.
我马上向代理牧师报告了我的发现。他很高兴这么快就能追踪到乌兹茨的异教徒并要抓他们去库滕堡接受审判。他感谢并奖赏了我对教会的付出。

I didn't have the heart to turn in the Bauers, so instead I made the excuse to the Vicar that I'd heard nothing out of the ordinary. But that didn't allay his suspicions and there was nothing more I could do.
我不忍心告发鲍尔家，所以我便告诉代理牧师没有听到任何奇怪的言论的解释。但这并不符合他的猜测，我已经别无他法了。
I have to get hold of three Cuman helmets. The important thing is they have to have visors that cover the whole face.
我需要得到三个库曼人的头盔。重要的是它们得有能遮住整张脸的面罩。
I've got to get hold of three Cuman suits of armour.
我需要得到三套库曼人的盔甲。
I've heard that Bran the charcoal-burner often talks about Cumans.
我听说烧炭工布兰经常说起库曼人。
Someone heard some stories about Cumans from Olena, the wife of the Talmberg fisherman.
有些人从塔尔木堡的渔夫的妻子奥莱娜那里听到过库曼人的故事。
Vashek, a young stableboy from Uzhitz, apparently knows something about the Cumans too.
瓦舍克，一个来自乌兹茨的马童，很显然也知道有关库曼人的事。
Now I'm all square with Peshek, he confided in me that he'd be willing to buy stolen goods from me from time to time.
现在我欠皮社科的债务都一笔勾销了，皮社科悄悄告诉我他很乐意时不时从我这里买点赃物。
Miller Peshek paid the apothecary 50 Groschen to treat me while I was unconscious. He wants me to pay the debt off by doing him a service.
磨坊主皮社科在我昏迷的时候帮我付了草药的钱，一共50格罗申。他想让我通过帮他做点事来偿还。
Bran has been regaling the local maids with tales of fierce Cumans wearing raven feathers. Where can I find some?
布兰一直在跟姑娘们讲可怕的身披乌鸦羽毛的库曼人的故事。我去哪儿能找到乌鸦羽毛呢？
I found Elijah and talked to him about his father wanting to disinherit him.
我找到了伊利亚并告诉了他关于他父亲想剥夺他的继承权。

It occurred to us that if the executioner's oil for setting the pyre ablaze were to be diluted with water, he wouldn't even be able to get the fire started. So I poured so much water into the oil that it was more suitable for drinking than for starting a fire.
我们认为刽子手用来点燃柴火的油一旦掺了水，他便无法点燃柴火。所以我往油里倒了足够多的水，以至于油变成了饮用水，根本点不着任何东西。

It occurred to us that if the executioner's oil for setting the pyre ablaze were to be diluted with water, he wouldn't even be able to get the fire started. Unfortunately, I was spotted trying to dilute the oil and now the executioner will be on his guard. That's not good.
我们认为刽子手用来点燃柴火的油一旦掺了水，他便无法点燃柴火。不巧的是，在给油掺水的过程中，我不小心暴露了，现在刽子手提高警惕了。情况不妙。
If I water down the executioner's oil, he'll be hard put to light the pyre under the convict at all.
如果我往刽子手的油里掺了水，他便无法点燃罪犯身下的柴火堆。

There's a rule that if the executioner fails to kill a condemned man by hanging at the first attempt, he has to let him go. And that would make the Kuttenberg executioner very unpopular. So I switched his rope for an old one that certainly wouldn't bear the weight of a grown man.
如果刽子手没能第一时间绞死罪犯，按照行当的规矩，他只能放走罪犯。这样就能让库滕堡刽子手名声扫地。所以我试图将他的绳子掉包成一根无法承受成年人重量的旧绳子。

There's a rule that if the executioner fails to kill a condemned man by hanging at the first attempt, he has to let him go. And that would make the Kuttenberg executioner very unpopular. So I tried to switch his rope for an old one that wouldn't bear the weight of a grown man. Only I wasn't careful enough and the game's up. I failed to sabotage the hanging.
如果刽子手没能第一时间绞死罪犯，按照行当的规矩，他只能放走罪犯。这样就能让库滕堡刽子手名声扫地。所以我试图将他的绳子掉包成一根无法承受成年人重量的旧绳子。只是我行事过于草率，事情败露了，无法对绞刑搞破坏了。
If the rope breaks under the weight of the hanged man, the executioner will have to release him. And that would disgrace him.
如果绞刑用的绳子没能承受住犯人的重量断掉了，刽子手只能放走犯人。这会令刽子手名声扫地。

I gave some attention to the executioner's sword and it's certainly far from sharp. Beheading a condemned man with one blow of a sword is the executioner's pride, but with this blunt thing he'd hardly chop the head off a chicken.
我对刽子手的剑动了手脚，它绝对不如从前那般锋利了。刽子手最引以为豪的便是一剑将犯人斩首，但他的这把钝剑连鸡的头都砍不下来。
Damn it! I was seen with the executioner's sword. Now he'll surely check it before the execution and make sure it's sharp.
该死！我在对刽子手的剑下手的时候被发现了。这下他肯定会在处刑开始前检查剑刃，确保它是锋利的。
Chopping someone's head off with a blunt sword won't be easy. Just the thing!
用钝剑砍头可不是件易事。这便是突破口！
I managed to poison the instruments of torture, so the convict will die quickly and the crowd will be deprived of their entertainment, which won't endear the executioner to them.
我成功给折磨犯人的刑具下了毒，这下犯人会当场一命呜呼，而观众的兴致也会大打折扣，他们便会看不起刽子手。
I failed to poison the torture instruments. I was seen doing it.
我没能给折磨犯人的刑具下毒。我被发现了。
The convict won't last out the torture with poisoned tongs for long - to the disgrace of the executioner.
罪犯不会在带毒的钳子下苟延残喘很久-刽子手会因此颜面扫地的。
I poisoned the horses which are supposed to draw the convict, so next day they would hardly be capable of walking, never mind dragging a man limb from limb.
我给要将犯人分尸的马匹下了毒，如此一来，第二日它们连走路的力气都没有，更别说分尸犯人了。
I wanted to poison the horses to weaken them, but unfortunately I was caught in the act. It didn't end well.
我本想给马下毒，让它们虚弱得走不动道，不幸的是我的行动暴露了。结果事与愿违。
If the executioner wants to draw a man limb from limb with horses, they'll need strength for it. I need to poison them.
如果刽子手想将犯人五马分尸，那么马匹必须要具有足够的力量。我得给马下毒。
It seems Vashek told everyone and his brother about the invincible Cumans dressed in dog hides. So I was left with no option but to get some. The sooner I forget that experience, the better.
看起来瓦舍克跟他的兄弟和所有人都说过刀枪不入的库曼人穿狗皮的事情。所以我除了去找些狗皮之外别无选择。我能越早忘记这事越好。
Dressed in dog skins? I wonder how Vashek manages to sleep at all with dreams like that. So where am I to find a stray dog, or one whose master won't be missing him...?
穿狗皮？我都好奇瓦舍克是怎么睡着的，每天梦到这些。所以我要去哪找流浪狗呢，或者是主人不想找回来的狗…………？
That Olena is a complete lunatic, but people believe her tales, so to convince them we're real Cumans, I have to get wolf fangs.
那个奥莱娜真是个彻底的疯子，但是人们相信她的故事。所以为了说服他们我们是真的库曼人，我得去找到一些狼牙。
Once Nicodemus had found out what the ailment was, he needed some time to prepare a remedy for it.
尼可丹姆斯已经查明了病症，他还需要一点时间准备治疗药剂。
Nicodemus found out what the ailment is. Now he has to prepare a remedy for it. That will take some time.
尼可丹姆斯已经查明了病症。现在他只需再准备一剂治疗药剂。这需要花点时间。

I promised to prepare the remedy for the sick villagers myself, so Brother Nicodemus went on ahead to Merhojed. Once I'd gathered the necessary ingredients, I shut myself up in the alchemical laboratory and started working on the potion. Thankfully, my efforts were rewarded with success.
我承诺亲自为病人熬药，于是尼可丹姆斯修士先一步赶往莫霍杰德照看病人。材料齐全之后，我便在炼金室里闭关，开始熬制药剂。好在我的努力没有白费。
I decided to prepare the remedy for the sick villagers myself. Meanwhile, Brother Nicodemus went on ahead to Merhojed to care for the sick.
我决定亲自为病人熬药。与此同时，尼可丹姆斯修士先一步赶往莫霍杰德照看病人。
Now to take the remedy to the sick villagers in Merhojed.
现在将药剂带给莫霍杰德的病人。
I've done everything I was meant to. I should tell Hermann what I did.
我已经按计划完成了任务。我应该向赫曼报告我所采取的行动。

Nicodemus was already waiting for me in Merhojed, where he'd been caring for the sick. Fortunately the pestilence hadn't spread any further, although the infected weren't getting any better either. At least there were no new victims.
尼可丹姆斯已经在莫霍杰德等着我了，他正在照看那里的病人。所幸瘟疫并没有传播到别处，只是病人的情况仍旧不容乐观。至少没有更多病人出现了。
Nicodemus was already waiting for me in Merhojed, where he'd been caring for the sick. Unfortunately, I'd come too late - Nicodemus told me all the infected had died.
尼可丹姆斯已经在莫霍杰德等着我了，他正在照看那里的病人。不幸的是，我来晚了-尼可丹姆斯告诉我，所有的病人都已然去世了。
Success! Brother Nicodemus and I breathed a sigh of relief when the potion worked.
成功了！看到治疗药剂有效之后，尼可丹姆斯修士和我长出了一口气。
The remedy failed. All the infected succumbed. Brother Nicodemus was devastated. He went back to the monastery.
药剂失败了。所有的病人都死了。尼可丹姆斯修士绝望了。他回到了修道院。
I gave the remedy to the sick and Brother Nicodemus is looking after them. We'll have to wait at least a day to see whether it works.
我将药剂分给了病人，尼可丹姆斯修士则负责照看他们。我们得等至少一天才能知道药剂是不是有效。
I want Peshek to teach me how to pickpocket. I have to follow him behind the mill.
我想让皮社科叫我怎么扒窃，我得跟着他去磨坊后面。
I wanted Peshek to teach me how to pickpocket. He was waiting for me behind the mill and set me the task of stealing the dagger from his purse. I succeeded.
我想让皮社科叫我如何扒窃。他在磨坊后面等我从他的钱包里偷走他的匕首。我成功了。
I have to try and steal Peshek's dagger from his purse. If I sneak up on him from behind, he won't notice me... I hope.
我得尝试从皮社科的钱包里偷走他的匕首。如果我从他后面摸过去，他应该不会察觉到我……但愿吧。
I can't stop thinking about that fiesty girl of mine. I've got to see her again!
窈窕淑女，君子好逑。我好想再与她鹊桥相会。
I told the herb-woman what happened after the women used her ointment. I expect she won't be selling any more of that stuff in future!
我告诉了采药婆那些女人们用了她的药膏之后发生了什么。希望她以后再也别卖那玩意了！
The herb-woman will want to know how the use of her ointment ended up. I should go and see her.
采药婆想知道用了她的药膏之后发生了什么。我应该去见她。
I figured Fritz played his part in the success of our venture, so I gave him his share of the loot.
我们的冒险能够成功，弗利兹在这之中扮演了重要的角色，所以我把他的那部分赃物给他了。
I didn't think Fritz helped much with stealing the quarrymen's wages, so I gave him nothing.
我觉得弗利兹在偷采石工的薪水时没帮上多大忙，所以我什么都没分给他。
I figure Fritz played his part in the success of our venture and he ought to get a fair share. I'm sure I'll find him in the Inn in the Glade along with Matthew.
我们的冒险能够成功，弗利兹在这之中扮演了重要的角色，所以他应该得到他合理的分成。我肯定能在林间酒馆里找到他和马修。
I've arranged for supplies of pitch. I just have to tell the quartermaster to send someone to pick it up.
我处理好了沥青的事情。我只需要告诉军需官，让他找人来取就好了。
I didn't manage to persuade Agnes, so I had to find another way.
我没能说动阿格尼斯，所以我只能去另寻他人了。
I didn't persuade Agnes to go and work for Konrad Hagen. Maybe I can find some other cook, otherwise I'll just have to tell him I didn't find one.
我没能说动阿格尼斯为康拉德·哈根工作。我应该去另找厨子，不然我只能去告诉他没找着合适的人选了。
Theresa caught me. I suppose I'm not very good at stealth, but at least it made her happy.
特丽莎抓到我了。可能我不太擅长躲藏，但至少这让她很开心。
Theresa couldn't catch me. Maybe I should have made it a bit easier for her.
特丽莎抓到我了。也许我应该让这点儿她。

I brought it back to Lukesh, naively thinking it was some family heirloom of his. He soon put me right, though - it was a valuable piece of jewellery he stole from Lady Ophelia of Sternberg. Anyway, with the necklace in his purse - thanks to me - he can disappear somewhere far from here and try to whitewash his black name.
我把它带给了鲁克斯，天真地以为那是他的传家宝。不过他很快就纠正了我——那是他从斯滕伯格的奥菲利亚夫人那里偷来的名贵珠宝。不管怎么样，他拿到项链之后——这可都要感谢我——就可以远走高飞、给自己洗白了。

That necklace was really a nice piece, so I wasn't keen on giving it to Lukesh. Instead, I told him I found nothing in his hiding place. Surprisingly, he never suspected I was lying. Seems he believes in honour among thieves.
那项链真的很不错，所以我也没想把它给鲁克斯。我告诉他我在他的屋子里什么都没找到。令人惊讶的是他居然没怀疑我在撒谎。看来他相信盗亦有道吧。
In the end, I decided I wouldn't help Lukesh. If it was too risky for a crook like Lukesh, I certainly wasn't going to put my neck on the line for him.
最后，我决定还是不要帮助鲁克斯了。如果这对鲁克斯这样的罪犯而言都太过冒险的话，我是绝对不会替他冒这个险的。
I managed to get the physician from Sasau Monastery enough free time to come and help us with our wounded and dying.
在我的帮助下，莎邵修道院的医师有时间来塔尔木堡的营地照顾伤员了。

Brother Nicodemus can't leave the Infirmarium and go and help at the Talmberg siege camps, because his hands are full at the monastery. I must talk to Johanka and see if there's anything I can do to help.
尼可丹姆斯修士离不开医院，所以不能去塔尔木堡的营地。因为他在修道院都忙不过来了，支不开身。我得去问问乔汉卡，看看我能不能帮上什么。
Peshek said the only one who would know anything about the ring is the executioner.
皮社科说唯一可能知道戒指的事的人就是行刑者了。
I didn't find any ring on the corpse. Peshek has some explaining to do!
我在尸体身上没找到什么戒指。皮社科得向我解释这一切！
Once we got through the gate, they charged us in the hope of driving us back. But we held our positions and beat off the attack.
突破大门以后，他们与我们背水一战，拼死想击退我们。但我们稳住了阵脚，压制住了他们猛烈的反扑。
There are still several enemies around the gate. We can't get any further until we beat them.
在大门周围还存余少许敌人。我们必须歼灭他们以除后患。
We beat the last of the enemy resistance holed up inside the fortifications around the church.
我们击溃了敌人在教堂周围布置的最后一道防线。
The last of the enemy forces are concentrated around the church. We have to deal with them.
敌军最后的兵力集中在教堂周围。我们要将他们击溃。
We fought our way through the forward patrols as far as the site of the encampment, where we met with further tough opposition.
我们从敌人的巡逻兵中杀出了一条血路，直捣黄龙，我们在敌人营地遭到了更为猛烈的抵抗。
We're attacking the bandits' encampment, but they have patrols on all the routes there. We'll have to deal with them first to get any further.
我们向土匪的大本营发起总攻，但他们派巡逻兵把守着各条通向老巢的道路。我们得先把他们干掉，以进行下一阶段的作战。
Enemy reinforcements attacked the positions we'd won in the upper camp after a tough struggle, but we managed to defend our positions and carry on with our siege of the church.
敌军的增援向我们好不容易才夺取的上层营地发起了猛烈的反扑，但我们成功守住了阵地，开始围攻教堂。
Enemy reinforcements are attacking our hard-won positions. We have to hold them off.
敌方增援正在反扑我们千辛万苦打下来阵地。我们要击退他们。

Our advance into the enemy camp was blocked by the archers inflicting casualties on us. I found a clever way of dealing with them - by setting fire to a pile of hay right under their positions. They had no choice but to stop shooting and pull back from the choking smoke, so now our men could advance.
对我们造成严重杀伤的弓箭手是我们进攻敌营的绊脚石。我发现了对付他们的简便方法-点燃他们所在位置下方的草堆。他们会因此自乱阵脚，停止射箭，被浓烟熏走。这样我们的人就能继续进攻了。
Our advance into the enemy camp was blocked by the archers inflicting casualties on us. I dealt with them so our men could advance.
对我们造成严重杀伤的弓箭手是我们进攻敌营的绊脚石。我把他们干掉了，以保障我们的士兵继续进攻。

I did my duty and informed the Prior about the two monks who've been boozing at night in the monastery cellars - Circators, who should be setting an example to the others! That should put a stop to their illicit merriment.
我遵守了我的原则，向长老举报了两个僧侣在修道院酒窖连夜喝酒的事实-就是那两个巡察使，他们本应以身作则，成为别人的榜样！这下应该可以结束他们出格的余欢了。
There's been boozing going on late at night in the monastery cellars, and the guilty parties are two Brother Circators! I'm sure the Prior would want to hear of it.
修道院酒窖每夜都会有酒局，两个巡察使修士便是罪魁祸首！我想长老肯定会对这件事有所作为。
Report the boozing to the prior

I reported the Circators who've been bullying Novice Lucas to the Prior. He wasn't too happy to hear what was going on behind his back and promised to set things to rights. So the bullies should leave Lucas alone now.
我将巡查长对卢卡斯折磨一事汇报给了长老。他对这些背地里的龌龊事很不满，承诺要插手制止这件事情。

When I told Lucas I'd reported the Circators to the Prior and that he wouldn't be bullied any more, he was horrified that I'd dealt with it in that way. But I think in the end he was happy to know the Circators would leave him alone.
当我告诉卢卡斯已将巡查长向长老检举一事，他会因此重获自由之时，他对我处理此事的方式感到恐惧。但我相信最终他会欣慰地发现巡查长不会再来找他的麻烦了。

Once I arrived in Merhojed, I discovered something terrible had happened there. I talked to Melichar, who took charge of the village after Vassal Smil was killed, and found out the village was apparently stricken by the plague.
到达莫霍杰德之后，我发现这里情况很糟糕。我和梅立恰尔谈了谈-他是属臣史麦尔遇难后村庄的管事-发现整个村庄已是瘟疫肆虐。
Something terrible has happened in Merhojed. I have to find the Bailiff or his assistant and ask what's going on.
莫霍杰德的情况很糟。我得去找执政官或者他的助手打听一下情况。

The time came for the raid. Quietly, under cover of darkness, we crept as far as the walls and raised a ladder. First the soldiers scaled the wall to take out the sentries. Meanwhile, me and Sir Hans waited below.
夜袭时间到。在夜色下悄无声息地匍匐着，我们潜行到了城墙边架起了一座云梯。先有士兵爬了上去干掉了哨兵。与此同时，我和汉斯少主在城墙下静候消息。
Here we are! I have to follow the soldiers and obey orders. I'd better not make a mess of it!
我们来了！我必须跟紧其他士兵，遵守纪律。可不能把计划搞砸了！
Once the sentries were dead, we could quickly scale the walls.
一旦哨兵被干掉了，我们便可以顺势爬上城墙。
The sentries are dead. We can scale the walls.
干掉哨兵了。我们可以爬上城墙了。
I've got to ride a horse from the Neuhof stud in the race. If I win, it'll help Zora.
我得骑着诺伊霍夫的种马参加比赛。如果我赢了，这个结果会帮助到佐拉。
Bringing Zora's horse back is the only decent thing to do. I can't leave her to comb the hills for him.
把佐拉的马带回她身边是我唯一能做的好事了。我不能让她去漫山遍野地寻觅他。
Christ! I totally forgot about Fritz and Matthew. Oh well, they're big enough to take care of themselves... I suppose.
天啊！我把弗利兹和马修忘了个干净！不过他们也不是小孩子了，可以自己照顾自己了……大概吧。

The lords decided to act quickly. They mustered as many men as possible and set out for Vranik, where a great battle took place and the bandits were wiped out to a man. But for Istvan Toth, who had vanished. Then we discovered to our horror that while we were battling with the bandits, Istvan and some of his men had taken advantage of Talmberg's vulnerability and seized the castle.
领主们决定快速出击。他们征集了足够的人手朝着弗拉尼克出发，一场大战之后，匪徒们几乎被全部消灭了。但是伊斯特万·托思，这个人消失了。然后我们惊恐地发现，当我们在和强盗们战斗的时候，伊斯特万和他的一些手下趁着塔尔木堡防御脆弱的时候，攻下了城堡。
In order to recover my father's sword, I'll have to take part in the raid on Vranik.
为了找回我父亲的剑，我将会参与袭击弗拉尼克。
Quickly to Talmberg! We must win it back!
快去塔尔木堡！我们一定要赢回它！

The siege of Talmberg was long and hard and we even had to build a trebuchet to bombard it. Our encampments survived several attacks by Istvan's men, and attempted to penetrate the castle by stealth, but failed. All our endeavours culminated in a massive attack on the castle on two fronts and we finally conquered it. But Istvan once again proved his evil cunning and took Lady Stephanie and Sir Radzig hostage in exchange for safe conduct out of Talmberg. And so he rode away unscathed, and took my father's sword with him!
围攻塔尔木堡的过程艰难而漫长。我们不得不建造了投石机来轰炸敌方。我们的营地经住了伊斯塔万的人的几次袭击。我们试图潜入渗透城堡，但是失败了。我们的努力在一次对城堡的夹击中达到顶峰，终于攻下了它。但是狡猾邪恶的伊斯塔万劫持了斯蒂芬妮夫人和拉德季大人，以使他自己安全离开塔尔木堡。他就这么毫发无伤地逃走了，还拿走了我父亲的剑！
I have to help the lords reconquer Talmberg, save Sir Radzig and Lady Stephanie and get back my father's sword.
我不得不帮助领主们夺回塔尔木堡，救下拉德季大人和斯蒂芬妮夫人，然后取回我父亲的剑。

There was a great assembly of lords at the Upper Castle in Rattay. Their Lordships were discussing high politics with none other than Margrave Jobst and planning what to do next. They agreed on one thing - that the Bohemian throne had to be restored to Wenceslas IV and Sigismund's bloody campaign brought to an end. They drafted a letter to Sir Otto of Bergow, the Supreme Prague Burgrave, a member of the League of Lords and a strong opponent of Wenceslas'. They sent Sir Hans Capon to deliver the letter. And I joined Sir Hans' entourage!
拉泰上城里有一大群领主们在集会。这些大人们正和一位人士讨论政治高见和接下来的行动，那人正是约布斯特。他们在一件事上达成了一致——波西米亚人的王座必须要归还给瓦茨拉夫四世，西格斯蒙德的血腥征战必须要画个句号了。他们起草了一封给波尔的奥托大人的信，他是布拉格的至高领主，领主联盟的成员，瓦茨拉夫的强力对手。他们派汉斯卡蓬大人去送信，而我加入了汉斯大人的随行团！
Istvan Toth is gone with my father's sword and somehow I must get Sir Radzig to let me pursue him. And that won't be easy.
伊斯塔万·托思带着我父亲的剑逃了，我必须说服拉德季先生让我去追他。这可不会容易。
Now to wait until the soldiers arrive at the quarry with the coin.
现在等士兵们带着钱到达采石场。
There really was a mention of Lubosh's cronies in the Black Chronicle. And it seems one of them even lives close by. Now to track him down.
《拉泰罪犯实录》中真的提到了卢波的同伙！而且看起来他们其中一个好像住的还不太远。是时候出发找他了。
I have to ask Brother Nicodemus how it's going with the remedy for the Merhojed folk.
我得问问尼可丹姆斯修士为莫霍杰德村民准备的治疗方案进度如何。
I should ask Brother Nicodemus what he thinks about the Merhojed tragedy and how the sick are doing.
我应该问问尼可丹姆斯修士莫霍杰德的受灾情况，以及病人的状况。
Whenever I want, I can go to the fisherman and his mates and have a brawl with them for a wager.
只要我想，随时都可以来找渔民和他的伙伴们，和他们下注后打一场。
I can always have a fight with Milan or the Skalitz brawlers, but only Milan is worth it.
我总有机会能与米兰或者斯卡里茨打手交手，但是只有米兰值得我这么做。
Andrew is looking for fresh meat. I should find out what kind.
安德鲁需要新鲜的肉。我应该看看他要的是哪一种。
I found out I can make a bit of coin working for the tanner.
我发现我可以为制革匠工作来赚点钱。
The Cuman's stash is hidden in an old hollow tree stump.
库曼人的赃物藏在一个空心老树桩里。
The fate of the Merhojed folk is in God's hands now. All I can do is wait and see if the remedy works or not.
莫霍杰德的村民如今只能听天由命了。我只能等着，看药剂是否管用。

I also got that trickster to tell me where the Cuman treasure is really supposed to be. There's a hill across the river from Rattay. If I go up the hill along the path, I should reach a crossroads by a burnt tree. Then I have to go downhill to the river, where there's a hollow tree stump to the right of the path. And that's where the treasure is supposed to be. Well, we'll see...
我从骗子那里得知了库曼宝藏的方位。流经拉泰的河流对面有一座山。只要沿着上山的路走，我会来到一个十字路口，就在一棵烧焦的树旁边。之后，我需要下山到河边。在路的右手边有一个空心树桩。宝藏便藏在那里。嗯，我们走着瞧……
We mustn't let the enemy break through the rear of our main force.
我们不能让敌人从后方偷袭我们的主力。
We mustn't let the enemy break through the rear of our main force.
我们不能让敌人从后方偷袭我们的主力。
We mustn't let the enemy break through the rear of our main force.
我们不能让敌人从后方偷袭我们的主力。
I lost the book for Peshek. I should try and get it back.
我弄丢了要交给皮社科的书。我应该试着把它找回来。
I lost the ring for Peshek. I should get it back.
我把要交给皮社科的戒指弄丢了。我应该把它拿回来。
I lost the deeds for Peshek. I should get them back.
我丢失了要交给皮社科的契约。我应该把它们找回来。
I lost the brocade for Simon. I should get it back.
我丢失了给西蒙的锦缎。我应该找回它。
I lost the recipe for Simon. I should get it back.
我丢失了给西蒙的配方。我应该找回它。
I lost the spurs for Simon. I should get them back.
我丢失了给西蒙的马刺。我应该找回它们。
I lost the jewels for Wozyeck. I should get them back.
我丢失了要给沃兹科的珠宝。我应该找回它。
I have to get to Skalitz! I can't leave my parents to the mercy of the dogs!
我得返回斯卡里茨！我不能把我的父母留在那帮野狗那里不管！
The foreign knight lured me into a trap! There's nothing for it now but to fight him.
那个异域骑士把我骗到了这个陷阱里！现在我只能和他一决雌雄了
I lost my belongings at Vranik, and I'll only get them back through the battlefield. Captain Bernard could help me with that.
我在弗兰尼克损失了装备，只能上战场把它们找回来了。巴纳德长官会给我找一身装备的。
I've got the key from the Pirkstein armoury. Now to pick what I want.
我拿到了皮克斯坦军械库的钥匙。去拿我想要的装备吧。
The race is starting at noon today in front of the Talmberg town gate. The most important thing is for me to go there on Zora's dappled grey. Otherwise, it will be all for naught.
赛跑将在今天中午塔尔木堡城镇大门前举行。最重要的是我得骑着佐拉的玉花骢去。不然一切都是无用功。
I won! I'm the champion of the famed Talmberg Races!
我赢了！我成为了家喻户晓的塔尔木堡赛马竞赛的冠军骑手！
Try as I might, I just couldn't win the Talmberg race.
尽管竭尽全力，我还是没能赢下塔尔木堡赛马竞赛。
And now to win! Giddy up!
Miller Peshek has a job for me.
磨坊主皮社科有一份工作给我。
Miller Peshek has a job for me.
磨坊主皮社科有份工作给我。
Miller Woyzeck has a job for me.
磨坊主沃兹科有份工作给我。
Miller Woyzeck has a job for me.
磨坊主沃兹科有个工作给我。
Miller Simon has a job for me.
磨坊主西蒙有一份工作给我。
Miller Simon has a job for me.
磨坊主西蒙有份工作给我。
The vagabond in Rattay has a job for me.
拉泰的流浪汉有件工作给我。
The vagabond in Rattay has a job for me.
拉泰的流浪汉有件工作给我。
The old whore at the Inn in the Glade has a job for me.
老妓女还有一个任务给我。
The old whore at the Inn in the Glade has a job for me.
那个老妓女有个任务交给我。
The labourer from the Sasau farm has a job for me.
莎邵的工人有个活儿要交给我。
The labourer from the Sasau farm has a job for me.
莎邵的工人有个活儿要交给我
I kept my promise and brought help, so Melichar should let me see the captive.
我信守了承诺，叫来了救助，因此梅立恰尔应该会让我见那个囚犯了。
Once I got back to Merhojed, I gave the remedy to the captive and waited to see how things would turn out.
我一回莫霍杰德就把药品交给俘虏并等待观察病情是否有起色。
I gave the remedy to the captive. Now he's in God's hands.
我把药品交给俘虏。现在他就只能听天由命了。
I should go and check how that captive bandit is doing.
我应该去检查一下被俘虏的土匪怎么样了。
It seems that bastard's guardian angel was watching over him - or the Devil. Either way, he survived, so I could interrogate him.
看上去这混蛋的守护天使-或是恶魔在罩着他。不管怎样，他活过来了，我可以审讯他了。
It didn't end well for the bandit, unfortunately. Not that I feel sorry for the bastard, but now I'll never find out what he could have told me.
很不幸，土匪的结局并不好。我不是在为这混蛋惋惜，而是我将再也无法知道他可能告诉我的事情了。
There was nothing for it but to search the bandit's corpse. May God forgive me for touching that unholy thing. Fortunately, he had a letter on him that could cast some light on the whole affair.
除了检查土匪的尸体再也没什么可做的了。愿上帝原谅我触摸这不洁的东西。走运的是他身上有封信件，或许会给整件事带来点希望。
A dead man answers no questions. But who knows, maybe his corpse can still give up some clues.
死人不会回答问题。但是谁知道呢，也许他的尸体会给点儿线索。
Theresa put all the things I had on me into a trunk.
特丽莎把我的东西都放进了一个箱子里。
They spotted us! I must get out of the castle or I'm done for!
他们发现我们了！我必须逃出城堡，不然我就要把命留在这里了！
Neither Sir Radzig nor Lady Stephanie can be found, damn it! I'll have to talk to Sir Hans about what comes next.
拉德季大人和斯蒂芬妮夫人都是无处可寻，该死！我得去和汉斯少主讨论下一步计划。
It's pitch dark outside and I don't know my way around Talmberg. I need a light.
外面挺黑的，我不知道去塔尔木堡的路，我得拿个能照明的东西。
I can get to the battlements via the steps next to the main castle gate.
我可以通过城堡大门旁的楼梯前往城垛。
Instead of Pious, I killed another novice. May God forgive me...
我杀了另一个学徒，而不是派阿斯。希望上帝能宽恕我。
I let Antonius go, but now I can't carry out the task I was given... Unless I kill a different novice, so the bandits hear of the murder in the monastery and assume Pious is dead.
我让安东尼斯走了，但现在我完成不了任务了……除非我杀死另外一个学徒，这样强盗们听说修道院出人命了，就会以为是派阿斯死了。
I really annoyed Theresa, so I'd better give her a wide berth for a while. Hopefully she'll cool down eventually...
我真的把特丽莎给烦到了，所以我还是先与她保持一段时间的距离吧。但愿她能消消气……
I'll have to cure Thomas myself.
Thomas might help me, but not if he's unconscious. I heard Johanka is taking care of the wounded. I'll have to help her.
伤员托马斯可能可以帮上我，但肯定不是在他昏迷不醒的状态下。我听说乔汉卡在处理病患，我得去帮助她。
We should have dealt with the archers who were raining arrows on us, but no one took care of that, which cost us heavy casualties.
我们要干掉那些朝我们射箭的弓箭手，但由于没人去对付他们，我方损失惨重。
There are archers covering our approach. They have to be dealt with.
那些弓箭手正阻挠我们前进。必须干掉他们。
I managed to sneak into Erik's quarters and get all my equipment back. Nobody's getting their filthy hands on my things.
我摸进了厄里克的房间并把我的装备都拿回来了，没人可以动我的东西！
I didn't manage to get my equipment back, but all was not yet lost. I'd be coming back to Vranik with an armed escort anyway.
我没能拿回我的装备，但不要紧，我下次回弗拉尼克就是伴随一支大军了
I found out my things are locked up in a trunk in the room where I came face to face with that bastard Toth!
我发现我的东西被锁在了一个箱子里，那个箱子就在我见到那天杀的托思的房间里！
Just as I expected, getting enough potion for all the camps was a hell of a job. I had to dash around from pillar to post and brew the stuff myself.
就像我想象的一样，给营里这么多弟兄做药剂真的累疯。我得自己一瓶一瓶做。
I couldn't find any herbalist who was willing to brew enough of the potion for me. I suppose I'll just have to brew it myself, if I can manage it...
我找不到可以帮我们做药剂的草药师。看来我得自己调制了，如果我可以的话……

The materials for counterfeiting were being handed over by a shrine to the south of Sasau Woods. I had a look there and ran into a couple of peculiar mercenaries, who were evidently guarding the handover place.
造假币的材料在莎邵森林南边的一个小庙里转手。我前去调查，却撞见了一队奇怪的打手，明显是在守着转手脏物的地方。
The materials for counterfeiting were being handed over by a shrine to the south of Sasau Woods. I'd better go and check it out.
造假币的材料在莎邵森林南边的一个小庙里转手。我最好去那里查看一下。
The easiest way to get into the Rathaus is through the rear door. There is a door on the ground floor leading through the kitchen and underneath the stairs is the entrance to the cellar.
进入市政厅最简单的方法是走后门。在一层有一扇门能进入厨房，楼梯下面就有进入地下室的入口。
If I get into the Rathaus through the upstairs door, I'll have to then make my way down into the cellar.
如果我从楼上的门进入市政厅的话，我就得想办法下到地下室去。
I managed to find the right door, all I had to do was get past it.
我设法找到了正确的门。我只要进去就好了。
The door to the cellar is on the ground floor, directly opposite the stairs to the upper floor.
去往地下室的门在一层，就在上楼的楼梯正对面。
The master engraver should have the crown ready. All I have to do is go and pick it up.
雕刻大师应该已经处理好皇冠了。我现在要做的就是去取。
I have to wait until the master engraver has set the Moldavite in the crown. It told me to come in the early evening on the following day.
我得等雕刻大师处理好绿玻陨石。他叫我在翌日傍晚去找他。
I helped Miller Peshek with that accursed ring. Hopefully he's put in a good word for me and Simon will stop being so suspicious.
我帮磨坊主皮社科拿到了那个被诅咒的戒指。希望他能在西蒙面前给我说点好话，别让他再怀疑我了。
Miller Simon won't tell me anything until I win his trust. So I'll have to go back to Miller Peshek in Rattay and accept his proposition.
磨坊主西蒙在信任我之前什么都不会跟我说。所以我得回到拉泰，找到磨坊主皮社科，并接受他的提议。

Miller Peshek couldn't put in a good word for me, so getting Simon to cooperate was impossible. I'll just have to continue my search for the crimps somewhere else and leave the millers to their own devices.
磨坊主皮社科没帮我说什么好话，所以和西蒙合作是不可能了。我得自己去找这些招募者了，不关这些磨坊主了。
Apparently the Vicar wanted to bring a swift conclusion to the affair of the heretics. He's already done his job and left.
显然，代理牧师想迅速解决掉异教的问题。他完成了工作，已经离开了。
Marius is free and the bandits are out of the way. Now he can continue his work in peace.
马略自由了，那帮强盗也逃之夭夭了。现在他可以在宁静中继续他的工作了。
Sir Divish told me he'd sent his locator to survey Pribyslavitz and was worried the man hadn't returned. I promised I'd go there and see if I can find him.
戴卫斯大人告诉我他派了个测定师去调查普拉比西拉维奇，但这人没有回来，他很担心。我向他保证我会去那里找找看。

Sir Divish has appointed me Bailiff of Pribyslavitz and put me in charge of its renewal! I have to take a document with his announcement to the Rattay Bailiff, who will make the public proclamation. It's usually best to see him shortly after noon.
戴卫斯大人任命我为普拉比西拉维奇的执政官，让我负责它的翻新工作！我得带着写有他的命令的文件去找拉泰执政官，由他来对公众宣布。一般来讲在午后去找他是最好的。
I've got to get back Sir Hans' necklace, which he lost at dice before realising it was just the thing to help him win the hand (and other parts) of the "love of his life".
我得把汉斯大人的项链弄回来，那是他之前在玩骰子的时候输掉的，那时候他还没意识到它正是能帮他赢到他“此生挚爱”的手（和其他部分）的决胜法宝。
I got Sir Hans' necklace back, then all I had to do was get it back to him quickly, before something else happened to it. Or to me!
我要回了汉斯大人的项链，接下来我要做的就是把它赶紧还给他，不然就该有别的坏事发生在它身上了。或者我身上！
I finally got my hands on Sir Hans' necklace. Now to get it back to him. The sooner I hand it over, the better - the damn thing must be cursed!
我终于摸到了汉斯大人的项链。现在我要把它还给他。越早越好——这鬼东西是被诅咒过的吧！

The player in Ledetchko who won Sir Hans' necklace was unexpectedly helpful. The only trouble was, he didn't have it anymore! He lost it to someone else who was just passing through Ledetchko, and all I could do was see if I could catch up with this stranger.
拉迪亚茨克那个赢走了汉斯大人项链的人出乎我意料地有帮助。唯一的问题是，项链已经不在他手里了！他把它输给了某个路过拉迪亚茨克的人。我能做的就是试着追上这个陌生人了。
Sir Hans' lost the necklace to a dice player in Ledetchko. I must ask around there and try to find this fellow. Let's hope he won't give me too much trouble...
汉斯大人把项链输给了拉迪亚茨克的一个玩骰子的。我得在这附近打听一下，看看能不能找到这个伙计。希望他别给我找太多麻烦……
I found the wayfaring nobleman quite easily on the banks of the Sasau. Only someone got to him before me and took the necklace from him, along with everything else he had... including his life.
我在莎邵河岸找到了那个路过的贵族，还挺容易的。只是有人捷足先登，并且把项链拿走了，还有他有的其他一切东西……包括他的命。
Some wayfaring nobleman won Sir Hans' necklace at dice and headed towards a ford near Sasau. If I want to get it back, I'll have to track him down.
某个旅行的贵族在玩骰子的时候把汉斯大人的项链赢去了，现在这个人正朝着莎邵附近的一片浅滩去了。如果我想要回项链的话，我得追上他了。
There's not a trace of the necklace at the nobleman's camp, but I did find signs that someone crossed to the other side of the river on horseback recently.
在贵族的营地里找不到项链的线索，但是我的确找到了一些迹象，说明有人最近刚刚骑马去了河的另一侧。
So the wayfaring nobleman is dead. Well, if I look around, maybe I can find the necklace, or at least some clue that will lead me to it.
所以这个旅行的贵族死了。好吧，如果我在附近找找看，没准能找到那项链，或者至少是什么能把我引向它的线索吧。
I found the robber baron's encampment amongst picturesque ruins in the middle of the woods. I hoped I was closer to finding the missing necklace.
在风景秀丽的林中废墟附近，我找到了强盗贵族的营地。我希望我离找到项链又近了一步。
The robber baron's camp where the necklace may have ended up isn't far from where the murder took place. It's hidden somewhere in the woods.
项链可能在强盗贵族的营地里。营地离谋杀现场不远，就在森林里的某处。
I didn't find out who killed Sir Alphonse. Sir Anselm will have to manage without my help.
我没找到杀害阿方斯大人的烦人。安塞尔姆大人得在没有我的帮助的情况下自己想办法了。

Sir Anselm of Domky asked me to find out who murdered his friend, Sir Alphonse, and bring the information back to him. I need to keep my eyes and ears open around the camp for any clues, and I'd better tread carefully - I don't want to end up like Sir Alphonse!
多姆基的安塞尔姆大人让我找出是谁杀害了他的朋友，阿方斯大人，然后再告诉他。我要好好注意着营地周围有没有任何线索，而且我最好小心行事——我可不想跟阿方斯大人一个下场！
Sir Hans has been liberated from captivity, but the Cumans knocked him around quite a bit. I'd better get him to Rattay to have his wounds seen to.
汉斯大人被解救了，但那些库曼人把他打得不轻。我最好把他带回拉泰疗伤。
I've got the treasure. Now, what to do with this Cuman?
宝藏已到手。那么现在，我将如何处置这个库曼人？
The captive Cuman promised to take me to his stash. I'd better watch him like a hawk, though.
库曼俘虏答应带我去找宝藏。但我最好看死他。
Vegetables from your own garden always taste best, and now I've weeded the garden, they'll grow better.
自家地里种出来的蔬菜永远是最好吃的，然而现在我把野草都除掉了，它们会长得更好
Vegetables from your own garden always taste best. It needs weeding though... but that can wait a while.
自家地里种出来的蔬菜永远是最好吃的。虽然需要除好草……但那可以先等等
Vegetables from your own garden always taste best, but they won't grown well if the garden is choked with weeds. I have to pull them.
自家地里种出来的蔬菜永远是最好吃的，但如果地里都是野草，这些菜可不会长好。我得除除草
The chickens were in the courtyard waiting to be fed, and they were happy to fill their beaks.
鸡在院子里等着吃东西呢，它们很乐意你填满他对嘴
The chickens are in the courtyard waiting to be fed. Unfortunately I didn't have time for that.
鸡在院子里等着吃东西呢。很不幸的是我没时间去管他们
The chickens are in the courtyard waiting to be fed.
鸡在院子里等着吃东西呢
I found out the armed men hiding out in the woods belong to one Sir Erhart of Bielowitz.
我发现藏在林中的武装者们是一位比洛维茨的厄哈特大人的手下。
There's a rundown farm in the woods filled with armed men who make it quite plain that they don't welcome visitors.
林中有一座破败失修的农场，里面全都是武装者，很明显，他们不欢迎任何客人。
I won at dice and found myself a step closer to the missing necklace.
我玩骰子的时候赢了，发现自己离失踪的项链又近了一步。
I didn't quite manage to win the dice tournament. I had to find some other way to get the necklace back.
我没能赢得骰子大奖赛。我得找个其他的办法找回项链了。
It seems the necklace has ended up in the pot for the brigands' dice tournament. All I have to do is throw some dice, beat everyone and win the pot. What could be easier?
看起来那条项链是在土匪们的骰子大奖赛的奖池里。我只要加入他们，打败所有人赢走奖品就好了。还有比这更简单的吗？
I managed to beat the first opponent, a fellow nicknamed Noggin for his renowned intelligence.
我设法打败了第一个对手，一个因为睿智而被昵称为脑哥的人。
I was beaten by my first opponent, Noggin, who's apparently as smart as his name suggests.
我被第一个对手脑哥击败了。他就跟外号听起来一样聪明。
I beat the second player, Berta.
我打败了第二个对手，贝塔。
I lost to my second opponent, Berta.
我输给了我的第二个对手，贝塔。
I got the better of the third player, Mladota.
我赢了第三个玩家，姆拉多塔。
I failed to beat the third player, Mladota.
我没能打败第三个对手，姆拉多塔。
I won against my last opponent, Pechuna.
我赢了最后一个对手，佩丘纳。
I failed to win against the last player, Pechuna.
我没能赢了最后一个对手，佩丘纳。
I recovered the necklace Sir Hans Capon inherited from his great-grandmother and lost at dice.
我找回了汉斯·卡蓬大人从他的曾祖母那里继承来、又在玩骰子中输掉的项链。

Sir Hans wants me to deliver a necklace to the girl of his dreams, a necklace he says is the only one fit to grace her lovely neck. Of course, it wouldn't be Capon if there weren't a catch! He lost the necklace at dice! Someone will have to try to get it back. Now, who might that someone be...?
汉斯大人要我把一条项链送给他的梦中情人，他说只有那条项链才配得上她的玉颈。当然了，没有后半句就不是卡蓬了！他已经把项链在玩骰子的时候输掉了！得有人试着把它弄回来。现在，谁是那个“有人”呢……？
I got Sir Hans' necklace and letter to Karolina.
我把汉斯大人的项链和信给卡洛丽娜了。

My next task is to sneak Sir Hans' necklace and love letter into the trunk of Karolina, his beloved. Apparently, this kind of ridiculous caper is all the rage in France. Discreetly and unobtrusively, then...
我的下一项任务是把汉斯大人的项链和情书放进他挚爱的卡洛丽娜的箱子里。显然，这种荒谬的追求活动在法国正流行呢。小心谨慎，低调不起眼地，然后……
I've done what His Young Lordship requested and I've got to go and see him in the morning for further instructions. Can't wait...
我已经完成了年轻的大人的要求，我早上要去见他，以便领取新的指示。我等不及了……
I finally got the Musk of Infinite Allure for Sir Hans. I hope it was worth all the trouble it took, but somehow I have my doubts...
我终为汉斯·卡蓬大人弄到了麝香春药，希望它配得上我为它经历的那些麻烦，不过我不知怎么的很怀疑……
I waited for Sir Hans to prepare for his rendezvous.
我等到汉斯大人准备好去约会了。
Preparing for a rendezvous with the love of your life naturally takes some time. I have to wait until evening when Lord Capon will have finished preening his feathers.
准备与你的一生挚爱约会自然是要花些时间的。我得等到晚上，让卡蓬大人梳理好他的羽毛才行。

I waited for Sir Hans to prepare for his rendezvous and then went to see him. Only... there was a fly in the ointment, so to speak. The Musk of Infinite Allure gave him a certain glow alright, but not quite as he expected...
我等汉斯大人准备好去约会之后去见了他。只是……这么说吧，他的药剂里有只苍蝇。麝香春药的确是让他红光满面，不过不是那种他想要的……
I don't know how to read. I'll have to learn if I'm to help Sir Hans with his affair of the heart.
我不会识字。我得学会认字，如果我要帮汉斯大人追寻所爱的话。
Sir Hans' Rash of Infinite Allure has finally cleared up! Now we can go and visit Karolina.
汉斯大人的麝香春药疹终于消退了！我们可以去找卡洛丽娜了。

The charlatan's Musk of Infinite Allure certainly made Sir Hans stand out from the crowd, though not quite how he expected - his whole face has broken out in red spots! Either we'll have to wait until it clears up on its own, or find some remedy for it.
江湖骗子的麝香春药的确令汉斯大人与众不同，尽管不是以他想要的方式——他整张脸上都长满了红疹！要么我们等它们自然消退，要么就得去找个药方了。
The charlatan's potion had an unfortunate side-effect. Sir Hans has broken out in a rather alarming rash. A herbalist or apothecary might know of a cure.
江湖骗子的药剂产生了不幸的副作用。汉斯大人脸上爆发了严重的疹子。草药师或者药剂师可能会知道该用什么解药。
By the time I managed to get hold of the Marigold decoction, Sir Hans' rash had already cleared up on its own.
当我想办法拿到金盏花药剂的时候，汉斯大人的疹子已经自己消退了。
Marigold decoction ought to help clear up His Young Lordship's rash.
金盏花药剂可以治好年轻的汉斯大人的疹子。
I followed Sir Hans until we arrived under Karolina's window.
我跟着汉斯大人到了卡洛丽娜的窗下。
The bold Sir Hans is finally ready to pay his beloved a visit. I have to follow him to the rendezvous.
勇敢的汉斯大人终于去拜访他爱的人了。我得跟着他去约会地点。
I found a spot to hide, from which I could prompt Sir Hans with lines of poetry.
我找到了藏身之处，我可以在那儿用诗句提醒汉斯大人。
I've got to hide somewhere, so Karolina doesn't see me from her window, but close enough so Sir Hans can hear me prompting him.
我得藏到什么地方去，这样卡洛丽娜从窗边看不到我，但是这地方又得离汉斯大人足够近，好让我给他提词。
Stibor is heading for the mine. We're to meet by one of the entrances.
斯蒂伯去矿场了。我们在其中一个入口碰头。

Sir Divish's fears for his Locator were not unfounded. The man had indeed run into trouble and been captured by a band of outlaws, who have him tied up in a tent. And it's up to me to get him out of there somehow.
戴卫斯大人对于他的测定师的担心并非没有一句。这个人的确遇上了麻烦，他被一群法外之徒抓住了，并被绑在了一顶帐篷里。就由我想办法把他救出来吧。
I reported to Sir Divish that I'd found his missing Locator. He was happy to hear the man was alive, but none too pleased that I'd left him to his fate. I have to go back and rescue him.
我向戴卫斯大人报告，我找到了他的失踪的测定师。他听到此人还活着的消息很开心，但是对于我把他留在那里自生自灭不太开心。我得返回去把他救出来。
Josef asked me to prove his suspicion that the innkeeper is responsible for his poisoning.
杰瑞让我证明他的怀疑并让酒馆老板负责。
I brought a horse to Miller Woyzeck as he wanted. I should have a word with him about my reward.
我为磨坊主沃兹科带来了一匹他想要的马。我得找他谈谈我的报酬
The hens are supposed to be fed every morning. I gave them their grain.
每天早上喂母鸡。我都是给它们喂点谷子。
The hens are supposed to be fed every morning, but somehow I forgot about them today.
每天早上喂母鸡，但不知道怎么的，我今天忘了。
I have to feed the hens every morning, and today is no exception.
我每天都得为鸡，今天也不例外。
I should talk to the Locator. What happens next will depend on his verdict.
我应该跟测定师谈谈，接下来该干什么就取决于他的判断了。
We surveyed everything and Marius says it's in better condition than he expected.
我们彻底地调查之后，马略说这地方的条件比他期望的要好
Me and Marius will look over Pribyslavitz and see if it's possible to rebuild from the ruins that remain of the village.
我和马略要调查普拉比西拉维奇，看看村子的废墟是否可以重建起来
Locator Marius is free and the bandits are out of the way. I should talk to Marius about what he's doing in Pribyslavitz.
测定师马略现在自由了，也没有土匪了。我应该跟马略聊聊他在普拉比西拉维奇都做了些什么。
I happened on a band of outlaws in Pribyslavitz who are holding in captivity a man who was sent there by Sir Divish. I should help him and deal with the bandits, before it's too late...
我发现一伙普拉比西拉维奇的法外之徒抓住了一个戴卫斯大人派去的男人。我应该对付那群匪徒，并帮助那个人，趁现在还来得及……
I dug up the grave. There wasn't much left of the deceased, almost as if the corpse was burnt.
我掘了坟。死者的遗骸残缺不全，尸体好像被烧过一样。
The charlatan wants me to find a grave near Ledetchko, dig it up and remove the remains. I seriously hope no one sees me doing it!
黑商让我去找拉迪亚茨克附近的一处坟墓，把它掘了，把里面的遗骸清走。我衷心希望没人看见我干这事儿！

I talked to the gossip woman, pretending to be curious about the grave. She clearly didn't know anything about it being dug up and was very nervous indeed. She said it was the grave of a charcoal-burner, Lev, who was struggling to make ends meet and took to thievery when his wife fell pregnant. They soon caught on to him and punished him, but he got off light and no one talked to him after that. His wife died in childbirth along with the child and after that he turned his back on God and man.
我与长舌妇进行了交流，假装好奇那个坟墓的情况。她显然不知道它已经被掘了，而且说起它的时候也十分紧张。她说那是位名叫列夫的烧炭工的坟。他生前辛苦挣命，媳妇怀孕后为生计所迫开始干偷窃的勾当。他很快就被绳之以法了，然而又被放了一马，在那以后，他就被众人孤立了。他的妻子在生孩子的时候死了，孩子也胎死腹中。之后他便背叛了上帝和万众生灵。
Now to talk to that gossip who lives on the edge of the village, in the last house on the left on the way to Sasau.
现在去和住在村边的长舌妇交谈，就在去莎邵的路左边的最后一间房子里。
I told the charlatan the whole tragic story and of course he was delighted. After all, tragedy is his stock in trade. It didn't take him long to come up with a plan.
我把整个悲惨的故事转述给了黑商，他听后当然很高兴。总之，这个悲剧故事是他生意的卖点。没多久他就有了个鬼点子。
Now to get back to the charlatan and tell him the whole story.
现在回去和黑商对话，向他转述故事的经过。
Done. Now everyone in Ledetchko thinks their hens are hexed.
完成了。这下拉迪亚茨克的所有人都会以为自家的鸡着了魔。
Since Lev was stealing eggs and he was a charcoal-burner, what better way to make it look like he's returned from the dead than to steal eggs from chicken coops and replace them with charcoal?
正因为列夫曾经偷过鸡蛋，又是一位烧炭工，还有比把鸡蛋掉包成木炭更能体现他起死回生了的把戏吗？
Now even the butcher has to admit to believing in the revenant. Either that or get a bad reputation for selling rotten meat.
这下就连屠夫也相信亡灵的存在了。不然也会因为卖了烂肉而坏了名声。
What an idiot I am! I got caught in the act, and now it won't be easy to frighten the villagers.
我真是蠢得没边儿了！我的行动败露了，现在想再吓唬村民可就不容易了。
The charlatan says a revenant can make meat go bad by touching it and I should do just that. I don't have that kind of power though, so I'll have to switch the meat at the butcher's.
黑商说凡是亡灵碰过的鲜肉都会变成烂肉，我应该照猫画虎。我并不具备这样的超能力，所以我只能去掉包屠夫的肉。
The charlatan didn't exactly make the job easy for me, but in the end I brewed the potion and poured it into the baths. And I must say, the effect made even me feel a bit uneasy.
黑商没给我铺好路，但最终我还是把药剂熬出来倒到澡堂里了。我不得不说，药剂的效果让我有点难堪。

I failed. I was caught red-handed... literally, colouring the water at the baths. With a bit of luck, no one will connect it with the other things, but as far as "water into blood" is concerned, the game's up.
我失败了。有人发现我双手鲜红……说白了，就是去澡堂给水上色去了。走运点儿，没人会联想到其他事情上，但至少“化水为血”这场戏，咱是做不下去了。
"And the water turned to blood". Nothing original, the charlatan says, but at least tried and tested. He recommended some potion for the job. Now if I only knew what the hell he was talking about...
“化水为血”。照黑商说的，绝非原创，但经得起推敲。他推荐了几种派得上用场的药剂。只是我不知道他狗日的在说些什么……
Most of the villagers' rosaries have vanished and the people are shaking with fear.
大多数的人都丢了念珠，人们已然惊慌失措。
To deprive the villagers of their peace of mind, I'm supposed to steal their rosary beads. Or, as the charlatan put it, "replace them with nothing."
为了把村民吓得魂飞魄散，我应该去偷了他们的念珠。或者，像那黑商所说，”把它们换成空气“。
It took a lot of running around investigating, but in the end I got to the bottom of this affair with Josef. The Bailiff was satisfied and he paid me a decent reward.
通过很多调查，最终我和杰瑞寻到了事件的源头。执政官很满意并给我了相当好的报酬。
The Bailiff is having trouble with a local farmer, Josef, so I promised him I'd look into it and try to fix things.
执政官与农夫杰瑞起了冲突，我保证我会尽力解决。
Henry was working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca wanted to bring him a beer, but she couldn't leave the tavern, so I did it for her.
亨利在羊圈练剑练得大汗淋漓。比安卡想给他带瓶酒，但她不能离开酒馆，所以我帮她送了
Henry was working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca wanted to bring him a beer, but she couldn't leave the tavern. I promised to do it for her, but I didn't.
亨利在羊圈练剑练得大汗淋漓。比安卡想给他带瓶酒，但她不能离开酒馆。我答应了帮她做这件事，但我没做
Henry is working up a sweat at the stockade training swordfighting. Bianca would like to bring him a beer, but she can't leave the tavern, so I promised to help her out.
亨利在羊圈练剑练得大汗淋漓。比安卡想给他带瓶酒，但她不能离开酒馆，所以我答应了帮她做这件事。

After Johanka's sermon, the tailor's wife came to ask her for help with some troubles with her husband. Johanka has enough on her own plate, so she asked me to see what I could do and of course I agreed.
乔汉卡讲完后，裁缝的妻子来找她帮忙解决她丈夫的一些麻烦。乔汉卡自己的事已经够多了，所以她让我看看我能做些什么，我当然同意了。
After Johanka's sermon, the tailor's wife came to ask her for help with some troubles with her husband. Johanka has enough on her own plate, so she asked me to see what I could do. Well, let's see...
乔汉卡讲完后，裁缝的妻子来找她帮忙解决她丈夫的一些麻烦。乔汉卡自己的事已经够多了，所以她让我看看我能做些什么。好吧,让我们看看……
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning, so I gave him something to eat.
一般每天早上都会喂叮叮，所以我给它了点吃的
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning, but I haven't given him anything to eat.
一般每天早上都会喂叮叮，但我还没给它东西吃
Tinker is used to getting fed every morning and today is no exception. I have to feed him as usual.
一般每天早上都会喂叮叮，今天也不例外，我得像平常一样去喂它
We can't survey Pribyslavitz in the dark. I'd better come and see the Locator during daylight hours.
在黑暗中我们没法调查普拉比西拉维奇。我还是白天再来找测定师吧
I've been officially appointed Bailiff and some new settlers are already on their way to Pribyslavitz. Now it's time to start with the actual renewal of the village.
我已经被官方任命为了执政官，而有些新居民已经在去普拉比西拉维奇的路上了。现在是时候开始村子的重建工作了。
I took Sir Divish's announcement to the Rattay Bailiff and he will make the public proclamation, which I should be there for, since it concerns me personally...
我将戴卫斯大人的通告带给了拉泰执政官，由他来对公众宣布。我也应该过去，因为它也涉及到了我个人……
I should talk to Johanka about it.
我该和乔汉卡说说这事。

While the charlatan is thinking up some way of frightening the fellow who's afraid of fire, I have to deal with the one who's afraid of wild animals. Making terrifying animal calls ought to do the trick. Who could teach me that, I wonder?
黑商在想法子对付怕火的哥们儿，与此同时，我得去对付怕野生动物的那个。能模仿出凶恶动物的叫声就结了。我想了半天，谁能教我这招呢？

I need to take Ambrose for everything he has, so he loses his taste for the game. I'll have to bait him by letting him win a couple of times and see if he bites. I mustn't botch it. He'll be leaving for Kuttenberg soon and I might not get a second chance to play him, so there's no time to waste.
想让安布罗斯厌恶赌博，我得让他输成穷光蛋。我得先让他几场，看他上不上瘾。我不能磨蹭。他马上就要出发去库腾堡了，可能就再没机会教育他了，所以我得麻利儿的。
I've got enough linen to bandage Samuel's wounds.
我找到了足够的亚麻以用来包扎塞穆尔的伤口
Samuel's wounds have started bleeding again. I'll have to find some linen to bandage them.
塞穆尔的伤口又开始流血了，我得找点亚麻来包扎
I found some marigold to put on Samuel's wounds.
我找到了些金盏花，可以用来治疗塞穆尔的伤口
I need to find healing herbs for Samuel's wounds. Ten marigold plants should do.
我需要找到治疗的草药去治疗塞穆尔的伤口，十株金盏花应该就够了
Now the army has pulled out, it should be safe enough to go and see if anyone survived behind the walls.
现在军队撤走了，现在去城墙里找找幸存者应该很安全了
Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. We soon taught them some manners.
乔汉卡还没说完，就有几个人来拆散会众。我们很快就教他们做人了。

Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. We wanted to teach them some manners, but it didn't quite work out. I only hope this kind of thing won't happen again and they'll leave Johanka in peace.
乔汉卡还没说完，就有几个人来拆散会众。我们想教他们做人，但没有成功。我只希望这种事不会再发生并不再骚扰乔汉卡。

Before Johanka had even finished speaking, some fellows came along to break up the congregation. That's not going to happen! As long as I'm around, no one is going to make trouble for Johanka! What they need to learn some manners is a good beating! I'd better make sure it doesn't get out of hand though. If someone gets cut or worse, it could mean serious trouble.
乔汉卡还没说完，就有几个人来拆散会众。这绝不能发生！只要我在，就没有人能给乔汉卡找麻烦！我得锤他们一顿教他们做人！不过我最好确保事情不会失控。如果有人受伤或更严重，这可能会有大麻烦。
I should go and see if Johanka is alright.
我应该去看看乔汉卡怎么样了。
If Andrew's plan is to work, the robbery mustn't succeed!
倘若要使安德鲁的计划奏效，一定要阻止抢劫！

Sir Divish was delighted with the renewal of Pribyslavitz and rewarded me and Marius for getting the job done. The village is now a thriving settlement and I am entitled to all the profit from it! I'll be happy to come back now and again and see how things are going.
戴卫斯大人欣慰地看到普拉比西拉维奇重焕新生，犒赏了我和马略的工作。村庄现已发展成了一处生机勃勃的居住地，我则被授权拥有了当地所有的收入！我很高兴回去看看村庄的发展情况如何。
I've finished everything that needed doing. Now I must report to Sir Divish that the reconstruction of the village is at an end.
我完成了所有的建设工作。现在我要向戴卫斯大人汇报村庄的重建工程已经取得了阶段性成果。
My a stroke of misfortune, Locator Marius didn't survive to get his survey of Pribyslavitz finished. I'd better report the sad news to Sir Divish.
很不幸，测定师马略没能活到他调查完普拉比西拉维奇的那一天。我应该去把这悲伤的消息告诉戴卫斯大人。

I went to see Sir Hans to find out how his amorous encounter with Karolina ended up. Frankly, though, I can't see what he finds so appealing about her. Unless it's her lingering fragrance of smoked sausage?
我去见了汉斯大人，好知道他和美丽的卡洛丽娜的浪漫幽会进行得如何了。不过坦白地说，我完全不懂他觉得她哪里好，难道是她身上萦绕着的熏香肠的香味吗？
The night-time rendezvous is over. And I hope there won't be a repeat of it anytime soon! I must go and see Sir Hans in the morning to find out how it went.
夜晚的冒险结束了。我希望最近可不要再来一回了！我得在早上去找汉斯大人，问问他冒险进行得如何。
I took Marius' report to Sir Divish. He was very pleased and wants to visit Pribyslavitz in person.
我把马略的报告带给了戴卫斯大人。他很满意，并想要亲自来普拉比西拉维奇看看。
Marius gave me a dispatch for Sir Divish containing his report on the state of Pribyslavitz.
马略派我去找戴卫斯大人，带着他对普拉比西拉维奇的调查报告。
On my mission to save the soul of a Ledetchko prostitute, I went straight to Adela, who I already knew since the time I was investigating the Neuhof raid.
我去找了阿黛拉，劝这个拉迪亚茨克失足女从良。在调查诺伊霍夫种马场洗劫案的时候，我就和她有过一面之缘。
As it happens, I know Adela since the time I questioned her during my investigation of the raid on the Neuhof stables. She's a bath wench who fits the bill perfectly.
凑巧，当初调查诺伊霍夫种马场洗劫案的时候，我便邂逅且审讯过她。她就是我要找的澡堂妓女。
Johanka sent me to Ledetchko to find a prostitute and redeem her. I think I found someone who fits the bill.
乔汉卡让我去拉迪亚茨克劝一个妓女从良。我想我已经锁定目标了。
I don't know how I'm supposed to go about finding this prostitute. I'll just have to figure it out somehow.
我不知道怎么才能找到这个妓女，我得想个法子。
The prostitute was getting some rough treatment, but I decided not to get mixed up in it and come back the next day.
有人在欺凌那个妓女，但我决定不趟这摊浑水，第二天再来。

Sir Divish wasn't at all happy about my handling of Pribyslavitz and dismissed me from the office of Bailiff. I don't know if I could have done something better - perhaps I'm not cut out for public office.
戴卫斯大人对我于普拉比西拉维奇的工作相当不满，免去了我执政官的职位。我不知道我有什么需要改正的地方-也许我就是不擅长公共建设的工作。
I'd better go to Sir Divish and explain to him what's happened. The Pribyslavitz settlers are very disgruntled with the way things are going.
我最好去找戴卫斯大人向他阐明实情。普拉比西拉维奇的民众对村庄的治理很不满。

Marius explained to me how the actual construction work proceeds. He will enter all the information in the accounts ledger. He also told me there's a trunk where I have to put the money needed for building houses and paying workers. And when the village starts earning its own way, that income will go in the trunk too.
马略向我介绍了建设工程将如何进行。它会将所有的信息记录在记事簿上。他也告诉我，有一个箱子供我存放建设资金和工人的薪水。当村庄的设施开始运营之后，所有的收入也将存放在那个箱子里。
I'm officially Bailiff of Pribyslavitz and now it's up to me to see to the renewal of the settlement. I'm not sure quite how to go about it, though. I'd best talk to Marius about how to proceed.
我正式成为了普拉比西拉维奇的执政官，现在重建家园的重任落在了我的肩上。但是我不确定如何着手处理这项工作。我最好去和马略谈谈接下来的计划。
The church is standing. It took a lot of effort and coin, but it was worth it.
教堂巍峨屹立。尽管花费了不少的功夫和财力，一切的努力都是值当的。
I have the task of renewing the church. It won't be enough just to repair it - I'll also have to see to getting a new altar and ornament of the interior.
我接到了新建教堂的任务。光是重建还不够-还要修建一座新祭坛，并且布置内部的装饰。
The village is now earning a decent income. I had to pay out a lot from my own purse, but now I'll start getting it all back with interest.
村庄现在的收入还不错。之前我必须要掏自己的腰包垫钱，可现在我能赚回点儿利润了。
The village must pay its own way, otherwise I'll soon be ruined. I'd better make sure everything runs as profitably as possible.
村庄必须要自动回本，不然我就要破产了。我最好确保一切事项以收益最大的目标运营。
Pribyslavitz is now capable of housing lots of people. There are buildings enough and no shortage of living space.
普拉比西拉维奇现在可以住下很多人。住房充足，不缺少居住空间。

The village will have to be expanded even more, so I have the task of providing sufficient living space. That way, anyone interested in starting a new life can move here without fear of ending up without a roof over their heads.
村子还要扩张，所以我要开拓足够的居住空间。这样，所有前来寻求新发展机遇的民众能无所顾虑地前来，不用担心他们会露宿街头。
The whole village is shaking with fear! Looks like the plan worked!
整座村庄都惶恐不安了！看上去计划奏效了！

Things didn't work out quite as planned. Everyone knows it was me who was trying to scare the villagers. I'd better stay out of the way before an angry mob comes looking for me. And the charlatan won't be happy either...
计划失败。大家都知道是我在恐吓村民。我最好在生气的暴民找我算账之前逃之夭夭。那个骗子也不会放过我的……
The charlatan gave me the job of haunting Ledetchko and he has a few ideas how to go about it. Maybe I'll come up with something of my own too... The main thing is not to get caught!
黑商派我在拉迪亚茨克为闹鬼造势，他想出了一些可行的计划。也许我也可以别出心裁……但最重要的是不要被抓到！
I should go and see the charlatan from time to time to see how well I'm doing at haunting the villagers.
我应该常去和黑商核实造势的效果。
I buried Lev's remains in Rattay and now he can finally rest in peace, may God have mercy on him.
我在拉泰埋葬了列夫的遗骸，他终于获得了安息，愿上帝宽恕他。
The remains of that poor wretch have been weighing heavy on my shoulders and my soul. I must bury them, as the charlatan said, in hallowed ground, which I suppose means in Rattay.
我的身心已然担负不起这可怜人的遗体。我必须把它们妥善埋葬，按照黑商说的，要埋在圣所，大概说的就是拉泰吧。
I found all the meat at the butcher's. There are chickens hanging in the courtyard and lamb inside, but to my surprise, there's also venison hidden away in the pantry.
我找到了屠夫的全部藏肉。庭院里有挂着的鸡肉，里屋有羊肉，而出乎意料的是，储藏室里还私藏着鹿肉。
I have to find all the meat the butcher has, so I can replace it with rotten stuff.
我得找到屠夫所有的藏肉，这样我才能替换烂肉。
I did it. It turned out to be just poppy, St. John's wort and thistle. Quite easy really, just grind everything and brew it together in wine for one turn.
我做到了。只需要用到罂粟，圣约翰草和蓟草。挺简单的，把素材碾碎，然后放到红酒里熬一轮就得了。
I must ask the charlatan about that recipe for "turning water into blood". Couldn't possibly be anything too difficult, right?
我得去问问那个江湖骗子（黑商）“化水为血”的配方。应该不会是什么难的东西，对吧？
All I had to do was throw some rotten eggs in the well and now the villagers believe it's the gateway to Hell itself.
我只需要往井里扔点儿臭鸡蛋，现在村民们都把它当成通向地狱的大门了。
Damn it, I should have been more careful. Now the villagers will know the spoiled water was my doing and they'll... well, kick up a stink.
该死。我应该谨慎点儿才对。现在村民们都知道污染水质的事儿是我干的，他们会……呃，把我狠狠修理一顿。
Rotten eggs give off a real stink - a diabolical stink, like brimstone. That could surely be put to use. Maybe poison their water with them?
烂鸡蛋的味道可谓臭气熏天-一股魔鬼般的恶臭，像是硫磺。这肯定派得上用场。也许可以用来污染他们的井水？

The Bailiff asked me to deal with a band of itinerants who've been hanging around the area. He suspects them of having dug up that grave. Not only can I make a bit of coin out of helping him, but maybe I can also use this to my benefit...?
执政官派我去铲除一队在此处游荡的流民。他怀疑是这群人挖空了那座坟。我既能通过帮他挣点儿小钱，又或许可以让这个事件为我所用……？
I asked Fritz and Matthew for help with frightening the villagers. Of course, they jumped at the chance of making some mischief.
我请求弗利兹和马修帮忙恐吓村民。不出所料，他们不会放过恶作剧的机会。

I asked the gossip about this fearless fellow. His name is Felix, and he might not be such a hero after all, especially at night by Lev's grave, on his own. Only he always has two cronies with him wherever he goes. But now I know what those two are afraid of...
我向长舌妇打听了这个没吓着的伙计。他名叫菲利克斯，而他可能不会一直那么勇敢，尤其是让他夜里自个儿到列夫的坟头站着的时候。只是他不管到哪里身边总跟着两个小弟。但现在抓住了这两个人的把柄……

The charlatan won't be satisfied until every last one of the villagers is frightened, including one last brave lad, who claims he'd even sleep by Lev's grave. If I could get him there, maybe he wouldn't be so brave, if we only knew what would scare him. The gossip might know...
只有所有村民，包括这最后一位有点儿胆识的，声称要在列夫的坟里睡觉的伙计，全都被吓倒以后，黑商才会满意。要是他真到了坟边儿，八成他就不会那么威风了，只是我们需要知道究竟如何才能吓到他。长舌妇可能知道他的把柄……
I told the charlatan what I know about Fearless Felix and his two companions. He wants me to deal with frightening that pair.
我向黑商报告了那个没被吓着的菲利克斯以及他的两个同伙的情报。他派我去恐吓那两个跟班儿。
I must go back to the charlatan and tell him what I found out about those fearless fellows.
我得回去向黑商报告关于这些没被吓着的人的情报。
The charlatan drew my attention to a certain dog with a terrifying bark that can be heard all over Ledetchko.
黑商让我去找一条叫声大到整个拉迪亚茨克都听得见的狗。

I remembered that the Rattay Huntsman is good at animal calls. Who could forget his blood-curdling nightingale screeching? So I went and talked to him and sure enough he came through. Now I'll just have to try not to get gored by a rival rutting stag!
我记得拉泰狩猎大师擅长模仿动物叫声。谁能忘了他那令人毛骨悚然的夜莺啼叫呢？于是我便去请他出山了。现在我只需注意不要被一头发情的牡鹿对手给顶了了！
I could always try a more direct approach and just knock the fearless fellow out. Of course, it won't be easy, and if I get caught, the game will be up.
我可以尝试一种更为直接的方法，径直把那天不怕地不怕的哥们儿打跑。当然了，行动起来有困难，一旦行动败露，就玩完了。

An oil lamp - that's the charlatan's ingenious plan. All I have to do is shoot it down from a branch over the grave, it will break in the grave and the oil will burst into flames. That could work alright, just as long as my aim is good enough.
一盏油灯-这是黑商独创的计划。我只需要把它从坟墓上方的一根树枝上射下来，它就会砸进坟墓里，油就会燃起大火。只要我的箭术有准头，这个计划准能成。
I'm very curious what twisted plan the charlatan will come up with for frightening the other two.
我很好奇黑商会想出什么法子吓唬那两个跟班儿。
That didn't take much doing. He was clearly reluctant, but he didn't want to look like a coward and a blowhard.
不费吹灰之力。他显然是很不情愿，但他毕竟不想被人看成是个懦夫和牛皮大王。
Now to provoke Fearless Felix into spending the night at the grave.
现在挑衅无畏的菲利克斯到坟边儿过夜。
My aim was true! The lamp fell into the grave and broke. If it had been lit, the whole thing would have gone up in flames.
我果真有一手好箭术！油灯被射落，掉在坟头上。倘若是点着的，那地方瞬间就会被大火吞没。
I didn't get round to practicing shooting down the lamp. I'll just have to hope my aim is good enough when the time comes.
我没去试射油灯。只能祈求我的箭术在关键时刻足够准确。
The charlatan said I can practice trying to shoot down the oil lamp.
黑商说我可以练习试射油灯。
Those two got the fright of their lives. They won't forget this night in a hurry!
那两个人已经被吓得魂不守舍了。一时半会儿是忘不掉这噩梦般的夜晚了！

I have to frighten Felix's two companions. Fire should scare one and wild animal calls the other. If all else fails, I can always knock the two of them out. The important thing is that Fearless Felix is left there on his own.
