我得吓跑菲利克斯的两个跟班儿。一个怕火，一个怕动物叫声。要是全没奏效，我随时都可以把俩人给端了。重要的是要让无畏的菲利克斯一个人呆着。
The fearless fellows have been dealt with. Now I just have to talk to the charlatan.
勇敢的家伙已经被处理好了，现在我该去和江湖骗子（黑商）对话了

The charlatan was clearly delighted with the outcome. His plan worked and the locals are buying up anything they can to ward of evil. He'll soon have enough money to be on his way. And I got a well-earned reward.
黑商对成果非常满意。他的计划奏效了，村民们纷纷前来抢购辟邪的用具。他马上就发了。我也拿到了一份数目可观的报酬。
I have to come in the morning for my reward. Then the charlatan will know if his plan has worked.
我得在早晨去取我的报酬。只有在那之后黑商才能知道他的计划是否奏效了。
I escorted Adela to Sasau, where she can start a new life.
我把阿黛拉带到了莎邵，她将在那里开始一段新生活。
Now I should escort Adela to Sasau to start a new life.
现在我应该把阿黛拉带到莎邵去开始一段新生活。
This siege will never make any progress unless I help Master Feyfar.
围攻将毫无进展，除非我去帮助费法尔大师。
I managed to talk the Ledetchko miller into giving Fritz and Matthew a chance. I hope those two ne'er-do-wells don't make me look like a fool.
我设法让拉迪亚茨克磨坊主给弗利兹和马修一个机会。我希望那两个不中用的家伙别让我蒙羞。
I persuaded the Ledetchko miller to give Fritz and Matthew a chance. I must go and tell them right away.
我说服了拉迪亚茨克磨坊主给弗利兹和马修一个机会。我必须现在就去告诉他们。
I persuaded the itinerants to leave. The Bailiff was happy and rewarded me well.
我把流民劝走了。执政官欣慰地馈赏了我。
There was no persuading the itinerants and things got a little out of hand. They're all dead... Well, they left me with no option. Of course, the Bailiff wasn't too happy about it.
对那群流民苦口婆心相劝简直如同对牛弹琴，事态有点儿失去控制。他们全下地狱了……呃，是他们逼我的。执政官自然不会对此感到满意。
The itinerants are dead, but I still managed to take advantage of the fact by blaming the revenant for their deaths. And the Bailiff was convinced.
流民全被杀了，但我借机把他们的死嫁祸于亡灵。执政官被说服了。
Those itinerants don't care much for work, but they're not stupid. I talked them into helping me out with haunting the villagers.
这群流民虽然混吃混喝，但毕竟脑袋还算好使。我笼络了他们帮我为闹鬼造势。
I got them out of the way. Forever. I had to do it, or they'd have betrayed us.
我把他们拦下来了。确切的说是杀了。我不得不这么做，不然他们会背叛我们的。
I let them go. So now everyone in Ledetchko will know about me. I'll have to break the bad news to the charlatan.
我放他们走了。这下我在拉迪亚茨克出名了。我得赶紧把这个坏消息告诉黑商。

Things got out of hand. I wasn't cautious enough and Felix and his companions caught me red-handed. Now they're on the way back to Ledetchko to tell everyone about me. I could stop them, but only by violent means. Is it worth it though?
大事不妙。我一不小心让菲利克斯和他的跟班儿抓了个现行。现在他们正在回拉迪亚茨克向众人揭露我的丑行的路上。我可以拦下他们，只能动手别无他法。但这值当的吗？
I didn't succeed. They caught me out and went home. What do I do now? I'd better let the charlatan know.
我没成功。他们发现了我，然后直接回村子了。现在该怎么办？我最好把这件事告诉黑商。
I went to see Theresa. She was happy to hear from Fritz and Matthew and she even advised me which mill to ask at for jobs for them.
我去见了特丽莎。她很高兴听到弗利兹和马修的消息，她甚至建议我去磨坊那儿给他们找工作。
I promised Fritz and Matthew I'd pass on their regards to Theresa when I meet her.
我向弗利兹和马修保证我会向特丽莎传达他们的问好的。
I promised Pa I'd go and talk to Stibor about the silver going missing from the mines. Stibor was quite startled and asked for my help. It seems it was the pair of them who were responsible!
我答应老爸我会去找斯蒂伯谈谈矿场银子不见的事。斯蒂伯很吃惊，向我求助。看来就是他们俩干的！
I promised Pa I'd go and talk to Stibor about the silver going missing from the mines. Pa said Stibor would know what it was about.
我答应老爸我会去找斯蒂伯谈谈矿场银子不见的事。老爸说斯蒂伯知道怎么回事。

I was getting tired of riding around the countryside and wishing something would happen to break the monotony. And eventually something did - unfortunately. A little past Merhojed we saw smoke rising on the horizon. Kuno ordered the band to ride forward, and soon we arrived at the smouldering remains of a farmstead.
我已经厌倦了围着乡村闲逛，正期待有什么东西能打破这无聊的境地。最终还是出事了-真不幸。刚路过莫霍杰德的时候，我们看到天边升起一股浓烟。库诺当即下令部队前进，很快我们就到达了一处被烧毁的农场废墟。
Riding around the countryside constantly is tiring and seemingly unending, but I have to stick with Kuno's band, otherwise I'll be in trouble not only with Sir Radzig, but with Kuno too.
在乡村巡逻是令人疲倦的，似乎永远都没有歇脚的机会，但我不得不跟紧库诺的部队，不然我就会把拉德季大人和库诺都给得罪了。

It was necessary to search the burnt-out farm thoroughly. I didn't expect to find much in the way of clues in the ruins, so I was quite surprised to come across an armorial shield with a message attached to it in one of the buildings.
必须要全面搜查被烧毁的农场。我没指望能在废墟中找到什么线索，所以当我在一间房子里找到一块带字条的装甲盾牌时，还真是挺惊讶的。
I must scout out the burnt-out farm and see if there are any traces left of the raiders.
我必须搜索被烧毁的农场，找寻袭击者留下的线索。

Since the raiders couldn't have got far, I got to work trying to track them. It wasn't too difficult, since there were quite a few of them and they were loaded down with loot. I managed to track them to a clearing not far from the farm, where they were having a rest before moving on.
袭击者们应该还没跑太远，我得试图追踪他们。这绝非难事，毕竟敌寡我众，而且还携带着不少赃物。我成功在农场附近的一处空地上找到了他们，他们正在赶路之前做短暂休整。

I ought to have a look around in the vicinity of the farm and see if I can find any traces left by the raiders, because they can't have got very far yet. Fletching seems to know what he's doing as far as scouting is concerned. I could have a word with him.
我应该到农场周围搜查一番，看看有没有机会找到袭击者留下的线索，因为他们此时不会跑得太远。弗赖清看上去懂得搜查该从何入手。我可以去找他讨论一下。

I told Kuno about the message I found at the farm and he immediately recognised the crest - the coat of arms of the House of Zoul, a dangerous band in his opinion. Why they should be pillaging here in the province was a mystery to him though.
我把在农场找到的字条交给了库诺，他一下子就认出了那个徽章-是佐尔家族的像徽，在库诺眼里，佐尔家族是个劲敌。但是他们为何在此地兴风作浪，对于库诺来说仍然是个谜。
I should tell Kuno about the message I found. He'll know what to do next.
我应该把找到的字条交给库诺。他知道下一步该怎么做。
I tracked down the raiders. Their foul deeds shouldn't go unpunished and I'm sure Kuno will gladly help see to that.
我追到了袭击者。不能轻饶了他们的胡作非为，我确定这也是库诺想看到的结果。

I headed straight back to Rattay to report to Sir Radzig, who naturally was none to happy to hear the news I brought. It seems the House of Zoul, whose men raided the farm, have been engaged in a long-running feud with Sir Radzig and are out for vengeance. In his letter, Hagen Zoul even challenged Sir Radzig to a duel, but Sir Radzig would rather avoid that. I have to do something to stop the Zouls' campaign of provocation.
我直接回到了拉泰向拉德季大人汇报情况，他自然对我带来的消息甚是担忧。看上去这伙袭击农场的佐尔家族，曾经与拉德季大人长期针锋相对，现在出来寻仇。在这封信件其实是哈根·佐尔发给拉德季大人的一封挑战信，但拉德季大人不想应邀参加决斗。我得对佐尔的挑衅采取应对措施。
I must report to Sir Radzig.
我必须向拉德季大人报告。
Follow Kuno and help him to eliminate the raiders.
跟随库诺，协助他歼灭袭击者。
It seems a shield was found at the farm with the coat of arms of the House of Zoul and a message addressed to Sir Radzig, which bodes nothing good.
农场那边似乎是发现了一个带着佐尔家族徽章的盾牌，以及一条写给拉德季大人的字条，这不是个好兆头。
Somehow I lost track of time. I must ask Kuno how things turned out at the farm.
我不小心忽略了时间。我得问问库诺农场那边的情况。
Some thugs started making trouble for Johanka, kicking around the gifts people brought her and spreading offensive talk about her. I made sure they stopped and left her alone.
一些恶棍开始给乔汉卡制造麻烦，到处乱踢人们给她带来的礼物，并散布关于她的攻击性言论。我得确保她一个人的安宁。
Some thugs have been making trouble for Johanka. I should sort them out. I can probably find them hanging around the monastery gate during the day.
一些恶棍一直在给乔汉卡制造麻烦。我应该锤他们一顿。他们白天在修道院门口徘徊。
I should tell Johanka those thugs have been dealt with. She'll surely be glad to hear it.
我应该告诉乔汉卡那些恶棍已经被处理了。她听了一定会高兴的。

On the way we came across a girl who had fled from a nearby mill. She told us Hagen's men were pillaging there and feasting on the mill's supplies. So we attacked and dealt appropriately with the voracious rabble.
我们在途中遇到了一位从附近磨坊逃出来的姑娘。她告知我们哈根的人袭击了那里，并且在享用磨坊里的酒食。于是我们便出击，给了这帮贪婪的乌合之众应有的惩罚。
Hagen's band of brigands has taken over the windmill near Uzhitz and must be driven out!
哈根部队占领了尤兹茨附近的一个磨坊，我们要把他们赶走！

It's a good thing Josef is so popular in the area. Persuading the herb woman to brew a potion for him was child's play. I didn't even have to use the most extreme torture on her. In the end I succeeded in getting all the ingredients for the potion.
杰瑞在这个区域很受欢迎是件好事。说服采药婆沏药给他是件极简单的事。我甚至不需要用酷刑对她。最好我成功拿到了药剂所需要的成分。

It's a good thing Josef is so popular in the area. Persuading the herb woman to brew a potion for him was child's play. I didn't even have to use the most extreme torture on her. Only I had to get some ingredients for the potion: five pieces of charcoal, five thistles and five handfuls of nettles.
杰瑞在这个区域很受欢迎是件好事。说服采药婆沏药给他是件极简单的事。我甚至不需要用酷刑对她。我唯一要做的事就是取得药剂的成分：五个木炭、五个蓟和五个荨麻。
It turned out it was all a trap. Hagen's men surrounded us at the ford and a bloody engagement ensued. We barely made it back to the eastern bank and took cover in the woods.
我们发现这整个就是个全套。哈根的人在浅滩包围了我们，然后我们该死地短兵交接了。我们差点就回不到东岸，在森林里找掩护了。
We were ambushed, just as we were crossing the ford. This is no time for heroism, better to beat a hasty retreat.
我们穿过浅滩的时候中了埋伏。现在没时间逞英雄了，最好还是打退堂鼓吧。

My first task was to go to Sir Kuno's encampment on the hill between Rattay and Ledetchko. I was given a warm welcome and was introduced to the members of the merry band - at least those who were conscious. Then I met Sir Kuno himself, who was happy to have a guide, but had no intention of dragging any dead weight with him.
我的首要任务是前往库诺大人的营地，就在拉泰和拉迪亚茨克之间的山上。我受到了热情的招待，被介绍给了一群正在欢宴的人群-至少还没喝蒙的那几个认得我。之后我见到了库诺大人本人。他很欢迎我这个顾问的到来，但没想让我拖他的后腿。
First I have to go to Sir Kuno's camp and report to him.
我得先去库诺大人的营地向他报告。

I had to prove I could handle a weapon by duelling with Dangler. It was obvious right from the start that Kuno's men were no greenhorns, but in the end I showed I had what it took and Kuno accepted me into the company.
我得与丹格勒过招，以证明我的身手。第一眼看上去库诺的手下绝非等闲之辈，然而最终我还是向他们展示了我的实力，库诺答应让我加入他们。
To prove to Kuno that I know what I'm doing in combat, I have to duel with his man Dangler and put on a good show of skill.
为了向库诺证明我是个合格的战士，我得与他的手下丹格勒过招，尽可能地展示我的能力。
The first expedition with Kuno's band is ahead of me. The Chief wants to set off at first light.
库诺部队的第一次出征就在眼前。长官下令，天明启程。
Kuno's band needs to keep patrolling, and me with them.
我需要和库诺部队一起进行巡逻。
We have to keep up the patrols. Hagen's pillaging must be nipped in the bud.
我们必须要进行巡逻。哈根的阴谋一定得被扼杀在摇篮里。

It looks like Jakey betrayed Kuno. Apart from anything else, he was the one who brought us the information that unfamiliar horsemen had been seen, he went on ahead before we reached the ford and now he's nowhere to be seen.
看起来杰克背叛了库诺。不管怎么样，他是告诉我们有陌生骑手出没这条情报的人，他在我们抵达浅前就过去了，现在他不见人影。
We'll have to figure out what to do next. I'd better hear what Kuno has to say.
我们得搞明白接下来该干什么。我最好去听听库诺怎么说。

Either Jakey didn't expect us to survive the ambush, or he hadn't the good sense to vanish while he had the chance. Instead he went to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. By the time I got there, he was gone, and the people there weren't very forthcoming about where he went. It took a bit of persuasion, but in the end I found out he'd been drinking with some merchant's daughter called Maria and the two had then gone off together into the night.
要么杰克以为我们不能活着走出埋伏了，要么是他不够灵光，没在该消失的时候消失。他去了林间旅店花他靠背叛而得来的钱。当我到那里的时候他已经走了，而且那里的人对他的行踪也说得语焉不详。我费了点功夫说服他们，好在最后我查到他在和一个叫玛莉亚的商人的女儿一起喝酒，而且这两人一起在夜色中离开了。

Either Jakey didn't expect us to survive the ambush, or he hadn't the good sense to vanish while he had the chance. Instead he went to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. He's probably gone by now, but I should certainly go there and find out what I can.
要么杰克以为我们不能活着走出埋伏了，要么是他不够灵光，没在该消失的时候消失。他去了林间旅店花他靠背叛而得来的钱。他大概现在已经走了，但我还是应该去那里看看，能查出什么是什么。

Some of the people at the Inn had seen Jakey and Maria running to the pine forest to the south of there. I started looking for them there. Clearly they were both full of drunken cheer and had left behind quite a trail.
酒馆的有些人曾见到杰克和玛莉亚去了南边的松林。于是我开始在那边寻找他们。显然他们都醉得不轻，一路上留下了不少痕迹。

Some of the people at the Inn saw Jakey and Maria running to the pine forest to the south of there. I should start looking for them there. Maria's father went looking for them too, so there's a chance I might run into him.
酒馆的有些人曾见到杰克和玛莉亚去了南边的松林。我应该去那边找找他们。玛莉亚的父亲也去找他们了，所以我也许能碰到他。
After I'd heard Jakey's story about Maria, it was clear to me she wouldn't be going back to her father in a hurry. Apparently she didn't hold him in very high regard.
在我听过玛莉亚和杰克的故事之后，显然她不会很快就回到她爸爸的身边。似乎她不是很把她爸爸当回事。

I ran into Maria's father, a merchant called Ernest, who's also looking for her, although he doesn't seem to be putting much effort into it. He's just standing at the edge of the woods and calling out to her. Anyway, I promised I'd help him find his daughter.
我找到了玛莉亚的爸爸，一个叫欧内斯特的商人，他也在找她，即使他看上去并没有很努力地去找。他仅仅只是在树林旁站着叫她。不过，我承诺过要帮他找到他女儿。
I found Jakey tied to a tree deep in the woods, which is rather convenient for interrogating him, which I should do now.
我发现杰克被绑在了林子里的一棵树上了，这对于审问他来说真的是太方便了，我现在就得去审问审问。

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. I intervened and reminded Kuno of his honour, albeit a mercenary's honour. Fortunately I convinced him and Hagen had no choice but to fight. It was a tough battle, but in the end we got the better of them.
我们在萨莫培什附近的野地里赶上了哈根和他的手下们。哈根本想和库诺谈判，想要提供给他一大笔钱，换他离开这地方然后再也不插手。我介入之后提醒库诺要注意他的荣誉，尽管他是个雇佣兵。幸运的是我说服了他，哈根别无选择只能与我一战。那场战斗相当激烈，但最终我们赢了。

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. I intervened and reminded Kuno of his honour, albeit a mercenary's honour. Fortunately I convinced him and Hagen had no choice but to fight. It was a tough battle and one we couldn't win. I had to retreat from the battlefield to save my life.
我们在萨莫培什附近的野地里赶上了哈根和他的手下们。哈根本想和库诺谈判，想要提供给他一大笔钱，换他离开这地方然后再也不插手。我介入之后提醒库诺要注意他的荣誉，尽管他是个雇佣兵。幸运的是我说服了他，哈根别无选择只能与我一战。那场战斗相当激烈，我们无法取胜。为了保命我只好从战场撤退。
We face Hagen and his men on the field of battle. They must be defeated!
我们在战场上遇到了哈根和他的手下们。必须要打败他们！

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. Kuno, unscrupulous mercenary that he is, took Hagen's money and rode away with his men. Hagen thought it was all over, but I appealed to his honour and challenged him to a duel, which I won in the name of my liege lord, Sir Radzig.
我们在萨莫培什附近的野地里赶上了哈根和他的手下们。哈根本想和库诺谈判，想要提供给他一大笔钱，换他离开这地方然后再也不插手。库诺这个不择手段的雇佣兵选择拿了钱带着他的手下走人。哈根以为事情已经告一段落，但我出现了，告诉他要注意自己的荣誉，并向他发起了决斗。我以我效忠的拉德季大人之名，赢得了决斗。

We caught up with Hagen and his men in a field near Samopesh. Hagen wanted to parley with Kuno and offered him quite a pile of coin to leave the province and interfere no more. Kuno, unscrupulous mercenary that he is, took Hagen's money and rode away with his men. Hagen thought it was all over, but I appealed to his honour and challenged him to a duel. Unfortunately, I was no match for him and had to beat a tactical retreat.
我们在萨莫培什附近的野地里赶上了哈根和他的手下们。哈根本想和库诺谈判，想要提供给他一大笔钱，换他离开这地方然后再也不插手。库诺这个不择手段的雇佣兵选择拿了钱带着他的手下走人。哈根以为事情已经告一段落，但我出现了，告诉他要注意自己的荣誉，并向他发起了决斗。不幸的是，我根本不是他的对手，我只好进行战术性撤退。
I challenged Hagen Zoul to a duel! I must defeat him!
我向哈根·佐尔提出了决斗！我必须要战胜他！

There's not enough coin in the trunk to pay wages, so the artisans have put down their tools and the traders have closed shop. If the village is to start working again, there has to be enough coin there overnight.
箱子里的资金不够支付工钱了，工艺人罢了工，商人关张了商店。要想让村庄的运营重回正轨，今夜就要补充资金。
I suspect this so-called Musk of Infinite Allure will attract nothing but flies. But Sir Hans was very happy with it and went at once to prepare for his rendezvous. Bon courage!
我怀疑这个所谓的麝香春药除了苍蝇之外什么都吸引不来。但是汉斯大人很高兴，并且立刻去准备他的约会去了。好胆量！
I've got the potion for Sir Hans. Now to deliver it to him, so he can embark on his amorous adventure in proper French style.
我拿到给汉斯大人的药剂了，现在我要把药剂带给他，好让他开始他的法式浪漫冒险。

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.
圣母玛利亚又出现在乔汉卡面前，她决定再去传道。这次她不想在广场上布道，而是想在城外的草地上布道。我陪她去听她的布道。这让我脊背发凉。

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she'd rather not preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I should accompany her to make sure nothing happens to her. Anyway, I'm curious what she'll say this time.
圣母玛利亚又出现在乔汉卡面前，她决定再去布道。这次她宁愿不在广场上布道，而在城外的草地上。我应该陪着她，确保她不会出事。不管怎样，我很好奇她这次会说什么。

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.
圣母玛利亚又出现在乔汉卡面前，她决定再去传道。这次她不想在广场上布道，而是想在城外的草地上布道。我陪她去听她的布道。这让我脊背发凉。
Johanka wanted me to escort her, but I didn't make it. I'd better go and see her again.
乔汉卡想让我护送她，但我没能做到。我最好再去找她看看。

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she'd rather not preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I should accompany her to make sure nothing happens to her and anyway, I'm curious what she'll say this time. I should pick her up at dawn and I'd better not be late.
圣母玛利亚又出现在乔汉卡面前，她决定再去布道。这次她宁愿不在广场上布道，而在城外的草地上。我应该陪着她，确保她不会出事。不管怎样，我很好奇她这次会说什么。我应该在黎明时去接她，最好不要迟到。

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. I accompanied her there and listened to her sermon. It sent shivers down my spine.
圣母玛利亚又出现在乔汉卡面前，她决定再去传道。这次她不想在广场上布道，而是想在城外的草地上布道。我陪她去听她的布道。这让我脊背发凉。

The Virgin Mary appeared again to Johanka and she decided to go and preach again. This time she didn't want to preach on the square, but in a meadow outside of town. She wanted me to escort her and she wasn't at all happy when I turned up late. She'll be waiting for me at dawn again and this time I'd better not let her down.
圣母玛利亚又出现在乔汉卡面前，她决定再去布道。这次她宁愿不在广场上布道，而在城外的草地上。她要我护送她，当我迟到时，她一点也不高兴。她还是在黎明时等我，这次我最好别让她失望。
I'd better get back to the Bailiff quickly and let him know how I got on.
我最好当即向执政官报告，让他知道我的进展。
If I'd know what trials I'd have to endure to get Sir Hans' necklace back, I'd have told him politely to find himself some other lackey. But at least he was truly delighted to have it back.
如果我当初知道我为了拿回汉斯大人的项链要经受什么样的考验，我就该礼貌地让他另寻高明。但是至少他拿到了项链之后真的很开心。
I've got the necklace at last! Now to get it to Sir Hans.
我终于拿到了项链！现在把它交给汉斯大人。

While Sir Hans went up to Karolina's room to "claim his prize", I had to keep her father busy and above all make sure he didn't catch Sir Hans with his hose around his ankles, otherwise there'd be hell to pay!
当汉斯大人去卡洛丽娜的房间里“拿他的奖励”的时候，我得让她的父亲忙着，不能让汉斯大人在脱了裤子的时候被他抓住，不然事情可就大了！
I couldn't keep the butcher at bay long enough. It seems the art of conversation isn't his strongest point. Or mine.
我可没办法拖住屠夫太久。看起来谈话的艺术可不是他最擅长的领域。也不是我的。
Sir Hans went up to Karolina's and left me outside to keep watch and buy him enough time to finish what he started without interruption.
汉斯大人去找卡洛丽娜了，把我留在外面望风，给他争取足够的时间，让他能不被打扰地干完事情。
The Marigold decoction did the trick - Sir Hans' rash has cleared up. We can go a-courting!
金盏花药剂发挥了作用——汉斯大人的疹子消退了。我们可以去追妹子了！
By the time I managed to get hold of the Marigold decoction, Sir Hans' rash had already cleared up on its own.
当我想办法拿到金盏花药剂的时候，汉斯大人的疹子已经自己消退了。
When Karolina's father, the butcher, pounced on me in front of their house, I decided the best course of action was to run for my life. Sir Hans won't be too pleased about it...
当卡洛丽娜的父亲，那个屠夫，在房前扑过来抓我的时候，我觉得我最好还是逃命吧。汉斯大人对此可不会开心的……
I'm supposed to be keeping watch at the butcher's house. I'd better get back there, or Sir Hans might get caught.
我应该在屠夫的房子边上望风的，我应该回去，不然汉斯大人可能会被抓住。
I'm amazed! Johanka spoke like she was completely transformed. Like a real prophet! I really didn't expect that of her. And I'd say she made quite an impression on her listeners.
太惊奇了！乔汉卡说起话来像是完全欢乐一个人。就像一个真正的先知！真没想到，她肯定给听众留下了深刻的印象。
Johanka set off in the morning to the market square to share her visions with the people. I wasn't there for it, so I should go and ask her how it went.
乔汉卡早上就出发去市场上，分享她所见的幻象给人们了。我没去，所以该问问她进展如何。
Johanka is planning to share the Virgin Mary's message with the people. I ought to offer her a few words of encouragement.
乔汉卡早上就出发去市场上，分享她所见的幻象给人们了。我该给她打打气。
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
我在林边找到了袭击者的踪迹。我应该跟着踪迹，看它会把我引到哪里。
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
我在林边找到了袭击者的踪迹。我应该跟着踪迹，看它会把我引到哪里。
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
我在林边找到了袭击者的踪迹。我应该跟着踪迹，看它会把我引到哪里。
I picked up the raiders' trail at the edge of the woods. I should follow it and see where it leads me.
我在林边找到了袭击者的踪迹。我应该跟着踪迹，看它会把我引到哪里。
I talked to Stibor about what to do next. It turns out the best option is if I go into the mine to get the silver.
我和斯蒂伯谈过接下来怎么做了。现在最好的选择就是我去矿洞里拿白银。
I have to talk to Stibor about what to do next.
我得跟斯蒂伯聊聊接下来怎么做。

I finally got the gossip to tell me how Lev ended up, and it's no wonder she was reluctant to talk about it. When some arsonist was starting fires in Ledetchko, the villagers were sure Lev was the culprit and set fire to his house with him inside! But the fires didn't stop, so he was innocent...
长舌妇终于把列夫生命的终曲告诉了我，难怪她迟迟不愿提起。一群纵火犯让拉迪亚茨克燃起熊熊大火之时，村民们当即认定列夫就是罪魁祸首，将他烧死在了他的家中！但大火并没有就此熄灭，这证明他是清白的……
The gossip refuses to talk to me anymore. She's very sensitive about the whole affair and I must have pressed her too much. Now I'll never know how things ended up with Lev.
长舌妇拒绝再和我说话了。她对这件事非常敏感，而我又逼她太紧了。现在我无从得知列夫究竟是怎么死的了。
I should ask the gossip about a good place to bury Lev's remains. Without letting on what I'm up to, of course...
我应该去问问长舌妇把列夫的遗骸埋在什么地方合适。当然了，不要让她知道我要干什么……

I've got to get back Sir Hans' necklace, which he lost at dice in Ledetchko before realising it was just the thing to help him win the hand of the "love of his life". Naturally, any task for Capon would have to be as complicated as possible. The man who won it from him lost it to another player, some nobleman travelling to Sasau...
我得把汉斯大人的项链弄回来，那是他之前在拉迪亚茨克玩骰子的时候输掉的，那时候他还没意识到它正是能帮他赢到他“此生挚爱”的手的决胜法宝。自然，为卡蓬办的任何事都没有最复杂只有更复杂。赢走那项链的人已经把它输给了另一个人，某个要去莎邵旅行的贵族……

I've got to get back Sir Hans' necklace, which he lost at dice in Ledetchko. Naturally, no task for Capon would be simple. The man who won it from him lost it to another player, some nobleman travelling to Sasau. And as if that weren't enough, this nobleman was murdered and robbed and the necklace ended up in the camp of a robber baron!
我得把汉斯大人的项链弄回来，那是他之前在拉迪亚茨克玩骰子的时候输掉的。自然，卡蓬的任何任务都不会简单。赢走那项链的人已经把它输给了另一个人，某个要去莎邵旅行的贵族。这还不够，这个贵族已经被杀了，项链被抢走了，现在它在一个强盗贵族的营地里！
I know the murderer stole Sir Alphonse's dice. And apparently they're not easy to overlook - they were made specially, are red and gold and one of them has a devil's head in place of the one.
我知道杀手偷走了阿方斯大人的骰子。而且显然，它们很难被错过——它们是特制的，红色和金色，其中一个的一点是恶魔的头。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by the fellow they call Noggin.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被一个外号叫做脑哥的人抢劫然后杀害的。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by the fellow they call Berta.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被一个叫做贝塔的人抢劫然后杀害的。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed someone called Pechuna.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被一个叫做佩丘纳的人抢劫然后杀害的。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by Sir Erhart himself.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被厄哈特大人自己抢劫然后杀害的。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by someone called Mladota.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被一个叫做姆拉多塔的人抢劫然后杀害的。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by the wench who hangs around at the robbers' camp.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被一个流连在强盗营地附近的女人抢劫然后杀害的。
I told Sir Anselm that Sir Alphonse was robbed and killed by old Blaha.
我告诉安塞尔姆大人，阿方斯大人是被老布拉哈抢劫然后杀害的。
Bianca wanted me to come back to her after bringing the beer to Henry. I did what she asked and went back to see what else she wanted.
比安卡想让我在把酒拿给亨利后去找她。我帮她送完了酒，然后回去看看她还有什么事
Bianca wanted me to come back to her after bringing the beer to Henry. I didn't go back to her though.
比安卡想让我在把酒拿给亨利后去找她。但我没回去找她
I took the beer as Bianca wanted, but she wants something else as well. I have to go and see her as soon as I can.
我帮比安卡把酒带过去了，但她还有些事。我得赶尽回去找她
At least I know now of a good place to bury Lev's remains - in a meadow near Ledetchko, where he buried his wife and child. What better place for him to find rest at last?
至少我知道了一处埋葬列夫的遗骸的好地方-拉迪亚茨克附近的一块草地上，他在那里埋葬了他的妻儿。还有什么地方比那里更适合他安息呢？
I won the tournament and Blaha gave me the key to the chest containing my winnings, including one very elusive necklace.
我赢了大奖赛，布拉哈给了我箱子的钥匙，箱子里有我的奖品，包括那条长了腿似的项链。
I won the dice tournament and all the prizes are mine! I have to go to Blaha for my winnings.
我赢得了骰子大奖赛，奖品都是我的了！我要去找布拉哈要奖品。
Blaha told me young Pechuna won the tournament, collected his winnings and left for Sasau to celebrate.
布拉哈告诉我年轻的佩丘纳赢得了大奖赛，取走了他的奖品之后去莎邵庆祝了。
However won the tournament has taken all the winnings, including the necklace. I'd better find out from old Blaha who it was.
骰子大奖赛的赢家把奖品都拿走了，包括那条项链。我得去找布拉哈问出是谁赢了。
I found Pechuna in Sasau and got Capon's necklace back from him. Thank Christ!
我在莎邵找到了佩丘纳，然后从他那里拿回了卡蓬的项链。感谢上帝！
Pechuna the charcoal-burner won Capon's necklace. I'll have to try and get it from him before he sells it, loses it, or gets robbed! He'll be drinking at the tavern in Sasau.
烧炭工佩丘纳赢走了卡蓬的项链。在他把它卖了之前，或者在他被抢劫之前，我得试着从他手里拿到它！他要去莎邵的酒馆里喝酒。

I didn't think the Custodian would just let Sir Erhart and his merry band go, but apparently that's what happened. Anyway, the encampment is cleared and there's nothing to stop me from going and getting the necklace.
我不觉得守卫会直接放厄哈特大人和他的人走，但显然事情就这么发生了。不管怎么说，营地现在清空了，什么也没法阻止我拿到那条项链了。
I managed to get my dice back, thank heavens! That little amorous adventure nearly cost me dear!
我设法要回了我的骰子，感谢上帝！那小小的爱情冒险差点让我血亏！
I only realised later that that light-fingered wench took my dice! I'd better catch her before she vanishes, otherwise I'll never see them again.
我后来才意识到那个顺手牵羊的女人偷走了我的骰子！我得在她消失之前抓到她，不然我这辈子都见不到它们了。
My guess paid off. I found Pechuna in the tavern, happily drinking away his dice winnings.
我猜对了。我在酒馆里找到了佩丘纳，正在拿着奖金大喝特喝呢。
Someone must have won the dice tournament and left with the loot before Sir Erhart's merry band was routed. If it was someone local, he'll surely be drinking away his winnings in the nearest tavern.
肯定有人在厄哈特大人的人手被打败之前赢得了骰子大奖赛，之后拿着东西走了。如果是某个当地人的话，他肯定会在最近的酒馆里消费掉他的奖品。

Bianca wanted to pick some herbs to brew a special schnapps for Henry, but she was afraid to go into the woods alone, because someone saw a wolf there. I promised to accompany her, in the belief that there's safety in numbers.
比安卡想去采集一些草药，为亨利熬制一种特制烈酒，但她不想一个人进树林，因为有人说林子里有狼出没。我答应和她同去，人多力量大。

Bianca wanted to pick some herbs to brew a special schnapps for Henry, but she was afraid to go into the woods alone, because someone saw a wolf there. I promised to accompany her, but in the end I left her on her own.
比安卡想去采集一些草药，为亨利熬制一种特制烈酒，但她不想一个人进树林，因为有人说林子里有狼出没。我答应和她同去，但我把她扔下了。
Together we don't have to fear the wolf, so I promised to accompany Bianca. We're to meet near the bridge.
一起走就不怕狼出没了，因此我答应陪比安卡采草药。我们约好在桥边碰头。
I talked to Papa, and he wants me to run quite a few errands this morning.
父亲跟我说了两句，他今早给了我不少差事
Papa is up and about. I should ask him if he needs anything.
父亲应该醒了，我得问问他需不需要我做什么
I found the sack of stolen silver in the flooded mineshaft.
我在被淹没的矿井里找到了那袋被偷的白银。
Now it's all up to me. I have to find the stolen sack of silver without getting caught.
现在全靠我了。我得在不被抓到的情况下找到那袋白银。
The battle is over. Now it's time to report back to Sir Radzig.
战斗结束了。现在是时候回去向拉德季大人汇报了
I must find out how things ended up with Hagen.
我得去查出哈根的事是怎么结束的
I talked to Father. The business with Tobias Feyfar will work itself out somehow, but now I have other things to deal with.
我跟神父谈了谈。托拜厄斯·费法尔的事会好起来的，但现在我还有其他事呢。
I should talk to Father about last night. He won't be happy that I didn't go to see Master Feyfar.
我该跟神父解释一下昨晚的事。我没去见费法尔大人，他有些不满。
Pa sent me to get the nails and I finally picked them up at the blacksmith's.
爸爸让我去拿钉子，我终于在铁匠铺拿到了钉子。
The blacksmith didn't have the nails done for Pa yesterday. He was busy forging a sword for Sir Radzig. He should have them today though.
昨天铁匠没有给爸爸做钉子。他正忙着为拉德季大人锻造一把剑。不过他今天应该做好了。
Samuel is in the mines. I ran into Fritz and Matthew and they led me to him.
塞穆尔还在矿场。我遇到了弗利兹和马修，他们带我去找他了。
I must find Samuel! He's working at the mines, but I don't know which gallery he's in today and besides, he could have fled to any of them. I have to find him and save him!
我必须得找到塞穆尔！他在矿场工作，但我不知道他今天在哪条矿道里，况且他可能已经逃走了。我必须得去救他！
I went back to Sir Hans. He gave me another chance, so we'll go to Karolina's again.
我回到了汉斯大人身边。他给了我第二次机会，所以我们又一起去了卡洛丽娜家。
I dallied too much while following Sir Hans to Karolina's and lost him. His Young Lordship certainly won't be happy about it. I should get back to him, or all my efforts will have been for nothing.
我跟着汉斯大人去卡洛丽娜家的路上耽搁了太久，把他跟丢了。年轻的领主大人肯定会不高兴的。我得回去找他，不然我的努力就付之东流了。
If I'm to find this cave, I'll have to start where Johanka said. I must find the footbridge beneath Skalitz Castle that leads to the waterworks next to the woods.
要是想找到这个洞，我就必须的按照乔汉卡说的来。我必须得找到人行桥，它通向林子旁的水厂而且就在斯卡里茨城堡正后方。

I went to the place Johanka described from her dream and found the cave, or rather an abandoned mineshaft near the woods. At the end of it I met with a terrible sight - corpses, lots of them, decomposing.
我到了乔汉卡梦中的地方，找到了那个洞，确切的说事林子旁的一个矿井。井底的景象真可怕——堆积成山的尸体，正在慢慢腐烂。
I went to the place Johanka described from her dream and found the cave, or rather an abandoned mineshaft near the woods. Now to look inside...
我到了乔汉卡梦中的地方，找到了那个洞，确切的说事林子旁的一个矿井。往里看……
The corpses fell down the shaft from above. I found a bloody trail at the mouth of the shaft that led to nearby huts.
尸体是从矿井上方扔进去的。我在竖井口发现了一条血迹，通往附近的小屋。

These corpses didn't get here on their own. Maybe someone carried them in here, although it's more likely they fell down the shaft, or rather were pushed. I should go and see where it opens out above.
这些尸体可不是自己掉下去的。或许是某人抬过来的，虽然看起来更像是掉下去，或者被推下去的。我该去看看上面到底是什么地方。
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. I gave him a nice treat.
丁丁之前也是早上喂的，它的吃食十分丰盛。
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. But he'll have to wait a while.
丁丁之前也是早上喂的，但它得等一会了。
Tinker is used to getting fed in the morning. I should give him something.
丁丁之前也是早上喂的，我该给他喂点什么。
After a little persuasion, Bianca's brother, Adam, lent me his bow and a few arrows.
三言两语过后，比安卡的兄弟，亚当，便把他的弓箭借给我了。
I didn't get the bow and arrows from Bianca's brother, Adam.
我没向比安卡的兄弟，亚当，要来弓箭。
Bianca's brother, Adam, has a bow he could lend us, or rather me. Bianca says he likes me and I should easily convince him. Like his sister, he works at the tavern.
比安卡的兄弟，亚当，可以把弓箭借给我们，确切地说，是借给我一用。比安卡说他对我有意思，我可以轻而易举地说动他。和她的妹妹一样，他也在酒馆跑堂。
I went and parleyed with Sir Erhart and despite Sir Anselm's warnings, it turned out quite well. I doubt poor Alphonse could have managed any better, God rest his soul.
我置安塞尔姆大人的警告于不顾，去和厄哈特大人谈判了。结果还不错。我猜可怜的阿方斯也没法做得更好了。上帝保佑他的灵魂安息。
Sir Erhart will receive me now, but Sir Anselm warned me to avoid negotiating with him. I could easily betray myself if I say the wrong thing.
厄哈特大人现在就要接待我了，但是安塞尔姆大人警告过我，不要和他谈判。如果我说错话会很容易把自己卖了的。

He thought it would help him out of a predicament. To convince Sir Hanush that he wasn't wasting time on frivolous pursuits, he told him he was training his page in knightly arts. His "page" meaning me, so what could I do but sign up for the tourney?
他认为这么做会帮他脱离窘境。为了让瀚纳仕大人相信自己并没有把时间浪费在寻欢作乐上面，汉斯少主告诉他自己正在给侍从传授骑士之道。他的“侍从”就是我，除了去参加比武，还有其他路可走吗？

Sir Hans got himself into a bit of a fix with his uncle. To convince Sir Hanush that he wasn't wasting time on frivolous pursuits, he told him he was training his page in knightly arts. His "page" meaning me. So I told His Young Lordship I'd enrol to help him out, but I didn't do it.
汉斯少主和他叔叔闹矛盾了。为了让瀚纳仕大人相信自己并没有把时间浪费在寻欢作乐上面，汉斯少主告诉他自己正在给侍从传授骑士之道。他的“侍从”就是我。当时向少主承诺过会去参加比赛帮他渡过难关，但终究还是没办这事儿。

Sir Hans got himself into a bit of a fix with his uncle. To convince Sir Hanush that he wasn't wasting time on frivolous pursuits, he told him he was training his page in knightly arts. His "page" meaning me, so what can I do but go and see the herald at the Upper Castle and sign up for the Rattay Tourney?
汉斯少主和他叔叔闹矛盾了。为了让瀚纳仕大人相信自己并没有把时间浪费在寻欢作乐上面，汉斯少主告诉他自己正在给侍从传授骑士之道。他的“侍从”就是我，这下除了乖乖去上层城堡找竞技场管理员报名参加比武大会，还有什么其他选择呢？
Now I should let Sir Hans know how I've fared as his page.
现在是时候向汉斯少主展示一下他的学徒的实力了
Bianca picked herbs while I kept my eyes peeled for the wolf.
比安卡采草药的时候，我负责帮她防着狼。
Bianca picked herbs while I kept a look out, but I didn't do a good job. I left her alone and went my own way.
比安卡采草药的时候，我负责看着她，但我失职了。我把她一个人丢下了，然后自顾自地走了。
Bianca is picking herbs while I keep watch, because you never know where danger may be lurking.
比安卡采草药的时候，我负责看着她，因为这里危机四伏。
I found Bianca, who'd fled from the wolf. In exchange for my help, she offered to make some schnapps for me too. I should go and pick it up tomorrow.
我找到比安卡了，她刚从狼口逃生。为了感谢我的帮助，她也要为我熬制一些烈酒。我明天去取。
Bianca fled from the wolf and I didn't go looking for her. Hopefully she got away safely.
比安卡狼口逃生，我没去找她。但愿她平安归来。
Bianca fled. I should go and find her now it's all over.
比安卡逃跑了。我得去找到她，一切就告一段落。
The wolf really did turn up... or rather a mangy old dog, but as hungry and mean-looking as any wolf. Fortunately it all ended well.
狼现身了……要么就是一条臭老狗，像狼一样贪婪凶恶。好在我们躲过了一劫。
The wolf really did turn up... or rather a mangy old dog, but as hungry and mean-looking as any wolf. We had to run for our lives, but it all ended well.
狼现身了……要么就是一条臭老狗，像狼一样贪婪凶恶。我们撒腿就跑，好在躲过了一劫。
The wolf has attacked us! I have to drive him away somehow!
狼咬过来了！我得把它赶走！
Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Fortunately, it wasn't the last tourney - I could still enrol in another, which I did, saving His Young Lordship from his uncle's wrath.
汉斯少主对我相当不满意。好在，比武大会不止这一场-我参加了接下来的比赛，把汉斯少主从他叔叔的震怒之下救了出来。
Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Fortunately, it's not the last tourney - I can enrol in the next one and still save His Young Lordship from his uncle's wrath.
汉斯少主对我相当不满意。好在，比武大会不止这一场-我还可以参加接下来的比赛，把汉斯少主从他叔叔的震怒之下救出来。
Johanka is troubled by a recurring nightmare. I ought to ask her about it. After all, that's what friends are for.
乔汉卡被一个反复出现的噩梦所困扰。我应该问问她这件事。毕竟这是作为朋友该做的。

Johanka was troubled by a recurring nightmare set in a particular place, so I went there and found there a dreadful murderer. After that was solved, Johanka stopped having the dream, but then she started having another, in which she was again visited by the Virgin Mary. Johanka's interpretation was that Our Lady wanted her to pass on a message to the people.
乔汉卡最近总是做同一个噩梦，且梦发生在一个特定的地方，于是我去到那里，发现了一个可怕的谋杀犯。他被绳之以法之后，乔汉卡不再做这个梦了，却开始做另外一个梦，梦中圣母玛利亚再次来访。乔汉卡认为圣母玛利亚想让她向世人传递一个消息。

Johanka is being troubled by a persistent nightmare set in a particular place. I promised her I'd go and try and find the locations she dreamt of. Maybe it will help her if I find out what's really there.
乔汉卡最近总是做同一个噩梦，且梦发生在一个特定的地方。我答应她会试着去寻找她梦中的地方。如果我搞清楚那里究竟发生了什么，或许能帮到她。

When I told Sir Hans how I got on in the tourney, he said Sir Hanush had seen me there, so there was a good chance he'd get off his back and leave him to pursue his own interests. Such as hunting, drinking, whoring...
当我向汉斯少主汇报参加比武大会的情况时，他告诉我瀚纳仕大人在会场看到我的表现了，所以很有可能会放他一马，将他放虎归山、放飞自我。比如说打猎、喝酒、泡女人……

Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Fortunately, it wasn't the last tourney, so he told me to go and enrol in one of the upcoming ones. However, I didn't do that either and he gave me a right ear-bashing about it. I think it'll be a while before he cools down.
汉斯少主对我相当不满意。好在，比武大会不止这一场，因此他让我去参加接下来的比赛。但是，后来的比赛我也没去参加，而他为此大骂了我一顿。我想他这回的一肚子闷气八成一时半会儿消不下去了。

Johanka asked me to find the place she sees in her nightmare. She described the way there that she walks in her dream - across a footbridge over a stream towards the waterworks next to the woods, with Skalitz Castle behind her. Then she goes past the waterworks to a rocky stream and follows it up to the mouth of the cave nearby.
乔汉卡请求我去找她梦里的地方。她向我描述了她梦中走的路——穿过立于溪上的人行桥，走向林子边的水厂，斯卡里茨城堡就在她身后。然后她经过水厂来到石壑溪流，紧随其后的就是山洞口了。
I made sure that murderer met with the justice he deserved. His reign of terror is over.
我确保那个杀人犯得到应有的惩罚。他的恐怖统治结束了。
I must put a stop to that murderer's exploits. Either I'll have to deal with him myself of tell Sir Radzig and let him deal with the matter.
我必须阻止那个杀人犯。要么我自己解决他，要么告诉拉德季大人，让他来处理这件事。
I'm not sure how the two things are connected, but ever since I dealt with that murderer, Johanka's sleep has been free of that nightmare.
我不懂这两件事怎么联系到一起的，但我解决了那个杀人犯之后，乔汉卡就摆脱了那个噩梦。

My investigation has come to an end. I don't know what else I could look for around here. There was no devil, but evil there was in abundance. I should go and tell Johanka about it. Maybe knowing the truth will put an end to her nightmare.
我的调查结束了。我不知道在这附近还能找到什么。那里没有魔鬼，罪恶的行径却在那肆意开展。我该告诉乔汉卡这件事。也许真相会叫她摆脱噩梦。
Sir Hans Capon is presently busy with a certain matter that absolutely must take precedence over our mission to Trosky Castle - the pursuit of true love. Trosky will just have to wait.
汉斯·卡蓬少主眼下正在忙一件比出使特罗斯基堡更要紧的事-追求爱情。特罗斯基的事儿只能推后了。
Now I should let Sir Hans know how I've fared as his page.
现在是时候向汉斯少主展示一下他的学徒的实力了

I listened to the whole tragic story and I decided to try and find out what I could about it. The best way was to enrol in the tournament myself. The prime suspect was one of the combatants, Peter, who was known as Black Peter for the colour of the armour he wore. But although I asked around at the tourney, I wasn't able to find out anything convincing.
我倾听了这个悲剧的始末，决定去尽力调查这件事。最好的途径就是去亲自参加比武大会。主要嫌疑人正是选手之一，彼得。此人为其一身黑色盔甲而得名“黑彼得”。我在比武大会上四下打探了一番，可还是没能找到有效的证据。

I listened to the whole tragic story and I decided to try and find out what I could about it. The best way is to enrol in the tournament myself. The prime suspect is one of the combatants, Peter, who is known as Black Peter for the colour of the armour he wears.
我倾听了这个悲剧的始末，决定去尽力调查这件事。最好的途径就是去亲自参加比武大会。主要嫌疑人正是选手之一，彼得。此人为其一身黑色盔甲而得名“黑彼得”。
The blacksmith was disappointed, but he thanked me for trying at least.
铁匠有些失望，但他对我的尝试表达了感谢。
I should let the blacksmith know how I got on.
我应该去向铁匠汇报我的进展。

I'd given up on the whole investigation, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me! I told the blacksmith about it and we both agreed the same thing must have happened to his son. Of course it won't bring Svatopluk back, but at least his father has some peace of mind from knowing the truth.
我本想放弃这毫无头绪的调查，但事情突然有了转机-黑彼得偷袭了我！我把这件事告诉了铁匠，我们一致认为他的儿子也受到了同样的袭击。这当然不会让斯瓦托普鲁克重回人世，但至少得知真相的父亲会获得宽慰。

I'd given up on the whole investigation into Svatopluk's death, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me! I should tell the blacksmith about it.
我本想放弃对斯瓦托普鲁克死因毫无头绪的调查，但事情突然有了转机-黑彼得偷袭了我！我应该向铁匠汇报这件事。

I'd heard the whole tragic story of Svatopluk's death and it soon became clear to me who the culprit was. Who other than Black Peter, who sneakily lay in wait and ambushed me after I'd won the tourney? I told the blacksmith about it and we both agreed the same thing must have happened to his son. Of course it won't bring Svatopluk back, but I could see it game his father some peace of mind.
我倾听了斯瓦托普鲁克之死的悲剧始末，很快我就想到凶手是谁了。谁会比在我赢下比武大会之后偷袭我的黑彼得嫌疑更大呢？我把这件事告诉了铁匠，我们一致认为他的儿子也受到了同样的袭击。这当然不会让斯瓦托普鲁克重回人世，但至少得知真相的父亲会获得宽慰。

I'd given up on the whole investigation, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me! I told the blacksmith about it and we both agreed the same thing must have happened to his son. Of course it won't bring Svatopluk back, but at least his father has some peace of mind from knowing the truth.
我本想放弃这毫无头绪的调查，但事情突然有了转机-黑彼得偷袭了我！我把这件事告诉了铁匠，我们一致认为他的儿子也受到了同样的袭击。这当然不会让斯瓦托普鲁克重回人世，但至少得知真相的父亲会获得宽慰。
I'd given up on the whole investigation into Svatopluk's death, which was leading nowhere, when suddenly things took an unexpected turn - Black Peter ambushed me!
我本想放弃对斯瓦托普鲁克死因毫无头绪的调查，但事情突然有了转机-黑彼得偷袭了我！
I found the footbridge. Now I should go towards the waterworks.
我找到了人行桥。现在我该去水厂了。
I'll go and have a look at the other pools that are up higher.
我去看看更高的地方的池子。
There should be a rocky creek leading from the pools of the waterworks.
水厂的池子连着一条石壑溪流。
I found the rocky stream. Now to follow it up the hill - the cave should be nearby.
我找到了石壑溪流。现在我沿着它上山——洞应该就在附近。
I managed to take Ambrose for the six hundred Groschen he said he had. Maybe he'll finally understand dice could cost him his livelihood.
安布罗斯说她身上有六百块钱，全让我给赢了。也许这下他就能明白赌博害人了吧。

Ambrose boasted he had six hundred Groschen for buying cloth in Kuttenberg. If I can win it all from him, it should teach him quite a lesson. But I need to have at least 1300 Groschen to stay in the game.
安布罗斯吹自己有六百块钱，要到库腾堡进布料。要是把这些钱给输个精光，估计对他来说是个不小的打击。但我需要至少1300块钱来开赌。
Johanka wanted Matthias to take her to the dance, but she was too shy to ask him. I promised to help her and in the end I succeeded. Let's hope it works out for them.
约翰卡想让马蒂亚斯带她去舞会，但她太害羞了，不敢邀请他。我答应帮助她，最后我成功了。希望他们有情人终成眷属。
I promised Johanka I'd persuade Matthias to ask her to the dance, but I haven't done a very good job as a matchmaker. I can only hope fate will intervene to bring them together somehow.
我答应过约翰卡，我会说服马蒂亚斯邀请她参加舞会，但作为一个媒人，我并没有做得很好。我只希望老天能帮点忙，让他们走到一起。
Johanka wants Matthias to take her to the dance, but she's too shy to ask him. I promised to help her. Either I can carry out her plan, or come up with my own.
乔汉卡想让马蒂亚斯带她去舞会，但她太害羞了，不敢邀请他。我答应帮助她。要么我执行她的计划，要么提出我自己的计划。
What a matchmaker I am! I stole Matthias's dice and gave it to Johanka.
我真是个好媒人!我偷了马蒂亚斯的骰子，把它给了乔汉卡。
I didn't manage to steal Matthias' dice.
我没偷成马蒂亚斯的骰子。

Johanka's plan involved stealing Matthias' lucky dice, which he keeps locked up in his trunk when he's not out playing. Once I have it, I've got to bring it to Johanka, so she can blackmail him... that is, prove her love for him.
乔汉卡的计划包括偷马蒂亚斯的幸运骰子，他不玩的时候，他把它锁在他的箱子里。一旦我得手了，就必须把它给乔汉卡，这样她就可以敲诈他……换句话说，证明她对他的爱。

Fritz initiated me into the secrets of lockpicking. He really seems to know what he's doing. And millers are supposed to be dishonest? It seems carpenters aren't much better. Well... I know of one honest carpenter, but he's been dead for centuries.
弗利兹教我开锁的秘诀。他似乎很清楚自己在做什么。磨坊的就该是背信弃义的吗?那木匠也好不到哪里去。嗯…我认识一个诚实的木匠，但他已经死得透透的了。

If I'm to open Matthias' locked trunk without a key, I'll need a lockpick and some advice on how to use it. Like Fritz, for instance. And even if I don't need to get into that trunk now, who knows, a skill like that might come in handy in the future.
要是我没有钥匙开马蒂亚斯箱子，我需要一把开锁钳，需要有人指点我怎么用。比如弗利兹。即使我现在不需要开箱子，但谁知道呢，这样的技能以后可能会派上用场。
If I'm to open Matthias' locked trunk without a key, I'll need a lockpick and someone to advise me how to use it. Like Fritz, for instance.
要是我没有钥匙开马蒂亚斯箱子，我需要一把开锁钳，需要有人指点我怎么用。比如弗利兹。
Thanks to my skill in keeping irate butchers at bay, Sir Hans had time to bring the affair to a satisfactory climax, so to speak. For which he suitably rewarded me.
可以说，汉斯大人得以将这段关系推向令人满意的高潮都要归功于我，我用我高超的技巧拖住了盛怒的屠夫。汉斯大人为此大大地奖赏了我。
I failed. Sir Hans met with Karolina, but the murder I committed in the meantime by her house cast a dark shadow on the whole affair...
我失败了。汉斯大人和卡洛丽娜见面了，但是我与此同时在她家犯下的谋杀为这段关系蒙上了阴影……

Sir Hans met with Karolina as planned, but it didn't turn out quite the way he anticipated. I failed to delay the butcher long enough and he burst in and caught Sir Hans and his daughter "in flagrante". To cut a long story short, His Young Lordship took a proper beating and it's all my fault.
汉斯大人按计划与卡洛丽娜见面了，但是事情并不如预期般发展。我没能长时间拖住屠夫，他闯进屋子，汉斯大人和他的女儿被捉了个现形。长话短说，年轻的领主大人被一顿好打，这都是我的错。

I heard the whole tragic story of Svatopluk's death and enrolled in the tourney myself. Unfortunately, I had to confess to the blacksmith that I couldn't find out anything that would shed light on the murder.
我倾听了斯瓦托普鲁克之死的悲剧始末，亲自参加了比武大会。很不幸，我不得不向铁匠坦白，没能找到关于那起谋杀的任何线索。
I need to find water for Samuel, to drink and to bathe his wounds. Matthew said there should be some in the mine.
我得为塞穆尔找到水，不仅是给他喝，还得给他清理伤口。马修说过矿坑那边应该有一些
I’ve done what Sir Hans asked of me and I'm to visit him in the morning for further instructions.
我已经完成了汉斯大人要求我做的，我要在早上去找他，寻求下一步的指示。
I did what Sir Hans asked of me. Now I should go and see him again.
我已经完成了汉斯大人要求我做的，现在我该去见他了。
Sir Hans was far from pleased with me. Of course, it wasn't the last tourney and I still had a chance to enrol in the next one to make up for it. But I didn't manage that either.
汉斯少主对我相当不满意。好在，比武大会不止这一场-我还有机会参加下一场比赛弥补过失。但我最后还是没去参加比赛。
Old Blaha will know who won the dice tournament. I just have to ask him.
老布拉哈知道谁赢了骰子大奖赛。我只要问问他就行。
I managed to beat young Pechuna and win the tournament.
我设法打败了年轻的佩丘纳，赢得了大奖赛。
I didn't succeed in beating young Pechuna and winning the tournament.
我没能打败年轻的佩丘纳，赢得大奖赛。
To win the dice tournament, I'll have to beat Pechuna.
要赢得骰子大奖赛，我要打败佩丘纳。

As if he weren't already irresistible enough, Sir Hans wants me to get him Musk of Infinite allure from a certain charlatan... that is, a certain learned healer. He believes it will ensure his success with the fair Karolina.
汉斯大人要我给他从某个江湖骗子……某个博学的治疗师那里搞到麝香春药，就好像他的魅力还不够足似的。他认为麝香春药能保证他在卡洛丽娜的事情上大获成功。

Since we let Hagen's brigands get good and drunk before attacking them, some of them weren't even capable of joining in the battle. I sent them to meet their Maker stinking of wine. Alcohol is indeed the scourge of mankind.
我们让哈根的人在受死之前好生逍遥了一番，甚至有些人都醉得无法应战了。我把这帮酒气熏天的醉鬼送到了上帝那里。酒真是人的克星。
The bandits who were too drunk even to join the skirmish have to be taken care of too, before they sober up.
醉得无法应战的土匪也要被处理掉，不能让他们清醒过来。
So I brewed the cure against poisoning, with my own fair hands. That will surely come in handy one day.
所以我开始沏解毒剂，我亲自做。这迟早有用。
That herb woman is a sly old crone, getting me to learn how to brew the potion myself. I hope it will be interesting.
那个采药婆是个狡猾的老太婆，让我学自己沏药。我希望会很有趣。
I killed that so-called fearless fellow. Now there's no one left in Ledetchko to frighten. But I'll have to make up some story for the charlatan. He mustn't connect me with the murder.
我把那所谓的勇士给杀了。现在拉迪亚茨克没有没被吓着的人了。但我还是得在黑商面前编个故事。不能让他知道是我杀的人。
The tourney was cancelled, probably on account of some crime. I'll have to wait a week for the next one.
比武大会被取消了，可能是因为闹出了点儿乱子。我得再等一周了。

Kuno's band took up where the previous uninvited guests had left off and began filling their bellies. It wasn't exactly chivalrous behaviour, but after all, to the victor the spoils! I'd earned a little recreation too, so I joined in the merriment.
库诺的人把那群不速之客喝剩下的酒全都灌进了自己的肚子。这种行为很没有骑士风度，但还是那个道理，胜者为王！我也获得了一点儿休息时间，于是我加入了欢宴。

Once we'd defeated the raiders, Kuno's band took up where the previous uninvited guests had left off and began filling their bellies. Maybe I should point out the error of their ways. Or, I could just join them...
击败袭击者之后，库诺的人把那群不速之客喝剩下的酒全都灌进了自己的肚子。或许我应该指出他们的错误行为。或者去加入他们。
I got too far away from Sir Hans. I'd better get back to him quickly.
我离汉斯大人太远了。我得快点回到他身边去。
I should have done what Sir Anselm said and avoided getting into negotiations with Sir Erhart. I gave myself away and the whole plan fell to pieces.
我就该听安塞尔姆大人的话，避免和厄哈特大人谈判的。我漏洞百出，整个计划都完蛋了。
I managed to avoid getting into negotiations with Sir Erhart and kept him at a safe distance.
我设法避免了和厄哈特大人谈判，和他保持了安全距离。
I'll have to promise the tailor's wife to return the money I win, otherwise she won't agree with my plan.
我得答应裁缝铺老板娘，把赢的钱还给她，不然我们不会达成一致的。
Zbyshek got into a fight and was bleeding. I bandaged up the wound for him.
巴舍克打架了，正流血呢。我为他包扎了伤口。
Zbyshek got into a fight and was bleeding. I didn't help him though. Why should I?
巴舍克打架了，正流血呢。不过我没有帮他。我为什么要帮他呢？
Zbyshek got into a fight and is bleeding. I suppose I ought to help him... A bandage should do it.
巴舍克打架了，正流血呢。我想我该帮帮他……为他找点绷带吧。
I sat down with Ambrose, told him some stories and plied him with alcohol until he drank himself under the table.
我坐到安布罗斯身边，给他讲了几个故事，往死里灌他酒，直到他躺倒在地。
If I don't want to play Ambrose, I could try getting him so drunk that he remembers nothing, then I could take all his money and convince him he lost it all at dice. That ought to teach him a lesson.
要是我不想跟安布罗斯赌博，我可以把他灌得不省人事，然后顺走他身上的钱，再告诉他是酒后赌博败了家。这应该对他是个打击。
I managed to show Ambrose that playing dice costs him more than it gives him. He promised he'd quit playing.
我成功让安布罗斯意识到赌博有害无益。他答应我要戒赌。
I promised the tailor's wife I'd try and get her husband to stop gambling.
我答应裁缝铺老板娘帮她丈夫戒赌。
I must talk to the Sasau tailor's wife, because I promised Johanka I'd help her.
我得跟莎邵裁缝铺老板娘谈谈，我答应过乔汉卡要助她一臂之力。
The blacksmith himself can ask his son how he died. He's gone to join him in the hereafter.
铁匠能自己去问儿子的死因了。父子地下相会去了。
I took Amrbrose's money while he was unconscious, so I can tell him he lost it all at dice.
趁安布罗斯不省人事，我把他的钱给顺走了，现在我就跟他说，是他把钱都给赌光了。
I managed to get Ambrose to drink himself into oblivion! And Ma was always telling me I'd learn nothing useful hanging around in taverns... Now I just have to take his money and that'll be that.
我成功把安布罗斯灌醉了！妈总教育我，在酒馆混是不健康的……我得赶紧拿钱跑路。
The older you get, the worse the hangover, and Ambrose realised he didn't have what it took to carry on like a young buck.
越老酒量越小，安布罗斯意识到了他没法跟个初生牛犊不怕虎的年轻人玩儿命喝。
I have to wait until Ambrose comes round and I can play with his mind and get him to promise he'll quit playing dice.
我得等安布罗斯醒过来，试着说服他，逼他承诺戒赌。
When Ambrose told me what I'd been up to, I swore to myself I'd never touch another drop of booze. Although, once my head stopped pounding, my resolve started to fade a little...
安布罗斯把我出的洋相告诉了我，我发誓再也不沾一滴酒。只是，一旦清醒过来，我的决心就开始动摇了……
That didn't go quite according to plan. It was Ambrose who was supposed to end up under the table, not me. I should ask him what happened yesterday...
计划失败。本来应该是安布罗斯倒下，结果我被撂倒了。我得问问昨天都发生了什么……

An unfortunate choice of words has denied me access to the robber baron's camp. Now no one will believe I'm Sir Alphonse. I'll just have to find some other way of solving the problem. Ideally when everyone's back is turned.
很不幸，我的用词不当让我被强盗贵族的营地拒之门外了。现在没人相信我是阿方斯大人了。我要找个其他办法解决问题就好了。理想的情况是大家都看不到我的时候。

I announced myself officially at the camp entrance and could proceed safely... that is, as safely as I could in a nest of cutthroats. I'd have to watch my step if I didn't want to end up like the real Sir Alphonse.
我正式地在营地入口报上名字，然后就可以安全地进去了……我是说，在一群杀人犯的老巢里能达到的最安全的程度。如果不想落得和真正的阿方斯大人一个下场的话，我还是小心点吧。
Charging headlong into a camp full of nervous, heavily armed brigands probably isn't the wisest strategy. I'd better politely announce my arrival at the "main gate".
不管不顾地一头冲进一个满是全副武装的强盗的营地大概不是最聪明的策略。我还是礼貌地在“正门”报个到吧。
The blacksmith himself can ask his son how he died. He's gone to join him in the hereafter.
铁匠能自己去问儿子的死因了。父子地下相会去了。

Johanka's preaching was very well received. It even convinced one Pavel of Kolin, a merchant, to make amends for a sin that has troubled him for years. To do so, he wanted to recover a stash of Groschen and a dagger he hid away in the woods near Sasau. It was quite a long haul, but in the end I found the place.
乔汉卡的传教反响很好。甚至启发了这位科林的帕瓦尔，补偿他多年挥之不去的罪孽。为了赎罪，他想找回之前藏在莎邵附近树林里的一箱格罗申和一把匕首。真是让我一阵好找，但我终于有所收获。

Johanka's preaching has been very well received. It even convinced one Pavel of Kolin, a merchant, to make amends for a sin that has troubled him for years. To do so, he wants to recover a stash of Groschen and a dagger he hid away in the woods near Sasau. He attempted it himself, but all he has to show for it is some scratches and bruises, so I offered to help. Fortunately he was able to direct me roughly to the hiding place. I'm supposed to start between the Sasau quarry and the marshland at the point where a woodland stream flows into the river. If I follow the stream uphill, I should find a woodland path that joins it. Pavel lost his hat there. If I follow the path closely, it will lead me to an abandoned settlement deep in the woods. The hiding place is in one of the ruins there.

乔汉卡的传教反响很好。甚至启发了这位科林的帕瓦尔，补偿他多年挥之不去的罪孽。为了赎罪，他想找回之前藏在莎邵附近树林里的一箱格罗申和一把匕首。他自己尝试过几次，但最终只是弄得遍体鳞伤便半途而废，我便站了出来。所幸他给了我一些不是很确切的指引，我应该先到莎邵矿场和沼泽地，找到一条流进河流的林间小溪。沿着溪流往山上走，我就会发现一条与溪水相接的林间小路。帕瓦尔就是把帽子丢在了那里。继续小心沿着小路走，我就会来到林子深处一片废弃的废墟钱。财宝就藏在某座废墟里。

Kuno was right about Merhojed. On a routine patrol of the area, we found a freshly torched farm and the attackers even left a message for Sir Radzig - a letter and shield with a coat of arms. Now we knew who we had the honour of dealing with - Sir Hagen of the House of Zoul, an impoverished noble who blames Sir Radzig for the loss of his estates. He even challenged my liege lord to a duel, which Sir Radzig is not inclined to accept.
库诺对莫霍杰德的判断是正确的。在一次巡逻中，我们发现了一个刚刚被付之一炬的农场，袭击者还留下了给拉德季大人的信息 - 一封信和一面印有纹章的盾。我们现在知道我们要对付的是谁了 - 佐尔家族的哈根大人，一位指责拉德季大人使他一无所有的落魄贵族。他甚至向我的领主拉德季大人提出决斗的要求，然而拉德季大人不是很想接受。
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
一旦库诺和他的部队回到营地休息，我们就可以出发进行下一次巡逻任务。

On the way to Uzhitz we came across another testimony to Hagen's campaign of attrition. In the twighlight we ran into a girl who had fled from a nearby mill where Zoul's men were terrorizing her friends. Unfortunately, Kuno hasn't much more chivalry about him than Hagen and showed precious little sympathy for their plight.
去尤兹茨的路上，我们见过了另一位目睹哈根部队作乱的见证人。黄昏时分我们撞见了一个姑娘，她刚从附近的一座农场逃出来，而佐尔的部队在那里绑架了她的朋友。不幸的是，库诺的骑士风度没比哈根博大到哪儿去，没有对于这件事给予关注和同情。
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
一旦库诺和他的部队回到营地休息，我们就可以出发进行下一次巡逻任务。

Our third patrol was not without conflict either. The Zouls ambushed us at a ford near Sasau and caught us entirely off guard. Fortunately, under Kuno's command we fought our way out of the trap and inflicted heavy casualties on the foe. Once we'd gathered our wits, we concluded that someone had betrayed us, and since we'd been acting on information brought by Jakey, and he'd vanished right before the encounter, it didn't take much to figure out who the traitor was.
我们的第三次巡逻也充斥着火药味-佐尔在莎邵附近的一片浅滩上出其不意地偷袭了我们。所幸，在库诺地领导下，我们杀出重围，给予敌人重创。等缓过神来，我们得出结论，定是有人背叛了我们，因为我们所有的行动方针都是按照杰克提供的线索制定的，而他又在遭遇战之前失踪了，叛徒除了他没别人了。
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
一旦库诺和他的部队回到营地休息，我们就可以出发进行下一次巡逻任务。

In the light of recent events, I didn't accompany the band on patrol as usual. Instead, Kuno charged me with a different task - to find Jakey and get him to reveal everything he knew about Hagen. Jakey wasn't too difficult to track down - instead of fleeing while he had the chance, the fool had gone to the Inn in the Glade to spend his thirty pieces of silver. But divine justice intervened, and I found him tied to a tree in the woods, which made interrogating him quite convenient. Among other things, Jakey revealed that Hagen Zoul was planning to lead an attack on Samopesh himself...
鉴于当下的情况，我没有像往常一样和部队一起巡逻。库诺交给了我另一项任务-找到杰克，并让他交代所有与哈根的勾结。杰克并不难找-这个蠢货没抓住逃走的机会开溜，反而是跑到空地酒馆里花掉了三十块银子。但是他终究受到了正义的制裁，我在林子里找到他的时候，他正在被五花大绑地捆在一棵树上，正好方便我审讯他。杰克坦白交代了很多事，其中一点就是哈根·佐尔在计划亲自率兵袭击萨莫培什。
Once Kuno and his band are rested back at the camp, we can set out on another mission.
一旦库诺和他的部队回到营地休息，我们就可以出发进行下一次巡逻任务。
Despite all my efforts, I wasn't able to save my brother. Like the rest of my family in Skalitz, Samuel is gone...
尽管我已经尽力了，但我没法拯救我的弟弟。就像我其他在斯卡里茨的家人一样，塞穆尔也走了……
Samuel's in a bad way. He won't survive without my help. I must find everything I need to treat him.
塞穆尔的情况很糟，如果我不救他，他就不会活下来。我必须找到用来救他的所有材料。
In the woodcutters' camp I found woodcutter Julian still alive amongst the corpses. He was in shock.
我在伐木营的尸海中找到了伐木者雅德米拉，他还活着，但完全吓坏了。
The woodcutters' camp is just below the walls. If anyone survived there, I was too late to help. I found only corpses.
伐木营被墙压着了。即使那有人还活着，我也来晚了。我能找到的只有尸体了。
The woodcutters' camp is just below the walls. I wonder if someone could have survived there?
伐木营被墙压着了。那儿还有人活着吗？
I came across Marosh on the edge of the woods, desperately searching for his betrothed, Pavlena.
我在丛林边找到了莫拉什，正疯狂的找他的未婚妻帕韦纳。
Some of the Skalitz villagers could have fled to the woods, but I found only lifeless bodies.
部分斯卡里茨的村民有可能逃向丛林里了。但我只找到了尸体。
Some of the Skalitz villagers could have fled to the woods. I should go that way and see if anyone survived.
部分斯卡里茨的村民有可能逃向丛林里了。我应该去那随便看看有没有人生还。
I found Jarmila hidden in a hut near the works, terrified out of her wits.
我找到了躲在茅屋的雅德米拉，他完全吓坏了。
In the works near the mines there are lots of places that survivors could hide. But it seems someone got there before I did.
矿洞的这片区域应该有很多地方可供生还者躲藏。看来有人赶在我前面找到他们了。
In the works near the mines there are lots of places that someone could hide. I should search the place carefully.
矿洞的这片区域应该有很多地方可供生还者躲藏。我该仔细搜寻这个地方。
I found Master Potter Stanislav in front of his house.
我在大人波特 斯坦尼斯洛夫房子前面，找到了他。
Someone could have taken cover at the potter's smallholding, but if they did, I'll never know. There were only corpses to be found.
人们原本可以在波特的小农场里躲躲的，但他们去没去，都不得而知了。因为四处可见的只有尸体了。
Someone could have survived at the potter's smallholding, since it was out of the way of the attack.
人们原本可以在波特的小农场躲躲的，因为那里没有受到攻击。

A bathhouse wench came to Johanka and told her that her preaching on the square inspired her to live a more virtuous life. Johanka was pleased and got the idea to try and save more prostitutes. So I set out for Ledetchko, where there was one such wench...
一个澡堂的少女找到乔汉卡跟她说她在广场上的布道激励了她想要过一种正直的生活。乔汉卡很高兴，想到要设法挽救更多的妓女。于是我动身去了拉迪亚茨克，正好那有一个这样的澡堂少女……

A bathhouse wench came to Johanka and told her that her preaching on the square inspired her to live a more virtuous life. Johanka was pleased and got the idea to try and save more prostitutes. By chance, there's one in Ledetchko who might be persuaded.
一个澡堂的少女找到乔汉卡跟她说她在广场上的布道激励了她想要过一种更正直的生活。乔汉卡很高兴，想到要设法挽救更多的妓女。碰巧，拉迪亚茨克正好有一个这样的澡堂少女可能被说服。
I ought to go and see how Johanka is doing. I'm sure she'll be glad to hear I've done penance for my sins.
我应该去看看乔汉卡怎么样了。我相信她会很高兴听到我的忏悔的。

Johanka told me there was just one more sinner who needs saving. I was a bit taken aback when I found out she meant me! She rhymed off a list of my sins that she knew of. It's quite a burden on my soul and to relieve the weight of my transgressions, I set out on a pilgrimage of repentance to Uzhitz.
乔汉卡说还有一个罪人尚未获得救赎。当我听明白她说的那个人就是我的时候，我吃了一惊！她列举了她知道的我的诸多劣迹。我的灵魂感到了沉重的负担，为了从罪孽中解脱出来，我开启了一段去往尤兹茨的忏悔之旅。

Johanka told me there was just one more sinner who needs saving. I was a bit taken aback when I found out she meant me! She rhymed off a list of my sins that she knew of. It's quite a burden on my soul and to relieve the weight of my transgressions, I have to go on a pilgrimage of repentance to Uzhitz.
乔汉卡说还有一个罪人尚未获得救赎。当我听明白她说的那个人就是我的时候，我吃了一惊！她列举了她知道的我的诸多劣迹。我的灵魂感到了沉重的负担，为了从罪孽中解脱出来，我不得不开启了一段去往尤兹茨的忏悔之旅。
To relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I stopped off and prayed at the sacred sites I passed on the way, at least one for each of my sins.
为了使我的灵魂得到解脱，在去往尤兹茨的路上，我得在路过的圣祠祈祷，至少一种罪孽祈祷一次。

Johanka said that to relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I should stop off and pray at the sacred sites I pass on the way, at least one for each of my sins. She doesn't need to know I skipped that though, does she?
乔汉卡说，为了使我的灵魂得到解脱，在去往尤兹茨的路上，我得在路过的圣祠祈祷，至少一种罪孽祈祷一次。她不需要知道我偷懒了，对吧？
Johanka said that to relieve the burden on my soul, on the way to Uzhitz I should stop off and pray at the sacred sites I pass on the way, at least one for each of my sins. Is it really necessary?
乔汉卡说，为了使我的灵魂得到解脱，在去往尤兹茨的路上，我得在路过的圣祠祈祷，至少一种罪孽祈祷一次。这有必要吗？
In the church in Uzhitz I prayed at length to the Virgin Mary to unburden my sinful soul.
在尤兹茨教堂里，我向圣母玛丽祷告了很长时间，以消除我的罪恶。
Once I arrive in Uzhitz I should go to the Marian church there and pray to the Virgin Mary in front of her picture on one of the walls.
一到尤兹茨，我就得去那里的圣母教堂，在她的画像前忏悔。
In Uzhitz I prayed to the Virgin Mary and gave Father Godwin a donation for the church there.
在尤兹茨，我想圣母玛丽祈求过了，也给了古德温捐给当地教堂的善款。
Johanka said I should make some donation to the Uzhitz Church.
乔汉卡说我应该为教堂捐献一些善款。

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He lent me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, in which I could find out more about the matter.
当我把事情的来龙去脉，回来尤兹茨的原因告诉古德温以后，他感到很震撼，尤其是我提到的乔汉卡的那一段。他答应我要给我一本亚诺奥的马修的手稿复制，只不过我没接着调查下去。

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He promised to lend me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, which should cast some light on the matter. I should go and see him when he's found it.
当我把事情的来龙去脉，回来尤兹茨的原因告诉古德温以后，他感到很震撼，尤其是我提到的乔汉卡的那一段。他答应我要给我一本亚诺奥的马修的手稿复制，可能也提到了类似的问题。我得去看看他什么时候能找到。
All that remained was to settle accounts with the raiders, for which I enlisted the help of the whole band. Together, we gave the reprobates the punishment they deserved.
现在只剩下让袭击者血债血偿了，为此我要寻求队伍的支援。我们将同心协力给予这帮袭击者他们应有的惩罚。

All that remained was to settle accounts with the raiders. Kuno and his men would surely be glad to help, but I figured it was best to strike while the iron was hot and deal with them myself. Soon I could return to the rest of the band with the satisfaction that justice had been done.
现在只剩下让袭击者血债血偿了，库诺和他的弟兄们肯定乐意支援，但我觉得最好还是趁热打铁，自己端掉他们。很快我就能带着正义已然得到伸张的好消息回去和队伍会合了。
It seems I've spoken to everyone who's involved in this affair and now I should tell the Bailiff how Josef was poisoned.
看起来我跟所有这件事的有关人员说过话了。现在我应该告诉执政官为何杰瑞会中毒。

While I was looking for the bath wench, I heard a row going on in the bathhouse. I looked into it and found out the bath wench was arguing with a customer and he was putting her in her place in no uncertain terms.
在找那个澡堂妓女的过程中，我听到了澡堂里的争吵。我调查了一番，发现澡堂妓女正在和一个顾客争吵，他二话没说动了手。
There's a noisy row coming from inside the bathhouse. It sounds like some bath wench is having trouble with a customer. I should check it out.
澡堂里传来点儿吵闹声。听上去像是澡堂妓女跟一个顾客起了争执。我得去查看一下。

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? Well, it looked like he'd got a lesson from Maria he'd never forget, so I let him go.
我在杰克被绑着的时候审问了他。他当然是满怀悔恨的检讨了自己。总而言之，我从他嘴里套出了哈根要攻打萨莫培什的计划。现在问题来了，该怎么处理他呢？呃，看起来玛莉亚已经给过他一个刻骨铭心的教训了，所以把他放了吧。

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? I wasn't going to let him escape justice after betraying not only me and Kuno, but also Sir Radzig. So, I took him to the Rattay jailhouse.
我在杰克被绑着的时候审问了他。他当然是满怀悔恨的检讨了自己。总而言之，我从他嘴里套出了哈根要攻打萨莫培什的计划。现在问题来了，该怎么处理他呢？我不能让他在背叛了库诺和拉德季大人后就这么躲开法律的制裁。因此，我把他带到了拉泰监狱。

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? I wasn't going to let him escape justice. The penalty for treachery is death, so I saved the executioner the trouble.
我在杰克被绑着的时候审问了他。他当然是满怀悔恨的检讨了自己。总而言之，我从他嘴里套出了哈根要攻打萨莫培什的计划。现在问题来了，该怎么处理他呢？我不想让他逃离法律的制裁。叛变者，斩立决！所以我替刽子手解决了问题。

I questioned Jakey while he was nicely tied up. Of course he was full of regret and feeling sorry for himself. Anyway, I managed to get out of him that Hagen was intending to attack Samopesh. Then the question was, what to do with him? I wasn't going to let him escape justice. I could drag him all the way to the jailhouse in Rattay, or do the executioner's job myself. On the other hand, it looked like the hand of God had already intervened, and who was I to question that. So I left him tied up. Either someone would rescue him or he'd rot there until the crows got him.
我在杰克被绑着的时候审问了他。他当然是满怀悔恨的检讨了自己。总而言之，我从他嘴里套出了哈根要攻打萨莫培什的计划。现在问题来了，该怎么处理他呢？我不想让他逃离法律的制裁。我可以把他拖到拉泰监狱，或者我自己替刽子手了结他。但上帝已经介入这里了，我无法决断。所以我没把他解绑。也许有人会去救他，也许他会腐烂掉然后被乌鸦吃掉。

I discovered another interesting thing from Jakey: in my absence from the company, Kuno had been complaining a lot about serving Sir Radzig without reward. Jakey passed that information on to Hagen, and Hagen is planning to take advantage of it and try to bribe Kuno. I'd better be prepared for that and try to keep Kuno from falling for the bait.
我从杰克那里发现了另一件有趣的事情：在我不在的时候，库诺已经抱怨了好久拉德季大人不给报酬的事情了。杰克把这个讯息告诉了哈根，哈根正计划这借此贿赂库诺。我得准备好，防止库诺见财起意。
I got hold of a bow, just in case we do run into any wolf.
我带上了一把弓，以防有狼出没。
I didn't bother getting that bow before we left. That talk about a wolf is surely nonsense anyway.
我没带弓就出发了。关于狼的传说定是胡说八道。
If we do actually run into that wolf, it's better to have a bow than be empty-handed.
要是遇见狼了，手里有弓总要好过赤手空拳。
I got arrows. A bow's no good without them...
我拿到了几支箭。光有弓没箭可不行。
A bow needs arrows, but I didn't manage to get very many.
有弓必有箭，但我搞到的箭不多。
A bow without arrows is about as much use as a cart without wheels.
没有箭的弓，就像那没轮子的车。
On the way, we came across a magpie's nest. Bianca had seen the bird carrying something shiny there. I knocked it down from the tree and looked inside. There was a ring there!
我们在路上见到了一只喜鹊的巢。比安卡看到喜鹊叼着一个亮闪闪的东西。我把鹊巢从树上打了下来，里面有个戒指！
On the way, we came across a magpie's nest. Bianca had seen the bird carrying something shiny there. If I can somehow get the nest down, we can see what's in it.
我们在路上见到了一只喜鹊的巢。比安卡看到喜鹊叼着一个亮闪闪的东西。要是能把鹊巢打下来，我们就能看到那是什么东西。

I talked to Johanka and she gave me quite a telling off about my deeds. She wanted me to go on a pilgrimage of penance to the Marian church in Uzhitz and pray for forgiveness for my sins. Johanka was right - I did have a thing or two on my conscience, so I did as she asked.
我和乔汉卡谈过，她对我的行为大加指责。她想让我去尤兹茨的玛丽安教堂朝圣赎罪，为我的罪祈求宽恕。乔汉卡说得对——我确实有点良心不安，所以我照她说的做了。

I talked to Johanka and she gave me quite a telling off about my deeds. She wants me to go on a pilgrimage of penance to the Marian church in Uzhitz and pray for forgiveness for my sins. Johanka is right - I have a thing or two on my conscience and I should do as she says.
我和乔汉卡谈过，她对我的行为大加指责。她想让我去尤兹茨的玛丽安教堂朝圣赎罪，为我的罪祈求宽恕。乔汉卡说得对——我确实有点良心不安，所以我应该照她说的做。

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He wanted me to find a copy of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow that he has somewhere at the presbytery, which cast some light on Marian visitations.
我把造访尤兹茨的来由告诉了古德温，他对此感到无比惊讶，尤其是我提到乔汉卡的时候。他想让我找到一位名叫雅诺的马修撰写的手稿复件，这卷记载着圣母现世异闻的手稿就存在神邸的某处。

When I told Godwin the whole story of what had brought me to Uzhitz, it made quite an impression on him, especially what I said about Johanka. He promised to lend me a copy he'd made of a manuscript by Matthew of Janow, which cast some light on Marian visitations. Unfortunately, he wasn't able to find it. I can go to the presbytery and see if I can find it myself.
我把造访尤兹茨的来由告诉了古德温，他对此感到无比惊讶，尤其是我提到乔汉卡的时候。他想借给我一位名叫雅诺的马修撰写的手稿复件，上面记载着圣母现世的异闻。很不幸，他没找到。我可以自己去神邸找找。
At the eastern mineshaft I ran into Fritz and Matthew.
我在东部矿井遇到了弗利兹和马修。
Most of the material is carried through the eastern mineshaft. Samuel could be somewhere around there.
大部分材料是通过东部矿井运输的。塞穆尔可能就在附近。
The southern entrance has caved in. No one could get in or out through there.
南边的入口塌陷了。没有人能从那里进出。
Samuel could be hiding somewhere near the southern entrance to the mine. I should check it out.
塞穆尔可能藏在矿井南面入口附近。我应该去看看。
The western mineshaft is occupied by the attackers. Even if Samuel is there, I'll have to find another way in.
西边的矿井被袭击者占领了。即使塞穆尔在那里，我也得想办法进去。
Samuel might be hiding in the western part of the mine by the Wenceslas shaft.
塞缪尔可能藏在西边的瓦茨拉夫矿井附近。
I managed to get out of the clutches of the attackers and barricade myself inside the house, then I fled.
我设法摆脱了袭击者的控制，把自己锁在屋里，然后逃走了。
I managed to get out of the clutches of the attackers and barricade myself inside the house. But now I have to find a way out and get as far away from them as I can.
我设法摆脱了袭击者的控制，把自己关在屋里。但是现在我必须找到一条出路，尽可能地远离他们。
At the mouth of the cave.
I learned to read and it wasn't half as much of an ordeal as I expected. Now I should go and see what Sir Hans wants me to do.
我学会了阅读，但这还没有我预想的一半困难。我现在得去看看汉斯大人想让我做什么
Johanka was to go and speak on the market square in the morning, and she wants me to go with her. I should pick her up at the infirmary first thing tomorrow.
乔汉卡早上要去市场上发言，她想要我和她一起去。我一大早就要去疗养院接她。
Pa has nails ordered from the blacksmith and he sent me to pick them up. The forge is right below the castle.
爸爸从铁匠那里订了些钉子，他派我去取一下。铁匠铺就在城堡下面
As usual, Zbyshek was in no hurry to get to work, but I managed to talk him into it.
像往常一样，巴舍克赖着不想去工作，但我成功地让他去了
As usual, Zbyshek is in no hurry to get to work, and there's nothing I can do about it. Pa will just have to deal with that idler himself.
像往常一样，巴舍克赖着不想去工作，而我真的无计可施。看来爸爸要自己去处理这个懒虫了
As usual, Zbyshek is in no hurry to get to work. Pa wants me to chase him.
像往常一样，巴舍克赖着不想去工作。爸爸让我去催他
Samuel wasn't keen to get out of bed this morning, but I woke him and sent him on his way. He already has the reputation of an idler, and arriving late certainly won't help.
看起来今早塞穆尔不是很想起床，但我把他叫起来了并把他送走了。他已经被大家看作是一个懒虫了，迟到的话就更糟了
Samuel was still sleeping when I left. I didn't wake him, so I hope he gets up on time for work. The foreman has already been complaining about him.
我走的时候塞穆尔还在睡。我没叫醒他，所以我希望他能自己按时起来。工头已经在抱怨他老迟到了
Samuel is still sleeping and he should already be on his way to work at the mines. I'd better go and wake him so he doesn't get into trouble. Again.
他现在应该已经在矿上工作了，但塞穆尔依然再睡觉。我最好去叫醒他这样他就不会又有麻烦了
Pa sent me to the blacksmith to pick up some nails he had ordered, but there's no one at the forge. I should ask the blacksmith's wife if she knows anything.
爸爸从铁匠那里订了些钉子，他派我去取一下，但铁匠铺并没有人。我得去问问铁匠的妻子，看看她知不知道

Papa has nails ordered from the blacksmith, Martin. But he wasn't at the forge when I went there. He's at the castle, talking to Sir Radzig about the sword he's forging for him. I told Papa the nails wouldn't be done until tomorrow.
爸爸从铁匠马丁那里订了钉子。但我去了铁匠铺，他并没有在那里。他去了城堡里面，在和拉德季大人谈论那把给他铸的剑。我告诉了爸爸那些钉子得明天才能做好

Papa has nails ordered from the blacksmith, Martin. But he wasn't at the forge when I went there. He's at the castle, talking to Sir Radzig about the sword he's forging for him. I should tell Papa the nails won't be done until tomorrow.
爸爸从铁匠马丁那里订了钉子。但我去了铁匠铺，他并没有在那里。他去了城堡里面，在和拉德季大人谈论那把给他铸的剑。我得告诉爸爸那些钉子得明天才能做好
In front of the mine entrance
Or I could tell the Custodian about it. After all, why should I get my hands dirty when it's his job to keep the peace around the monastery?
或者我可以告诉官员，毕竟他的工作是维持修道院周围的安宁。何必弄脏自己的手呢?

Brother Nicodemus was concerned that Johanka might criticise the Church when she spoke in court, which would make things even worse for her. I managed to see her and tried to talk some sense into her, but to no avail. She's obstinately insisting that she has a duty to say what Our Lady tells her.
尼可丹姆斯修士担心乔汉卡在法庭上批判教会，这将使她的处境更加糟糕。我设法见到了她想劝她讲点道理，但没用。她固执地认为她有责任把圣母玛利亚告诉她的话说出来。

Brother Nicodemus is concerned that Johanka might criticise the Church when she speaks in court, which would make things even worse for her. I wanted to try to talk some sense into her, but I couldn't, because the Inquisitor wouldn't allow anyone in to see her.
尼可丹姆斯修士担心乔汉卡在法庭上批判教会，这将使她的处境更加糟糕。我必须设法说服她，但审判者不允许任何人进去看她，所以我得想个办法。

Brother Nicodemus is concerned that Johanka might criticise the Church when she speaks in court, which would make things even worse for her. I must try and talk some sense into her, but the Inquisitor won't allow anyone in to see her, so I'll have to think something up. And proceed very cautiously.
尼可丹姆斯修士担心乔汉卡在法庭上批判教会，这将使她的处境更加糟糕。我必须设法说服她，但审判者不允许任何人进去看她，所以我得想个办法。小心行事。

I managed to get to Johanka to talk to her, but she's still obstinately insisting that she can only say what the Virgin Mary directs her to say. I wanted to tell Brother Nicodemus about it, but I didn't have time. I'll just have to hope for the best.
我设法找到乔汉卡和她说话，但她坚持说只说圣母玛利亚让她说的话。我想把这件事告诉尼可丹姆斯修士，但我没有时间。我只能听天由命了。
I tried my best and that's all I can do. I'd better go and tell Brother Nicodemus about it.
我已经尽力了。我还是去告诉尼可丹姆斯修士吧。

Johanka is very obstinate and won't change her mind. I told Brother Nicodemus and he's worried that Johanka will come to a bad end if I can't convince her. He asked about her parents, but unfortunately they're gone. She still has some loved ones from Skalitz here though...
乔汉卡很固执，她不会改变主意的。我告诉了尼可丹姆斯修士，他担心如果我不能说服她，乔汉卡就不会有好下场。他问起她的父母，但不幸的是他们都去世了。她还有一些来自斯卡里茨的亲人……
Johanka set off in the morning to the market square to pass on the Virgin Mary's message to the people.
乔汉卡早上就出发去市场上帮圣母玛利亚给人们送信去了。

Johanka is convinced the Virgin Mary visited her and tasked her with passing on her message to the people. She's wanted to go and preach on the market square in the morning and asked me to accompany her, which I didn't do.
乔汉卡相信圣母玛利亚见她，派给她给人们传递消息的任务。她想早上去市场上宣扬此事，要我陪她去，但我不肯。

Johanka is convinced the Virgin Mary visited her and tasked her with passing on her message to the people. She's going to go and preach on the market square in the morning and asked me to accompany her.
乔汉卡相信圣母玛利亚见她，派给她给人们传递消息的任务。她想早上去市场上宣扬此事，要我陪她去。
Johanka is very upset about the tragedy that befell Ambrose and Guta. She asked me to come and see her tomorrow to help her with something.
乔汉卡对发生在安布洛斯和古塔身上的悲剧感到非常难过。她让我明天去看她，帮她做点事。
Johanka is very upset about the tragedy that befell Ambrose and Guta. She asked me to come and see her tomorrow to help her with something.
乔汉卡对发生在安布洛斯和古塔身上的悲剧感到非常难过。她让我明天去看她，帮她做点事。
I decided to intervene and save Adela from the violent customer.
我决定趟这摊浑水，把阿黛拉从那暴力的嫖客手中救出来。
It seems the prostitute is getting some rough treatment from a customer, but that's none of my business. If I wait until tomorrow, I'll be able to talk to her in peace and quiet.
看上去是有个客人在欺负我要找的那个妓女，但他们之间的摩擦与我无关。等到第二天，再去找她踏踏实实地谈。
I should tell Johanka how I handled that matter for Pavel of Kolin.
我应该告诉乔汉卡我是如何为科林的帕瓦尔处理这件事的。
Kuno of Rychwald is dead. Now his band will probably fall apart and that will be the end of the campaign against the Zouls. I should report the tragic news to Sir Radzig.
赖瓦尔德的库诺死了。他的部队四分五裂，讨伐佐尔的计划就此破产。我得把这个坏消息汇报给拉德季大人。
Jarmila was afraid to leave her hiding place and flee, but in the end she agreed.
雅德米拉不敢离开她的藏身之所逃跑，但最终她答应逃走。
Jarmila was afraid to leave her hiding place and flee. There was nothing I could do for her.
雅德米拉不敢离开她的藏身之所逃跑。我对此无能为力。
Jarmila is afraid to go. I have to persuade her somehow.
雅德米拉不敢逃跑，我得设法说服她。
Tinker caught wind of something and ran ahead. He led me to a wounded miner. I should look around for other survivors.
叮叮貌似发现了什么，它带我找到了一个受伤的矿工，我应该看看这周围有没有别的幸存者
Tinker caught wind of something and ran ahead. Was he showing me the way? Maybe he heard some survivors, but I found some without him too. I could look around for more.
叮叮貌似发现了什么，它在给我带路么？也许它听见了幸存者的声音，但我自己也能找到幸存者，我得再在这边看看
Tinker caught wind of something and ran ahead. Is he showing me the way? I should go where he leads me.
叮叮貌似发现了什么，它在给我带路么？我应该跟着它走
Holba needed to have his injured leg treated so he could make it to Talmberg. Fortunately, I know a little about healing and I was able to help him.
赫尔巴的伤腿急需医治，他好了才能去塔尔木堡。幸好我懂点医术，能帮帮他。
Holba needed to have his injured leg treated so he could make it to Talmberg. But I wasn't able to do it.
赫尔巴的伤腿急需医治，他好了才能去塔尔木堡。可惜我不会医术。
Holba needs to have his injured leg treated so he can make it to Talmberg.
赫尔巴的伤腿急需医治，他好了才能去塔尔木堡。
Holba needed to have his injured leg treated so he could make it to Talmberg. I wasn't able to do it, but at least I got him some bandages. That should help him manage the journey.
赫尔巴的伤腿急需医治，他好了才能去塔尔木堡。我不会医术，但我可以给他点绷带。或许可以让他勉强撑过旅途。
Holba needed to have his injured leg treated so he could make it to Talmberg. I wasn't able to do it, or even get him some bandages.
赫尔巴的伤腿急需医治，他好了才能去塔尔木堡。我不会医术，连绷带都没有。
Holba needs to have his injured leg treated so he can make it to Talmberg. I can't do that, but at least I can get him some bandages.
赫尔巴的伤腿急需医治，他好了才能去塔尔木堡。我不会医术，但至少我可以给他点绷带。

"How love turned to bloodshed. Once there was a knight who, though upright and noble-looking, had a prickly, unapproachable appearance. He fell in love with a fragile young maid, whom he saw with her sisters in a field, all wearing bright red wimples. But he was afraid his prickly exterior would frighten her, so he asked the advice of another knight, a pious and learned crusader, who carried the name of the patron saint of his order with pride. The pious knight told him he would arrange a rendezvous with the maid, all three would drink wine together by the river and he would help his friend to get acquainted with her. This they did, but the maid fell in love instead with the pious knight. The stern knight was enraged and challenged his rival to a duel. The two fought long and fiercely, but they were equally matched, and so in the end they both fell, mortally wounded. Anguished at the tragedy her beauty had caused, the young maid took a dagger from one of the knights and plunged it into her own heart. Their bodies lay together on the ground, and the blood flowed from them into the river, turning the waters crimson." The charlatan says I have to figure out from the fable the names of the three herbs for the potion, which I have to grind and brew together for one turn.

血溅情场。从前有个骑士，尽管身材高大、气度不凡，却有一副凶神恶煞、难以接近的外表。他爱上了一位娇弱的少女，他见到她时，少女正和姐妹们一道在田野里，所有姑娘都包着红头巾。但他生怕自己可怕的外表会吓到她，因此他求助于另外一位骑士。那位骑士是个虔诚而干练的十字军，为他所肩负的教团守护神之名感到光荣。这位虔诚的骑士告诉他，他将邀请这位少女参加约会，三人一同在河边把酒言欢，而他会把他的朋友介绍给那位姑娘。事情就成了，但少女却爱上了那位虔诚的骑士。那位相貌丑陋的骑士为此大发雷霆，在决斗中挑战他的情敌。两位骑士经历一场鏖战，结果势均力敌，双双倒下，均受了致命之伤。为其美貌所引发的灾难而悲痛欲绝的少女，从一位骑士身上寻来一把匕首，刺入了自己的心脏。他们的尸体齐躺在地上，鲜血流失，淌入河中，染红了河水。“黑商说我须得从这段寓言中找出用于熬制药剂的三种草药的名字，找到原料之后，将它们碾碎并一起熬煎一轮即可。
Julian was so dazed with fear, he paid no attention to me. But in the end I got through to him and convinced him to flee to Talmberg.
朱利安被吓傻了，他看都不看我。但最终我还是说服他逃去塔尔木堡了。
Julian was so dazed with fear, he paid no attention to me and I couldn't get through to him.
朱利安被吓傻了，他看都不看我，根本说不通他。
Julian is so dazed with fear, he pays no attention to me. I have to try and get through to him and convince him to flee to Talmberg.
朱利安被吓傻了，他看都不看我。我必须试着跟他交流，说服他逃到塔尔木堡去。
Stanislav refused to leave until he recovered his money from his house. I managed to get inside and find it for him.
没拿回房子里的钱，斯坦尼斯洛夫就不走。我想办法进了房子并帮他找到了。
Stanislav refused to leave until he recovered his money from his house. The problem was he lost his key while fleeing and I couldn't do anything about it.
除非拿回房子里的钱了，不然斯坦尼斯洛夫是绝不会走的。问题是他逃跑的时候弄丢了钥匙，这事我可没法子解决。
Stanislav refuses to leave until he recovers his money from his house, which he says he hid in the bottom of a sack of apples. The problem is he lost his key while fleeing and can't open the door.
除非拿回房子里的钱了，不然斯坦尼斯洛夫是绝不会走的。他说就在一袋苹果的下面。问题是他逃跑的时候弄丢了钥匙，这事我可没法子解决。
Marosh doesn't want to go anywhere without Pavlena and I couldn't help him with his search.
没有帕韦纳，莫拉什哪都不去，我不能帮他找未婚妻。
Marosh won't leave without Pavlena. If I help him find her, maybe he'll go somewhere safer. He told me Pavlena was wearing a blue dress and a white headscarf.
没找到帕韦纳，莫拉什是绝不会离开的。要是我帮他找到她，或许他就愿意去安全的地方了。他告诉我帕韦纳穿着蓝裙子，围着白头巾。
I found a wounded miner, Holba, near the mineshafts on the hill.
我在山丘上的矿洞附近，发现了一个受伤的矿工，赫尔巴。
There could be miners hiding around the mineshafts on the hill. I didn't find anyone alive though.
矿工们有可能躲在山丘上的矿洞附近，但我没见到一个活人。
There could be miners hiding around the mineshafts on the hill. Me and Tinker should take a look around there.
矿工们可能躲在山丘上的矿洞附近，我和丁丁该在这附近找找。
Sadly, Pavlena lost her life and Marosh finally agreed to leave. May God go with him.
不幸的是，帕韦纳死了，莫拉什终于同意离开了。愿上帝保佑他。
Marosh didn't want to go anywhere without Pavlena. I couldn't persuade him otherwise or do anything to help.
没有帕韦纳，莫拉什哪都不去。我即劝不了他也帮不了他。
Sadly, Pavlena lost her life. I'd better break the bad news to Marosh.
不幸的是，帕韦纳死了。我最好还是把这坏消息告诉莫拉什吧。
I found Stanislav's hidden money, but before I could give it to him, we were ambushed by a footpad. Fortunately, I managed to save both Stanislav and his precious Groschen.
我找到了斯坦尼斯洛夫的钱，但还没到他手上，就被强盗打劫了。所幸，我夺回了钱袋还救了他的小命。
I found Stanislav's hidden money, but before I could give it to him, we were ambushed by a footpad. It didn't end well...
我找到了斯坦尼斯洛夫的钱，但还没到他手上，就被强盗打劫了。事情变得很糟糕…
I found Stanislav's hidden coin. I should take it to him.
我找到了斯坦尼斯洛夫的钱，我该拿给他。
I tried again to talk sense into Johanka and gave her the dice from Matthias. I don't know whether it helped, but there was nothing more I could do.
我又试着跟乔汉卡讲道理，然后把马蒂亚斯的骰子给了她。我不知道这有没有用，但我实在没办法了。
